loans.name: Renilda

texts.en: Renilda is 43 years old, single, runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Renilda has been in her current line of work for two years and sells a variety of items such as snacks, canned goods and other groceries. Her goal for the future is to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Dina Luz

texts.es: Dina es residente en un barrio ubicado al sur occidente de Barranquilla, desde muy niña trabajo con su mamá en un restaurante de su propiedad, quien años mas tarde decidió cedérselo, por lo que ella estuvo dedicada durante muchos años a esta actividad. En la actualidad Dina encontró en la venta de camisas, pantalones y artículos de marroquinería una mejor elección para trabajar y tener una mejor calidad de vida; puesto que estar a cargo de un restaurante requiere de más dedicación y tiempo, el cual es muy valioso y no podía dedicárselo a su familia. Sus principales clientes son los compañeros de trabajo de su cónyuge, sus vecinos y amigos, a quienes les brinda facilidad de pago, ella esta dispuesta a ofrecer sus productos en el horario de 10:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m. todos los días.  Sus compra las realiza de contado a mayoristas ubicados en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo mediante el cual invertirá en compra de ropa y calzado con la finalidad de aprovechar las fiestas decembrinas, así mismo realizará adecuaciones al local para tener una imagen mas llamativa. Dina desea que sus hijos reciban su grado de bachilleres y seguirles ayudando para que sigan progresando,  por eso su gran desafío es trabajar con compromiso y dedicación.
texts.en: Dina is a resident of a neighborhood located in the southeast of Barranquilla. Beginning when she was a very young girl, she worked with her mother in a restaurant on their property. Many years later her mother decided to close it, however, Dina spent many years devoted to that activity. Currently, Dina can be found selling shirts, pants and leather items which is a better choice for work and leads to a better quality of life because being in charge of a restaurant requires more dedication and time which is very valuable to her and which she could not otherwise spend with her family. Her primary customers are her friends from her spouse's work, her neighbors and her friends who find it simple to purchase from her. DIna offers her products from 10:00am to 4:00pm every day. She completes her purchases from wholesalers located in the center of the city of Barranquilla in cash. Because of this situation she is currently applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will invest the loan in the purchase of clothing and footwear with the goal of taking advantage of the December holidays. Likewise, she will also make adjustments to her sales site to make it have a more striking appearance. Dina desires that her children receive their college diplomas and she continues to help them get ahead so they can continue to progress. Because of this situation her greatest challenge is to continuously work with commitment and dedication.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and footwear that is suitable for her location.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Asuncion works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tailoring. Asuncion is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more fruit to sell to her customers for her fruit vending business.

Asuncion has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell to her customers

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is 47 years old and has six children. Benigna is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Benigna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Benigna requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs.

Benigna has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

Benigna would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Lelani

texts.en:
Lelani is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Lelani has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lelani requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Lelani has been in this business for five years. In the future, Lelani would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Charito is 49 years old, married and has three children, one of whom is still in school. She works in livestock, raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Charito has been in her current line of work for many years, and has taken out and repaid three prior loans from NWTF. Her goal for the future is to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en: Mary Jean is 23 years old, married and the mother of three children, one of whom is in school, She works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell. She has been in her current line of work for two years and would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional household goods to sell.

loans.name: Zulhumor

texts.ru:
Зулхумор женщина 55 лет ,замужем мать пятерых детей . Она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и с раннего детства работала на поле ,собирала овощи и фрукты ,ухаживала за домашним скотом,помогала родителям . Зулхумор не имела возможности получить высшее образование.Она осталось в своём селе и продолжила заниматься животноводством . Вот уже 35 лет Зулхумор на своем участке земли ухаживает за скотом.Все её дети давно выросли ,2 сына живут с ней ,поэтому её невестки помогают ей пасти стадо , доить коров.Несмотря на возраст Зулхумор с раннего утра уже на поле , собирает урожай,кормит скот.
Зулхумор берёт кредит,чтобы закупить корм для скота на зиму.Но она не имеет полной суммы . Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Зулхумор заранее выражает свою благодарность МДО Арванд за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Zulhumor is a woman of 55 years, married, and the mother of five children. She was born and grew up in a village. From early childhood she worked in the field, gathering vegetables and fruits, taking care of the livestock and helping her parents. Zulhumor did not have the opportunity to get higher education. She stayed in her village and continued working with livestock breeding. 

For 35 years Zulhumor has taken care of livestock on her own plot of land. All her children are adults long ago. Two of her sons live with her and therefore her grandchildren help her to shepherd the flock and milk the cows. Despite her age, Zulhumor works in the field from early morning, harvesting and feeding the livestock. 

Zulhumor takes a loan in order to purchase fodder for the livestock for the winter. She does not have enough for the full amount herself. Therefore she turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. Zulhumor extends her thanks to "MDO Arvad" in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder for the winter

loans.name: María Bernalda

texts.es:
María de 39 años de edad, es ama de casa y no estudio debido a la pobreza en que vivían sus padres pues solo ganaban para tener un poco de alimentación diaria, ahora ella esta acompañada y es madre de 4 hijos de 20, 18, 13 y 9 años de edad, de los cuales 2 de ellos se encuentran estudiando son los que dependen de ella y el otro trabaja para ayudarle a sus padres en los gastos de la casa, su esposo no trabaja ya que él está pensionado mientras que María se dedica al cuido de sus animales desde hace 4 años, trabajo que lo aprendió de su compañero de vida quien se dedicaba a esto, para llegar a su trabajo María viaja en bicicleta 1 kilómetro trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm todos los días.

El préstamo que está solicitando en credicampo es para terminar de pagar los gastos médicos ya que uno de sus hijos estaba muy enfermito y no tenían los recursos económicos suficientes para cancelarlos.

El sueño de María es comprar más animales, pues siendo así podrá obtener más ingresos para darle a su familia lo mejor.
texts.en:
María is 39 years old. She is a housewife and did not go to school because of the poverty in which her parents lived; they always earned enough to have a little bit to eat every day. Now she is married and is mother to four children who are 20, 18, 13, and 9 years old. Two of them are currently in school. They are the ones who depend on her. Another works to help her and her parents with the household expenses. Her husband does not work because he is retired. 

María has worked taking care of animals for four years. She learned this work from her life companion, who used to do that work. To get to work, María travels by bicycle for one kilometer, working a 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. schedule every day. The loan that she is requesting from CrediCampo is to finish paying off medical expenses, as one of her children was very sick, and they did not have sufficient economic resources to pay the bills.

María's dream is to buy more animals, since then she would be able to obtain more income to give her family the best.

loans.use: to finish paying for medical expenses, as one of her children was very sick and they didn't have sufficient financial resources to pay the bills.

loans.name: Santos Aparicio

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su señora esposa y tres hijos, de 8, 5 y 2 años de edad, en su hogar Santos es la única persona que genera ingresos para subsistir, es propietario de una tienda de productos básicos desde hace 2 años, lo inicio por motivación propia, su mamá le ayuda a tender el negocio cuando realiza otras actividades.
EL financiamiento le será de utilidad para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, golosinas, pan, etc., con los que cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes, espera estar preparado para la época de fin de año, ya que las ventas son mayores.
Sus propósitos son lograr mejorar económicamente y dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de superarse académicamente.
texts.en:
Santos lives in his home with his wife and three children who are eight, five and two-years-old. He is the only person that earns an income in order to support their livelihood. He has been the owner of a general store for two years, which he started by himself. His mother helps him tend to the business when he is doing other work. 

The financing will be used to buy grains, beverages, candies, bread, etc., with which he will meet the needs of his customers. He hopes to be prepared for the end of the year, as sales are higher then. 

His goals are to improve financially and to give his children the opportunity to succeed academically.

loans.use: to buy grains, beverages, candies, bread, etc. to meet his customers’ needs

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 69 years old with four children.  Estela personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.  Since she became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost three years. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 6,000.00 for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, they have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors, so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase of new nets

location.town: Dipolog-San Pedro, Dapitan City, Zambo.Del Norte

loans.name: Abdumurot

texts.ru: Абдумурот мужчина 40 лет , женат ,отец четверых детей. Он на протяжении всей своей жизни занимается животноводством.С юных лет он помогал родителям ухаживать за скотом,теперь на своем участке земли Абдумурот ухаживает за 10  баранами и пятью коровами.В его делах помогает ему жена и внук.Каждое утро жена Абдумурота доет коров и сама относит молоко на рынок для продажи . Абдумурот берёт кредит,чтобы закупить корм для скота на зиму,но у него нет полной суммы. Поэтому он обратился за финансовой поддержкой в МДО Арванд. Он надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу и помощи и выделит нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Abdumurot is a man of the age of 40. He is married and the father of four children. His whole life he has worked with livestock breeding. From a young age, he helped his parents taking care of the livestock. Curently he takes care of ten rams and five cows on his own plot of land. His wife and grandchild help him with his business. Every morning, Abdumurot's wife milks the cows and takes the milk to the market for selling. 

Abdumurot takes a loan in order to purhcase fodder for the cattle for the winter. He does not have the full amount himself. Therefore he turned for financial support from "MDO Arvand". He hopes that "MDO Arvand" will respond to his request and help him by giving him the necessary amount. He thanks in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder for the winter

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita works hard to support her family. Pacita is married and has a vegetable-farming business in the Philippines.

Pacita requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Pacita has been in this business for 32 years now.

Pacita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Peloche

texts.en:
Peloche is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Peloche is 39 years old and has three children who are in school.

Peloche has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines. Peloche requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Peloche has been in this business for five years. In the future, Peloche would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 57 years old and married with four children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She has been running a general store for 20 years and also earns an income from raising livestock in the Philippines.  Nelia has requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Nelia has borrowed and repaid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Claire is 33 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Claire has a food vending business in the Philippines. Claire requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her food production business.

Claire has been in this business for three years. In the future, Claire would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients and materials for her food production business

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is 63 years old and married with two children.  

Eleuteria is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Eleuteria requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Eleuteria has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain this. 

In the future, Eleuteria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Yenira Esperanza

texts.es:
Yenira Esperanza tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región, Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Yenira Esperanza se dedica a la venta de champú, cachangas, papas rellenas etc, desde hace 11 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la puerta del mercado de abasto de Oyotún, ella solicita préstamo para activo fijo; pues desea realizar la compra de calamina para el techo de su casa, puesya se acercan las temporadas de lluvias y Yenira Esperanza desea ofrecerles seguridad y comodidad a su familia, mejorando de esta forma su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yenira Esperanza is 38 years old. She lives with her son in the Oyotun district, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock. It is located in the Chiclayo province, which belongs to the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru.

For the past 11 years, Yenira Esperanza has made a living selling champu (a drink made from maize, pineapple, and other ingredients), cachangas (a type of flat bread), stuffed potatoes, etc. Her business is located at the door of the wholesale food market in Oyotun.

She is requesting a loan for a fixed asset; she wishes to buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof of her house, since the rainy season is approaching. Yenira Esperanza desires to give her family safety and comfort and therefore improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheets for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Ercelliana

texts.en:
Ercelliana is 59 years old, married and has six children, one of whom is still in school.

Ercelliana is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

Ercelliana requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Ercelliana has been in pig fattening for 5 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ercelliana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ma. Cristina

texts.en:
Ma. Cristina is 38 years old and is married with five children.  She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a direct selling Avon products in the Philippines and has been running the direct selling avon products for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice.  She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of Avon products to sell.

Ma. Cristina has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of Avon products to sell

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 55 years old and is married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines.  Estrella has been farming vegetables for 5 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

She has successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.  Estrella is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. 

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Flordelona

texts.en:
Flordelona is 45 years old, married and has four children, three children of whom are currently in school.

Flordelona is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her chickens.  Flordelona has been raising chickens for 9 years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her chickens

loans.name: José Juan

texts.es:
José de 36 años de edad, solo estudio quinto grado en la escuela de la comunidad, lastimosamente no continuo sus estudios porque se dedico a ayudar a su padre a trabajar para llevar el sustento a su casa. Actualmente vive con sus padres aun esta soltero y no tiene hijos.

Él es empleado y se levanta a las 5:00 am todos los días para ir a su trabajo porque le queda lejos, él trabaja en una granja. 

El préstamo lo necesita para mejorar la vivienda y comprara arena, tierra blanca, hierro y cemento. En un futuro sueña con formar una familia y darles todo lo que este a su alcance.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old, and he only studied until the 5th grade in the community school. Unfortunately he did not continue his studies because he dedicated himself to helping his father work in order to bring the daily bread to their home. He currently lives with his parents. He is still single, and has no children.

He has a job, and he wakes up at 5:00 am every day to go to work, since it is located far away. He works on a farm. 

The loan is being requested in order to improve his home, and buy sand, white adobe, iron and cement. In the future, he dreams of forming a family and giving them everything within his power.

loans.use: to buy sand, white adobe, iron and cement to improve his home.

loans.name: Soli

texts.ru: Соли мужчина 35 лет , женат , отец троих детей . Он вырос в сельской местности и с детства помогал родителям по дому,на поле , ухаживал за скотом,собирал урожай. У его родителей не было средств ,чтобы дать ему высшее образование,поэтому после женитьбы Соли продолжил заниматься животноводством.Сейчас он имеет свой участок земли ,где ухаживает за скотом.У него 15 голов баранов . Он откармливает их и продаёт . Соли работает не покладая рук,чтобы обеспечить своим детям светлое будущее ,чтобы иметь возможность обучить их и дать им хорошее образование. Соли берёт кредит,что купить одного барана и увеличить поголовье своего скота.Но он не имеет нужной суммы.Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Соли надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Soli is a man of the age of 35. He is married and the father of three children. He grew up in a village, and since childhood he helped his parents in the house and in the field, taking care of the livestock and gathering the harvest. His parents did not have enough money to give him higher education. Therefore Soli continued working with livestock breeding after getting married.

Currently, Soli has his own plot on land, on which he takes care of the livestock. He has five rams. He fattens them and then sells them. Soli works tirelessly in order to provide his children with a bright future and to have the opportunity to raise them and give them a good education. 

Soli takes a loan in order to purchase a ram and increase the number of livestock. He does not have the necessary amount himself. Therefore he turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. Soli hopes that "MDO Arvand" will respond to his request for help and give him the necessary amount. He thanks in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase a ram

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines.  Irine has been in pig fattening for 5 years, and also earns additional income from abaca weaving. 

Irine is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Wynie

texts.en:
Louie Jay is 16 years old and is the second of two children in the family. His mother Wynie, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her buy and sell livestock business in the Philippines.

Louie Jay is studying for his Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Wynie is borrowing PHP 5800 to pay for the tuition fees of her son Louie Jay, for the second semester of the school year of 2014-2015.

Louie Jay plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 56 years old and has one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, etc.

Salvacion has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, like soap, milk, sugar, etc

loans.name: Jocely

texts.en:
Jocely is 44 years old and is married with four children.  Two children are currently in school and Jocely works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the and has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, sugar, salt, shampoo, canned goods, cereals, etc

She has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

In the future, Jocely would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, detergent soap, sugar, salt, shampoo, canned goods, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Husnidin

texts.ru: Хуснидин мужчина 55 , женат , отец четверых детей .Он на протяжение 20 лет занимается выращиванием и продажей  фруктов . Собирать урожай помогает ему его жена и младший сын. Товар Хуснидин отвозит на рынок ,где и  продаёт его . У него очень много покупателей,потому что Хуснидин выращивает свой урожай с любовью и всё у него всегда получается вкусным и зрелым. Хуснидин поставил на ноги свою дочь и двух сыновей,а его младший сын  в этом году закончил школу.Хуснидин хочет обучить его в университете.Но в настоящее время у него нет полной суммы для оплаты образования.Поэтому Он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой.Он надеется,что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную сумму.Заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Husnidin is a man of the age of 55. He is married and the father of four children. For a period of 20 years, he has worked with growing and selling fruits. His wife and youngest son help him with harvesting. Husnidin takes the goods to the market, where he sells them. He has a lot of customers, because he grows his fruits with love and all of the fruits are tasty and ripe. 

Husnidin has helped his daughter and two sons on their feet, and his yongest son finished school this year. Husnidin would like for him to get a university education, however, currently he Husnidin does not have the full sum to pay for the education. Therefore he turned to "MDO Arvand" for financial support. He hopes that "MDO Arvand" will respond to his request for help, and give him the necessary amount. He thanks in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 44 years old, married, and has ten children.  Four children are currently in school.

She is in the business of raising pig in the Philippines. 

Marivic has been raising pig for 5 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.  She has requested a PHP 5500 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and piglets.

In the future, Marivic would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 44 years old and is married with one child.  She works very hard to provide for them.

Mercidita runs a general store in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years, selling a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries.   She has requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

In the future Mercidita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Reuben's Group

texts.en:
Reuben is a 60-year-old proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Reuben has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Reuben described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing two solar lights, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Reuben’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8.25 acres of land and purchase a total of 10 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase two solar lights and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Belen is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Belen has a buy and sell frozen foods business in the Philippines. Belen requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers.

Belen has been in this business for two years. In the future, Belen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургуль, 30 лет, замужем, детей нет. Образование у нее высшее. Нургуль работает инспектором пресс-службы и получает заработную плату в размере около 12,000 сом (KGS). Сейчас Нургуль с супругом живут у его родителей, но планируют отделиться. Поэтому недавно приобрели квартиру, однако нужно сделать ремонт. Поэтому Нургуль обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS). На полученный кредит она купит обои, входную дверь, кафель и прочее. Нургуль очень хочет уже в новом году жить самостоятельно и быть хозяйкой собственного дома.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 30 years old and married. She does not have any children. She has higher education. Nurgul works as an inspector for the press and gets a salary of around 12,000 som (KGS) per month. 

Currently Nurgul and her husband live with his parents. However, they are planning to move out. Therefore they purchased an apartment not long ago, however it needs renovation. Therefore, Nurgul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 110,000 som (KGS). For the loan she will purchase wallpaper, doors, tiles and similar. 

Nurgul would very much like to live independelty already before the new year, and be a housewife in her own house.

loans.use: to purchase wallpapers, door, tiles and similar in order to finish repairing her house and move in

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Elizabeth works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling personal products. 

Elizabeth is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.  Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of her home. Emily hopes to live comfortably with a house of good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 20,000. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. Matter that Emily has given a priority as a Microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to have her house renovated

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells a variety of items, ranging from cooking oil, coffee, noodles, biscuits, toothpaste, soap, eggs, matches and soft drinks. She is married and has three children, ages 20, 18, and 12. To augment her income, she also engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish. She has been engaged in this kind of business for six years.

Maribeth is asking for a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP. She will use it to buy additional grocery items, fishing materials like fishing nets, and piglets to start up a hog-raising business. These things will make her store filled with different stock. Due to this, the store will attract more customers. In the coming months, she will raise and sell pigs. She will create higher sales, and she will be able to re-invest her profits into any possible business ventures. She could continue sending her children to school. In the future, she is hoping to manage her various businesses for the improvement of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fishing nets, and piglets to start up a hog-raising business

loans.name: Ma. Rosalie

texts.en:
Ma. Rosalie is 33 years old and has four children. Ma. Rosalie is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Ma. Rosalie is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Rosalie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Ma. Rosalie has been in pig fattening for 2 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Ma. Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 56 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Myrna has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Roselia Ruth

texts.en:
Roselia Ruth is 57 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

Roselia Ruth has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Roselia Ruth aspires to save enough to buy more farmlands.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like soap, noodles, eggs, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 35 years old and married with six children.

Nenita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 22 years and also earns additional income from selling dry goods and vegetables.

Nenita aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Niecel

texts.en:
Niecel is 35 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Niecel is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Niecel has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from basket weaving.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Oulah's Group

texts.en:
Oulah, pictured above, has been a farmer for 20 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 15 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 45 years old, is married and has eight children.

Oulah likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2012 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Oulah plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Oulah’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Samson's Group

texts.en:
Samson is 67 years old and has eight children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Samson is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Samson started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve, especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he likes being a leader.

Samson’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan, the group will also receive a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Jelrose is 19 years old and is the first, of the three children in the family. Her mother Liezel, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her livestock business in the Philippines.

Jelrose is studying toward a Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. Currently, she is in the first of this four-year course.

Liezel is borrowing PHP 5600 to pay tuition fees of her daughter, Jelrose, for the second semester of the school year 2014-2015. Jelrose plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her daughter's education

loans.name: Filogia

texts.en: Filogia is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She makes and sells lavalava to earn a living and has been doing this for more than 3 years. Filogia has requested a loan to buy paints, materials, a brush, an elei board, etc. She plans to use her profits to extend her business in the future. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, materials, a paint brush, an elei board, etc.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La socia Tomasa se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Tomasa continues with her grocery store business.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for five years, and it is going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Nonila

texts.en:
Nonila is a forty-year-old woman with four children living in Mcarthur, Leyte. Her oldest child is 20 and the youngest is 5. She earns a living by operating a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household items ranging from noodles, biscuits, soap, beverages and soft drinks. It has been 3 years now since she started operating her store. Her husband's occupation is a tricycle driver.

Nonila is asking for a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for the store like soft drinks, tuba (coconut) wine and other assorted items. This will help Nonila display a variety of stocks and could possibly attract more consumers to purchase. In this way, she could continue send her children to school and provide healthy diets to the whole family.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business to be productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks for the store like soft drinks, tuba (coconut) wine and other assorted items.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a fish vendor residing in Mcarthur, Leyte.  She sells fish. She is a 47-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 2. Her husband earns by engaging in tuba (coconut) wine vending. Aside from that, she also grows and sells tilapia (cichlid) fish. She has been engaged in this  kind of business for almost four years now. Because of the scarcity of capital, she needs support to continue her current livelihood.

Josefina is asking for a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy additional variety of fish to sell, and purchase feed for tilapia (cichlid) fish. In her day-to-day activity, she could now sell more variety of fish, and increase the growth of more tilapia fish. 

In the long run, Josefina hopes to manage her business to be able to recover and continue to support the need of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional variety of fish to sell, and purchase feed for tilapia (cichlid)  fish

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: Retailing helped Charito provide for the family. She retails rice and brings in a meager income of PHP 8,000 per month. She found the business of buying and selling rice to be easy and simple because all she needed to do was to weigh and repack the rice for her buyers. Charito plans to expand her retailing business. She applied to PMPC for a loan of the needed capital. She wants to purchase inventories of rice for retail. Charito smiles at the fact to see all her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase inventories of rice for retail

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try, after she learned that she could obtain financial assistance for her chosen business. Maricar has maintained her membership in good standing, without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans, and all were repaid in a timely manner.

Recently, she obtained a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins, for her chosen business. Maricar wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively, with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

loans.name: Renamie

texts.en:
Renamie is 25 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. Renamie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, sugar, noodles, etc.

Renamie has been in this business for one year. 

In the future, Renamie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell like soap, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nishel

texts.en:
Nishel is 25 years old and married with one child.  

Nishel is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Nishel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nishel has been in pig fattening for 5 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

Nishel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 36 years old and has two children, who are both in school. Noemi is married.

Noemi is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Noemi requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

Noemi has been in pig fattening for 3 years now and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Noemi would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feeds and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Ernia

texts.en:
Ernia works hard to support her family. She is widowed, and she has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothes, in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF. She will use this loan to purchase additional stock to sell. Ernia has been in this business for five years, now.

In the future, Ernia would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Lorlyn

texts.en:
Lorlyn is 50 years old and married. With one child who is in school, Lorlyn works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, etc. She has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future Lorlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, noodles, and soap.

loans.name: Miguel Evaristo

texts.es:
Miguel de 20 años de edad, es jornalero, estudio hasta el 4 grado, no continuo sus estudios debido a la pobreza en que vivían sus padres, entonces decidió aprender a trabajar para poder ayudarle a su familia en los gastos del hogar, está soltero y no tiene hijos vive con sus padres.

 Miguel se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de pollos y cerdos desde hace 5 años trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres, quienes siempre se han dedicado a este negocio, para trasladarse a su trabajo Miguel camina 3 kilómetros trabajando en el horario de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm todos los días.

El crédito que está solicitando,  es para comprar 2 terneras de repasto con las cuales dentro de un periodo establecido le darán ganancias y así obtendrá mejores ingresos para ayudarles económicamente a sus padres y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

 Miguel sueña en siempre darle a sus padres todo lo necesario y poder construir una vivienda de ladrillo para cuando él se case tenga donde vivir, ya que por el momento está viviendo en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Miguel is 20 years old. He is a day laborer who studied through the 4th grade. He did not continue with his education because of the poverty in which his parents were living, so he decided to learn to work in order to be able to help his family with the household expenses. He is single and has no children. He lives with his parents.

Miguel has earned his living in agriculture, raising cattle, chickens, and pigs, for five years. He learned this work from his parents, who have always worked in this business. To get to his work, Miguel walks three kilometers. He works a schedule of 7:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. every day.

The loan he is requesting is to buy two beef calves, which will provide him with earnings within an established time period. This way, he will obtain a better income to help his parents financially and give them a better quality of life.

Miguel dreams of always giving his parents everything they need and being able to build a house so that when he gets married, he will have a place to live; for the moment he is living in his parents' house.

loans.use: to buy two beef calves, which will provide him with earnings within an established time period.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andres está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, con el sueño de algún día poder tener su propia empresa.
Está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de sus estudios ya que siempre ellos han esta con él.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas, de manera a cubrir ese gasto y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Andres is studying for a degree in Business Administration. His dream someday is to have a business of his own. He is putting forth his best effort so that he can help his family through his studies since they always been there for him.

Andres is requesting a loan in order to pay his fees. This will enable him to cover this expense and he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 37 años de edad, es una madre soltera, costurera, ellas se dedica al oficio de corte y confeccion desde hace varios años, ademas tiene un pequeño negocio de pollos de engorde, sola a sacado adelante a su hijo quien se encuentra estudiando bachillerato, ella vive con dos de sus hermanos mayores, desde que sus padres murieron Carmen quedo al pendiente de los quehaceres del hogar.

 Carmen es una mujer muy colaboradora en su comunidad pues es un miembro activo de la directiva de desarrollo comunal y en muchas ocaciones es ella quien coordina las actividades que realizan en beneficio de la comunidad.

El crédito lo necesita para invertir en un pequeño negocio de pollos de engorde, para comprar mas concentrado y arreglar la galera de los pollos para tenerlos en un ambiente mas adecuado, y no se le mueran por el calor y lograr venderlos en esta navidad.

El sueño de Carmen es que su negocio cresca para obtener mejores ingresos, para poder pagar la universidad de su hijo.
texts.en:
Carmen in 37 years old. She is a single mother, and a seamstress. She has worked in the craft of cutting and preparation for many years. She also has a small business raising chickens. By herself, she has brought her child along, and he is now studying for a bachelor's degree. She lives with two of her older siblings. Since her parents passed away, Carmen became the one to look after the household chores.

Carmen is a very collaborative woman in her community. She is an active member of the community development directive, and in many occasions, it is her who coordinates the activities that take place for the benefit of the community. 

The loan is being requested to invest in the small chicken raising business, and to buy more chicken feed and repair the chicken coop in order to keep them in a more adequate environment. This way they will not die because of the heat, and she will be able to sell them during Christmas.

Carmen's dream is that her business grows to obtain more income so she can pay for the university education of her son.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed, and to repair the chicken coop in order to keep them in a more adequate environment.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is a 63-year-old proud father of 9 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very resourceful person, and is representing his group of 12 farmers in Matete District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, John has noticed that he has a larger farm group support.

John described his harvest as very good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to buy a cow.

With this loan, John’s Group will be able to plant a total of 8 acres of land and purchase a total of 9 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German tiene 57 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

German se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, etc; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio, German solicita préstamo para compra de una cantidad mayor de animales para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; German piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
German is 57 years old. He is in a common-law marriage with no children. He lives with his family in a rural area of the Oyotún district of the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. His community is mostly employed in farming, livestock production, and commerce.

German works raising and selling animals like ducks, hens, roosters, chicks, etc. He has more than ten years of experience in the business, which is located in his home. 

German is requesting the loan to purchase a larger quantity of animals in order to expand and diversify his stock. This investment will help him to have greater animal variety and productivity, which will greatly affect his business. 

German is planning to increase his stock of animals in order to be able to meet the different tastes and needs of the customers in his area. This will allow him to improve his income in the short term, to increase his profits, and ultimately to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to expand and diversify his stock of animals

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 26 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, vive en casa propia con sus dos menores hijos natural de la zona. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano,maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nancy es la crianza de animales (ovejos, chivos, pavos y pollos), además vende comida en su domicilio, la actividad que realiza desde hace más de 2 años, con experiencia en el negocio, con muy buenas referencias en la zona. Nancy necesita del crédito para capital de trabajo, pues desea realizar la compra de mesas, sillas para poder atender con una mayor comodidad a sus clientes. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido al crecimiento económico de la zona.
texts.en:
Nancy is 26 years old, lives with her partner and with her two younger children in her own home and is a native of the area. Life in the community is quiet the residents work in agriculture and cattle, as the main source of income they grow and harvest bananas, corn, cowpeas, etc. The community is located in the district and province of Morropón, Piura region, in the north coast of Perú.

Nancy works raising animals (sheep, goats, turkeys and chickens). In addition, she has been selling food in her house for over two years. She has experience in the business and very good references in the area. Nancy needs the loan for working capital. She would like to buy tables and chairs to take care of her customers and for their comfort. The market is promising due to the economic growth of the area.

loans.use: to have working capital because she would like to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda, 53 years old, is married and has five children, the youngest 16 years old. Rosalinda is engaged in farming and has operated a sari-sari (convenience) store business for ten years. She grows bananas, sweet potatoes, cassava and taro. In her store, she also sells items such as chips, candies, canned foods, coffee, shampoo, detergent and soap. She is asking for a loan to buy sachets of shampoo, conditioner, coffee, canned food, insect repellent, mung beans, chocolate and noodles.

Rosalinda hopes to expand her business so she can take care of herself and her husband without having to depend on her grown children. Her income will be for food, savings and reinvestment in her business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, conditioner, coffee, canned food, insect repellent, mung beans, chocolate and noodles

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es:
Ignacia: Es una señora amable de 61 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 18 años se dedica a la elaboración de repostería en un horno artesanal que construyo en su vivienda. Solicita financiamiento para comprar una batidora industrial en Managua, debido a la creciente demanda de la temporada navideña, de promociones, cumpleaños, bodas, etc. y comprar insumos para la elaboración de queque de yuca, banano, sodake, Paty (bocadillos propios de la Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte- RACCN). Su sueño es pintar su vivienda y comprar vitrinas para exhibir sus productos en su vivienda, actualmente los vende manera ambulante y por encargos. 

En la fotografia se presenta a Doña Ignacia y su nieta de 11 años Gissel.
texts.en:
Ignacia is a kind, 61-year-old woman, originally from Puerto Cabezas. She is a single mother of three grown children. In order to raise her children and have her own source of income, she has made a living for 18 years baking in an artisanal oven that she built in her house.   

She is requesting funding to buy an industrial mixer in Managua, due to the increased demand from the holiday season, promotions, birthdays, weddings, etc. – and to purchase supplies for the production of various types of cakes (cassava, banana, “sodake” and “paty”) – special dishes of the Autonomous Region of the Northern Caribbean Coast (RACCN). 

Her dream is to paint her house and buy cabinets to display her products in her home. Currently, she sells them as a street vendor and by commission. 

In the photograph are Doña Ignacia and her 11-year-old granddaughter Gissel.

loans.use: to buy an industrial mixer in Managua.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy, 54 years old, resides in Sicayab, Dipolog City. She is married and blessed with 2 children who are now adults. Cristy joined PMPC in order to access the programs and services of the coop. She is accessing her 2nd loan, in the amount of PHP 20,000, for additional working capital of her existing business, which sells a variety of food products in the local community. She will use the loan to buy a variety of basic commodities.

loans.use: to buy a variety of basic commodities such as rice, canned goods and milk

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn manages her eatery business in Sindangan, which she mastered when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well and supporting the family's needs. Ailyn has local customers and also accepts catering for added income. She recently borrowed a loan to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would be even happier to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma, 43 years old, is from Sindangan. She personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. Since Alma joined Paglaum MPC almost 3 years ago, she has been a member in good standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC, amounting to PHP 14,000, for the purchase of new nets.  As much as possible, Alma has to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. She also wants to buy her neighbors' fish catch so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. In the future, Alma dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from daily sales. She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets

loans.name: Familia Cedros Group

texts.es:
En la comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo “Familia Cedros” recientemente se ha iniciado la cosecha del maíz que es el cultivo más importante de la región y el alimento fundamental para las familias mexicanas durante todo el año. Para poder tener una buena cosecha se requiere de mucho trabajo, esfuerzo, dedicación pero sobretodo una fuerte cantidad de dinero. Los habitantes saben que toda esta inversión vale la pena porque más adelante tendrán la oportunidad de disfrutar de los elotes, esquites, gorditas de maíz, tamales y las tradicionales tortillas hechas a mano por las amas de casa.

Las integrantes del grupo son Isidora, Verónica y Reynarely quienes comparten un vínculo familiar: Isidora es mamá de Verónica y Reynarely es nuera de Isidora. Las tres son mujeres muy trabajadoras y actualmente necesitan de un préstamo para poder invertir es sus negocios, Doña Isidora en sus borreguitos, Verónica en productos de plástico para el hogar y Reynarely en tejidos y costuras.

Verónica o Vero, como la llaman de cariño, es muy amable y platicadora; es madre de dos niños (la niña de 5 años ya asiste a la escuela)  y vive en unión libre con Rubén quien trabaja en la construcción de casas. Hace tres años Vero fue invitada para vender productos de plástico para el hogar y fue como comenzó a conocer acerca de la industria aunque no se sintió muy cómoda con la distribuidora. Tiempo después cambió de empresa, la cual le envía los productos hasta su domicilio, le da plazos para pagar los productos y también le entregan los catálogos para ofrecer los productos. “Me encanta la forma de trabajo, los pagos son muy accesibles y me siento muy contenta trabajando de esta manera". Actualmente Vero necesita invertir para comprar más productos de plástico y poder entregar los pedidos a sus clientes. 

Vero aprovecha todos los lugares de reunión para dejar sus catálogos y vender sus artículos, el préstamo de VisionFund le ayudará aún más ya que la temporada de fin de año es una excelente época para vender y obtener muy buenas ganancias. Vero sueña con subir de nivel de ventas en la empresa, para lograrlo necesita conformar un grupo de 8 vendedoras, ella trabajará para lograr esta meta porque sabe que así podría ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y podría hacer algunas renovaciones en su hogar.

*La fotografía se tomó en el jardín del municipio donde viven los integrantes, al fondo se puede apreciar la fuente, centro del jardín. Vero es la primera a mano izquierda y tiene en sus brazos a su hijo más pequeño.
texts.en:
In the community where the “Familia Cedros” [Cedros Family] group is found, recently a corn harvest has started. Corn is the most important crop of the region, and is the fundamental nourishment for Mexican families all year. Having a good harvest requires a lot of work, effort, and dedication – but above all, a lot of money. The residents know that all of this investment is worth it, because in the future they will have the opportunity to enjoy the corn cobs, esquites [a Mexican snack made of corn, mayonnaise, chiles, and other ingredients], corn gorditas [a small Mexican cake made with corn flour, and stuffed with cheese and other ingredients], tamales, and traditional tortillas, made by hand by the housewives. 

The members of the group are Isidora, Verónica, and Reynarely, who share a family bond: Isidora is Verónica’s mom, and Reynarely is Isidora’s daughter-in-law. All three are very hardworking women, and they currently need a loan to be able to invest in their businesses – Isidora in her little sheep, Verónica in plastic household products, and Reynarely in fabrics and needlework.

Verónica, or Vero, her nickname, is very talkative and friendly. She is the mother of two children (the 5-year-old girl is already in school). She lives in a domestic partnership with Rubén, who works in the construction of houses. Three years ago, Vero was invited to sell plastic household products. This is how she came to know this industry, although she didn’t feel very comfortable with the distributor. A little while later, she changed to a different business, which now sends the products to her residence, allows her to pay for the products in installments, and also gives her catalogs to market the products. She says, “I love to work this way. The payments are very accessible and I feel very content working in this manner.” Currently, Vero needs to invest in buying more plastic products to fill her customers’ requests. 

Vero takes advantage of all of the meeting places to leave her catalogs and sell her products. The loan from VisionFund will help her even more, considering that the end-of-year season is an excellent time to sell and make good earnings. Vero dreams of increasing her level of sales in the business. To succeed in this, she needs to form a group of 8 sellers. She will work to succeed in this goal because she knows that, this way, she will be able to help her husband with the household expenses, and will be able to make some renovations to her home.

*The photograph was taken in the garden of the municipality where the members live. In the back, one can see the fountain, which is the center of the garden. Vero is the first one on the left-hand side, and she has her youngest son in her arms.

loans.use: to buy more plastic products.

location.town: Concepción chico, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, 60 years old, lives in Liloy, Zambo. Del Norte, with her husband, a construction worker, and eight children. Unable to sustain the family's needs with only her husband’s income, Juliana has found ways to obtain income through her sari-sari (convenience) store. The business began by selling a small amount of merchandise to their neighbors. 

Juliana joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her store in January, 2004. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received several loans already. She has applied for a loan of  40,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Thelma

texts.es: Thelma: Es una señora luchadora, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 52 años de edad, madre soltera de cinco hijos: Dos mayores de edad, dos adolescentes que estudian su secundaria y la menor de 7 años que cursa su primer grado (se presenta en la fotografía). Cuenta con una experiencia de 31 años de ser enfermera, con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos y tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 6 meses estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos y utensilios plásticos para el hogar. Solicita financiamiento para pintar su vivienda de concreto y construir el baño. Su sueño es construir el corredor de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Thelma is a hard-working woman. She is a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 52 years old and a single mother. She has five children: two adults, two teenagers who are in middle school, and the youngest is a 7-year-old girl who is in first grade (she is in the photograph).

Thelma has 31 years of experience working as a nurse. In order to move her children forward and to have her own source of income, she started a small business 6 months ago. She sells clothes and plastic household utensils.

She is requesting a loan to paint her concrete house and to build the bathroom. Her dream is to build the hallway in her home.

loans.use: to paint her concrete house and to build the bathroom.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Business Law. Here is her story:

“As a child, I heard a legend about a money tree, which grows in a special forest. I dreamed to find one and believed that it could help me to get everything that I wanted. Now I understand, it was just a dream of a small girl, but my parents tell me to dream big and never give up on them. I have a dream to have a good education, as it’s the key to a successful life.

On hearing of AUCA, I knew that it was exactly that university which would open the new doors to my future opportunities. My dream became my goal and I planned to realize my goal. At first I started learning English by myself, because we didn’t have an English teacher in our rural school. In summer, while my classmates were having a holiday and fun, I was taking English courses in Bishkek, far from my home. Secondly, the big obstacle was my family’s financial situation. We were short of money and I could get financial support in case I entered AUCA and received high scores. I did it and now have a chance to apply for a Kiva loan. 

My mother is a teacher in our rural school and my father is a farmer. We grow fruits and vegetables, have livestock to implement meat and sell it at the market. My father’s income is not stable as it depends on climate conditions and the richness of the harvest. Our family’s income is mostly spent for my grandfather’s treatments; he has a permanent paralysis of his legs and gets treatments every 3 months. The remaining money is enough just for daily necessities. I know it’s hard for my parents to afford my education at AUCA. So, why do I study at AUCA and make my family’s life harder? Just because I want my dreams to come true in order to be able to dream in the future and believe in their implementations.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma  has a wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities from growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Elma has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Elma has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Elma hopes to purchase another rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: James Mark

texts.en:
James Mark is a fisherman living in the town of McArthur, Leyte. He is a 23-year-old married man with a one-year-old son.

He earns a living by fishing. He sells fish to the nearby market in his community. He has been fishing for more than five years already. Aside from that, he also grows and sells tilapia (cichlid) fish as an additional source of income.

He is in need of capital to continue his fishing activity. James Mark has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy fishing materials such as fishing net and fish feed for tilapia. In this manner, he can improve his ongoing catch and hopefully raise and sell more tilapia. He can then pay for good food and provide better living conditions.

He is dreaming of handling his current livelihood successfully and supporting the needs of his growing son as well.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials such as fishing net and fish feed for tilapia (cichlid).

loans.name: Shem's Group

texts.en:
Shem is a 66-year-old proud father of 5 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Shem has noticed that he has had more profits from each harvest.

Shem described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to invest in a business.

With this loan, Shem’s Group will be able to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 6 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en: Jesusa has started her small business and became a boss with her sari-sari (convenience) store. She has managed to have enough inventory and rolls up her capital to gain more profit. She has made good sales every day since she is the only store in their district. Jesusa recently approached Paglaum for her much-needed capital to restock her store with basic commodities. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities such as canned goods, oil and soy sauce

loans.name: Aliia

texts.en:
Aliia is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Liberal Arts and Sciences. Here is her story:

“I turned to Kiva to ask for a loan to pay for my degree through a Kiva loan. Thanks to it, I will be able to finish my major and will achieve my goal. There are several reasons for my applying for a Kiva loan.

Firstly, my parents are divorced, and my father has another family. I live with my mother and two siblings. At present, my mother has a maternity leave to take care of my younger sister. So, we live on alimony, and father tries to support us when he has extra money.

Secondly, I have diabetes of the first type. Living with type-one diabetes is tough, but with proper care can be won by one’s efforts. At its core, proper type-one diabetes management is composed of a handful of elements: blood glucose control and insulin management, exercise, nutrition, and support. This requires a lot of money.

Thirdly, my younger sibling goes to kindergarten, which is also to be paid for. All these circumstances worry and upset me, but they also make me stronger and a fighter for my fate.

My mother doesn’t have money to pay for my tuition at AUCA. We need a loan of 1,100 USD. I have faith in the Kiva lenders to help me continue my studies at AUCA.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Myrna is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities, like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store, with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en: Lucena wants to fulfill her dreams, by completing  a degree. She religiously pays attention to making a good mark, every semester. For another school year, Lucena is in need of an amount to pay for her school fees. Lucena has big dreams to help her family, and for her siblings as well. These dreams are reasons why she works hard for her education.

loans.use: to pay for her school fees

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana believes education is a key to succeed in life. She wants that her son will earn a degree and become a successful engineer. With the loan of PHP 14,900, she will be able to pay for the tuition and graduation costs of her son. Her son is about to finish his course, but would need to fully pay the school fees. Her son sees himself to be in a position to help others, too, in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and graduation costs for her son.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Claudia se dedica al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, Claudia, belongs to Huaraypata Communal Bank, located in the Quiquijana district of the province of Quispicanchis in the department of Cusco.  She earns a living with her grocery store business.   She works from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. selling staple products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She has five years of experience in this business and it's going very well for her.

Claudia's requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments punctually.  Her dream is to expand her grocery store business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
