Cherry is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home. She hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing supported by her loan of PHP 14,900.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that Cherry has been given priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs for her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en: Marlyn, 40 years old, lives in the province of Siquijor, with her husband and children. Her husband is a construction worker. Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through snack & food vending. It began with selling a small amount of viand & snack to their neighbors. She joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in January of 2004. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. Now, she applies for 14,900 PHP loan to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. She hopes that her business will continue and someday become a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventories for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en: Esterlina is 59 years old and lives in Sindangan, Zambo. Del Norte. She is married and has children. Esterlina has a fish-vending business and a fishing boat business. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month, doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to pay for fishing boat repair for her fish selling business. Esterlina has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to pay  for fishing boat repair.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a vehicle motor for transportation

loans.name: Sokchea's Group

texts.en: A farmer living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sokchea is 35 years old and a mother of five schoolchildren. She can earn income to support her family's living condition via rice cropping on a five hectares area. For Sokchea, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of three, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seeds. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and rice seeds.

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en:
Rufo is a 47-year-old widow from the island of Siquijor. Rufo personally sells the catch from a fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

Since he became a member of Paglaum MPC almost 3 years ago, he has been a member in good standing. He wants to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 10,000 for the purchase of new nets. As much as possible, the fishermen have to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch. He already has floaters to help guard their fish cages. He also wants to buy the fish catch of his neighbors so he can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices. 

In the future, he dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales. He wishes to see his children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase new nets

loans.name: Norma Leticia

texts.es:
Norma, tiene una tortillería, inicio el negocio hace varios años, poco a poco ha ido expandiendo su negocio en la ciudad en donde vive, trabaja de seis de la mañana a dos de la tarde; vive con su esposo y una hija, la cual está en edad escolar, con esté negocio puede apoyar en los gastos familiares.
Invertirá en maíz y leña al por mayor, de esta forma adquirirá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de tortillas a un bajo precio, obteniendo así un margen mayor de ganancias y espera que con el préstamo su negocio tenga una mayor productividad.
Sus aspiraciones son remodelar su vivienda, trabajar con dinero propio y dar a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Norma has a tortilla-making business.  She started the business several years ago and has slowly been expanding the business in the city where she lives.

She works from 6:00 a.m. to 14:00 p.m..  She lives with her husband and daughter, who is of school age.  With this business, she can help pay the family expenses.

She will invest in corn and firewood in bulk quantities, thereby acquiring the raw material for selling tortillas at a low price. This way she will obtain a higher profit margin and expects the loan to improve the productivity of her business.

Her aspirations are remodeling her home, working with her own money and giving their children a better future.

loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood in bulk quantities, thereby acquiring the raw materials for the sale of tortillas.

loans.name: Henry's Group

texts.en:
Henry is a 65-year-old, proud father of six children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual. He is here representing his group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2014, Henry has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Henry described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to be purchasing a solar light this year, in addition to fertilizer and maize seeds, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel, and thereby save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to save more money for the future.

With this loan, Henry’s Group will plant a total of 5.75 acres of land and purchase a total of nine solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, and cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Susana se dedica al negocio de venta de flores, la socia vende rosas, claveles entre otras flores, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas y claveles.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Susana belongs to the community bank "HUARAYPATA".  The bank is located in the district of Quiquijana, in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

Susana is in the business of selling flowers.  She sells roses, carnations and other flowers. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.. She wants to succeed with this business. Her dream is to expand the business of selling flowers. She is requesting a loan to buy roses and carnations.

She is happy for the loan and promises to meet her required payments.

loans.use: to buy roses and carnations.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie lives in Baybay, Leyte. She is 42 years old. Since 2004, she has raised hogs in order to support her family. She is married with three children, and the youngest is eighteen. Her average income is not  enough to support the needs of her family.

She is requesting a loan to purchase hog feed and more piglets to raise. She hopes that by feeding her hogs a better quality of feed, they will be healthier, and she will be able to resell them at a higher profit in four months. The sale of her hogs will provide for her family's daily needs of food, and savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to  buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen has high hopes to live comfortably in her house with good roofing. She is juggling the business of her Sari-Sari Store while at the same time supervising the renovation of their home. She loaned from PMPC for the renovation of her house.

She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with good repayment record - a matter that Helen has given a priority as a microfinance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for, after all her financing needs on her retail business where supported by PMPC.

loans.use: renovate her house, including improving her roof

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Jane, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 56 years old, married, and has four children. Jane has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Jane isn’t new to One Acre Fund; she actually joined the program in 2014 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Jane will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition, since now she will be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone.

Using this loan, Jane's Group will purchase a total of nine solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and married with eleven children, four of whom are in school. Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell nipa roofing in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for nine years.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa roofing to sell

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Pao is 25-years-old and single. To support her standard of living, she grows rice on two hectares of land and plants cassava to earn extra income. Now she can earn income around 32,300 KHR per day. This is the third cycle for Pao with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. 

Pao will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can gain more yields and income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Penina's Group

texts.en:
Penina, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 69 years old, married and has six children.

Penina likes to think of herself as a very hardworking individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Penina plans to use the profits from this coming season to save more money for the future.

In total, Penina’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 5.75 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 11 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Miriam's Group

texts.en:
Miriam is 44 years old and has 5 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very friendly person. Even though Miriam is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 6 farmers in Matete District, Kenya.

Miriam started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Miriam’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.5 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 4 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera, tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos en el distrito de La Matanza. La vida en el distrito se desarrolla tranquilamente debido a que en lo que respecta al negocio u a otra actividad que se desarrollan sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería y crianza de animales. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Nancy es la venta de chicha de jora, cerveza y crianza de animales(patos, conejos, pollos, entre otros). La actividad la realiza desde hace más de 1 año en parte de su domicilio. El destino del crédito será para invertir en su negocio. Nancy necesita del crédito para la compra de cerveza, maíz etc. para poder aumentar su producción y así poder satisfacer las diversas preferencias de sus clientes. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. El mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que el producto se vende de manera semanal.
texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old. Her marital status is single. She has 3 adult children and lives in her own home with her children in the La Matanza district. Life in the district is calm, in regards to jobs and other work that its residents carry out, due to them making a living from farming and cattle and animal raising. Said district is located in the province of Morropon, Piura region, northern coast of Peru.

The work that Nancy does is raise animals (ducks, rabbits and chickens among others) and sell chicha de jora (a fermented corn drink) and beer. She has done this work in part of her home for more than one year. The loan will be used to invest in her business. Nancy needs the loan to buy beer, corn, etc. in order to increase her production and in that way be able to satisfy her customers varied preferences. In the short term this would allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings and in the end improve her quality of life and that of her family. The marketplace presents good prospects since the product is sold each week.

loans.use: to buy beer, corn, etc. in order to increase production.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
Adoracion is 57 years old and has two children, one of whom is in school.  

She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening, in the Philippines. Adoracion requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed.

Adoracion has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain this.

In the future, Adoracion would like to build and expand her business, to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap, 40, lives in Battambang province and is a mother of three children. To improve her living conditions, she raises pigs and ducks as her main source of income. This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. 

She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her entire loan portion to buy duck feed to support her duck raising. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy duck feed to support her duck raising.

loans.name: Saoem's Group

texts.en:
Saoem, 50, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province and is the mother of five children. To support her family, she grows rice as a single source of income and earns about 40,000 KHR per day.

For Saoem, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can improve her rice farm to get more yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en: A local farmer living in Battambang province, Sim is 33 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. To tackle her family’s hardship, she grows rice on two hectares area as a single source of income. She has been involved this business for ages. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely, to improve her living condition at a gradual pace. As a leader group of two, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labors fee. She hopes that she can earn more income to support her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labors fee.

loans.name: Joel's Group

texts.en:
Joel's Group is formed by 14 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Joel, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 55 years old, is married and has 4 children. Joel has been a farmer for 20 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Joel isn't new to One Acre Fund, he actually joined the program earlier in 2014 and has since noticed his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year, Joel will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Using this loan, Joel's Group will purchase a total of 11 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Her name is Salina. She 48 and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Virgilio, a driver, and has children. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal and household needs.

Salina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all of these products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 a day.

To help her continue operating her general store, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such as sacks of rice, charcoal, soda and other grocery items. She is positive that her income will grow as she expands her business. Her earnings are their source of income to meet their daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She wishes everyone a blessed Christmas!

Salina hopes to grow her business to become a grocery store. She dreams of a better life for her children and strives very hard to give her children the best education possible. She prays for a quiet and happy life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Neng's Group

texts.en: A resident from Kampong Cham province, Neng is 43 years old and a mother of two children. Because of her living, she grows cassava and plants the rubber. Moreover, she can earn more income via pig raising. This is the fourth cycle for Neng with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pig feed. She hopes that she can get more yield and sell at a high price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pig feeds.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“Education is one of the most important aspects of a successful life, yet not all people have the opportunity to get a good education. My parents want to give me all the opportunities they can, but the reality of our situation is that they will never be able to pay for the type of education I dream of: the type of education, which changes your life when you work hard. Because of my family’s situation and my strong desire to better myself, I am applying for a Kiva loan.

My family lives in Aral, a small village in the Talas region of Kyrgyzstan. We are four people in it: my father, my mother, my brother and me. Both my parents receive a pension due to their health problems, but this money is not enough even for their own medicine. After finishing the high school, my brother didn’t go to the university because of the same problem and works as a construction worker in Bishkek. It is almost impossible to find a job in our village, and even harder without a higher education. Thus, now my brother is the only person in our family, who does his best to support it. I understand that his work will not last in construction and I have to rely on myself, do my steps to the brighter future.

Last year I was a lucky student at New Generation Academy of AUCA, who won the full scholarship, received stipend and lived in dorm for free. This chance gave me a belief that if I study and try not being afraid, I can achieve my goals through education, what may redeem the position of my family. 

Through Kiva loan, I would be able to study and gain skills and knowledge I need in order to become a successful for my family, my village, and myself.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en: Nang, 50, is a farmer who lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of five children. To support her family's condition, she grows rice on three hectares area as her main source of income. Moreover, she raises ducks to supplement income. This is the first time for Nang with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seeds and duck feed. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and duck feed.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Yenis Zenith

texts.es: Esta emprendedora mujer tiene 42 años de edad y una amplia experiencia en los negocios, Yenis inicio con un estadero (lugar donde las personas toman licor y bailan) el cual le generaba mucho agotamiento físico por los horarios extenuantes que se manejaba en este formato de negocio. Por los anteriores motivos ella decidió iniciar una venta de comidas rápidas y restaurante, el cual  funciona desde el año 2012, y ha obtenido los resultados esperados.  Sus principales clientes son los empleados de negocios aledaños en el sector y transeúntes del lugar quienes desean probar estos platos exquisitos que elabora con mucho amor y dedicación Yenis. Su carta de comidas es muy variada, elabora almuerzos y comidas rápidas como perros calientes, sándwich, asados, mazorcas desgranadas. Ella maneja dos horarios según varían las ventas en los días de la semana; lunes a miércoles la atención al público es de 7 a.m. a 3 p.m. y jueves a domingo la atención al público es de 3 p.m. a 1 a.m., las ventas son canceladas de contado, aunque a sus clientes fieles también les brinda facilidad de pago.  Sus compra las realiza de contado graneros ubicados en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en los insumos de sus comidas como panes, salsas, carnes, aceite, aderezos, arroz, verduras entre otros ingrediente.  Yenis es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos y 1 hija a quienes les desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida por eso su meta familiar es tener casa propio.
texts.en:
This enterprising woman is 42 years old and has extensive experience in business.  Yenis started with an 'estadero' (where people drink liquor and dance) which caused a lot of physical exhaustion from the grueling schedule that is required in this business format. For the above reasons she decided to start a fast food stall and restaurant which has been operating since 2012 and has achieved the expected results.

The main customers are the employees of nearby businesses in the sector and passers-site who wish to try these delicious dishes prepared with love and dedication by Yenis.  The menu is varied meals.  She prepares lunches and fast foods like hot dogs, sandwiches, and roasted corn.  She works two shifts depending on the days of the week; Monday to Wednesday, she is open from 7 am to 3 pm and Thursday to Sunday she is open from  3 pm to 1 am.

All sales are canceled in cash, which for her loyal customers, also gives ease of payment.  Her purchases are made in cash at stalls located in the center of the city of Barranquilla.  This is why she has now applied for a Kiva loan. The financing that Fundación Mario Santo Domingo makes will be used to invest in ingredients for her meals as breads, sauces, meat, oil, seasonings, rice, vegetables among other products.

Yenis is a single mother of 2 sons and 1 daughter.  She wants to provide them a better quality of life so her family goal is to have their own house.

loans.use: to purchase breads, sauces, meat, oil, seasonings, rice, vegetables among other products

loans.name: Matiasa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.


La socia Matiasa se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y chanchos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y chanchos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This client, Matiasa, belongs to the communal bank "HUARAYPATA." The bank is located in the Quiquijana district, which belongs to the Quispicanchis province in the department of Cusco.

Matiasa makes a living through her animal husbandry business; she raises small animals such as guinea pigs and pigs. She makes them get bigger and develop and later she sells them in different fairs and markets. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. She has been in this business for eight years and it goes very well for her.

Her dream is to have a shop where she could sell the animals. She requests this loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs. Matiasa is happy to have this loan and she promises to make all of the payments.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en:
Habiba is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Ana Romilia

texts.es:
Ana, cuida de su familia formada por su esposo y su hijo de 39 años de edad, en su vivienda únicamente viven tres personas; su padre le enseño a cultivar granos básicos y a comercializar ganado, inicio a trabajar de manera independiente desde hace aproximadamente 20 años, trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m., sus actividades las desempeña en su localidad y en los tiangues de los alrededores.
Comprará concentrado, vitaminas para el ganado e insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz, espera alimentar y cuidar de su ganado para venderlo y obtener mejores ganancias, con la cosecha de maíz  alimentará a su familia y abastecerá a sus clientes.
Sueña crecer con su negocio, aumentar el área de cultivo y tener mejores ingresos para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Ana takes care of her family, made up of her husband and her son, 39.  Only three people live in her home.

Ana's father taught her to grow basic grains and sell livestock.  She started working on her own approximately 20 years ago.  She carries out her work from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. in her town and in the nearby markets.

She's going to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for her livestock, and agricultural inputs for her corn crop.  She hopes to feed and care for her livestock so she can sell it and earn better profits.  With the corn harvest she'll feed her family and supply her customers.

Ana dreams of growing with her business, expanding the area she farms, and having better income to change her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed, vitamins, livestock, and agricultural inputs for corn.  She hopes to feed and care for her livestock to sell it.

loans.name: Sri's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Sri is 51 years old and a mother of three children. She grows rice on four hectares as her main source of income. Additionally, she can earn more income via fish-catching. Now she can earn an income of about 33,300 KHR per day. 

This is Sri's eighth cycle with VisionFund. She has fully repaid her past loans and has used the money wisely to gradually improve her living conditions. In a group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor. She hopes that she can improve her family's living conditions

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married mother of two children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 30,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors staying for long enough to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 40,000 KES she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has two children, and both attend school. Agnes owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Agnes has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the loan of 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Santos Alicia

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica a vender ropa, vive con dos hijos, los cuales dependen económicamente de ella, es una mujer soltera; el negocio inicio con una pequeña venta de ropa en su vivienda con el objetivo de ayudar con los gastos de su hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, lo aprendió de su madre quien ya falleció, no tiene un horario establecido.
El crédito le servirá para comprar camisas, pantalones, falsas y otras prendas de vestir para ofrecer a sus clientes, espera mantener su fuente de ingresos para cubrir las necesidades familiares y resarcir sus deudas. 
Su deseo es tener recursos económicos para apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios y que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Santos earns a living selling clothing.  She's a single woman who lives with two children who are financially dependent on her.

Santos started her business with a small clothing store in her home so she could help with the household expenses and get her children ahead.  She learned the work from her mother, who has already passed away.  She doesn't have a fixed schedule.

The loan will help her buy shirts, pants, skirts, and other garments to sell to her customers.  She hopes to keep her source of income to cover the family necessities and to pay back her debts.

Santos wants to have the economic resources to support her children in their studies so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, skirts, and other garments to sell to her customers

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, utilizo el préstamo anterior para remodelar las instalaciones en donde tenía su negocio y comprar materia prima para la venta, logrando tener mayor demanda de los antojitos que ofrece y mejorar los ingresos, actualmente tiene un mejor equipo de trabajo y una mejor situación económica.
Nuevamente solicita un crédito para comprar pollo, tomates, condimentos, gas propano y otros para elaborar la venta de antojitos, también invertirá en material de construcción para ubicar el negocio en su vivienda, ya que lo tenía ubicado en un local arrendado.
texts.en:
Mercedes used the last loan to remodel the locale where she has her business and to buy raw materials for her sales, resulting in a greater demand for the snacks that she offers and better income. Today she has better work equipment and a better economic situation.

Now she seeks a loan to buy chicken, tomatoes, condiments, propane gas and other items to make her snacks to sell; also to invest in construction materials to locate her business in her home, as she was using rented space.

loans.use: to buy chicken, tomatoes, condiments, propane gas and other items to make her snacks to sell.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and tricycle passenger businesses. Corazon is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Muungano Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Ekila, a member of Muungano Self Help Group. She is 54 years old, married and blessed with seven children. She practices poultry keeping as her economic activity. 

She is thankful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) enterprise management training she received, which equipped her with skills to manage her business. 

She borrowed 10,000 KES from the HIH EA enterprise incubation fund, which she used to start poultry keeping. She has already completed repaying the loan, and is borrowing from Kiva to further expand her poultry business, by adding more poultry. 

She hopes that the loan will boost the business, and hence increase her income. This will in the long run help her improve the living standards of her family, such as medical care and modern housing.

Ekila is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, tiene como fuente de ingresos el destazo de reses y cerdos, vive en compañía de su compañera de vida y un ahijado en edad de 12 años, ambos dependen económicamente de él; su negocio funciona desde hace 2 años, le apoya su pareja a realizar dicha actividad, el horario de trabajo es de 3:00 a.m. a 1:00 p.m., dos días a la semana, el oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia, una de sus ventajas es que en la zona la competencia es mínima.
Invertirá en la compra de una novilla para su destazo, le permitirá tener más producto para cumplir con los pedidos de la temporada, de esta manera sus ingresos serán mayores y los utilizara para cancelar la deuda adquirida y cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.
Rigoberto desea seguir ampliando su negocio, comprar un lote para construir su casa y compartir una vida más confortable con su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto has as a source of income a butcher shop of beef and pork. He lives with his wife and 12 year old godson, both of whom are dependent upon him economically. He has had his business for 2 years. His wife supports him with the business. He works from 3 AM until 1 PM two days a week. He learned this work on his own, and one of the advantages in this area is that there is little competition.

He will use the loan to buy a heifer which will permit him to have more product to meet the orders from the season. In this way his income will be greater and he will use it to pay the acquired debt and cover the basic necessities for his home. Rigoberto wishes to continue expanding his business, to buy a lot on which to construct his home, and share a more comfortable life with his family.

loans.use: to buy a heifer for his butcher shop, which will permit him to have more product to meet the orders from the season

loans.name: Juana Paula

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Juana Paula  se dedica al negocio de venta de flores y tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras, la socia vende rosas, margaritas entre otras flores, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas y margaritas. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Juana Paula belongs to the community bank "HUARAYPATA".  The bank is located in the district of Quiquijana, in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

Juana Paula is in the business of selling flowers and also engaged in the business of selling vegetables.  She sells roses, daisies and other flowers

She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 pm.  She wants to get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand the business of selling flowers. She is requesting a loan to buy roses and daisies.

Juana Paula is happy for the loan and promises to meet her required payments.

loans.use: to buy roses and daisies.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Violeta  se dedica al negocio de venta de flores, la socia vende rosas, margaritas y claveles, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de flores. La solicita el crédito para comprar rosas,claveles y margaritas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank “HUARAYPATA” located in the district of Quiquijana, in the province of Quispicanchis, Cusco state.

Violeta sells flowers such as roses, daisies and carnations. She works from 8am to 5pm. Her business is how she plans to make progress for herself. Her dream is to increase her flower business.

She asks for a loan to buy roses, carnations and daisies. She is happy about the loan and promises to complete her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy roses, carnations and daisies.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
The person in the photo is named Mary. She is 43 years old, married and blessed with five children.

Mary earns her living by practicing maize and bean farming in her village. She has received training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise management, which  enables her to manage her enterprise more effectively.

She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase farm inputs such as hybrid planting seeds, to help improve crop yield. This will ensure she keeps up with the high demand for cereals, and she hopes this will increase her income.

Mary is very grateful to Kiva and promises to pay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy hybrid planting seeds that will help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Harrison, a member of Mwangaza Kondoo Self Help Group. He is 37 years old, married and blessed with five children.

Harrison does crop farming of maize and beans and also does dairy farming. He utilizes the skills he acquired in business management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to run his business. He is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase dairy feed and a calf. This will help improve on milk production, hence supply more to the market, leading to more income.

Harrison is very grateful and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy dairy feed, and a calf that will improve on milk production when it matures.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothing sales business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: A mother of six dependent children living in Battambang province, Thy is 47-years-old. Nowadays, she can earn an income to improve her family's living conditions via rice cropping. For Thy, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She has fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees. She hopes that she can update her lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Ana Gabriela

texts.es: Ana es madre soltera, tiene 25 años de edad, y su hijo tiene 2 años,  Ana se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja de vendedora de una tienda, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, Ana comenta que mientras ella trabaja es su madre quien le ayuda a cuidar a su hijo, Ana es una madre responsable ya que trabaja duro para darle a su hijo lo necesario.
texts.en: Ana, 25, is a single mother of a two-year-old son. She raises small animals and also works as a saleswoman in a store. She will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens. Ana says that while she works her mother takes care of her son. Ana is a responsible mother who works hard to give her son what he needs.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a single woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the 60,000 KES loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “HUARAYPATA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Virginia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Virginia belongs to the community bank "HUARAYPATA".  The bank is located in the district of Quiquijana, in the province of Quispicanchis and department of Cusco.

Virginia is in the business of raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.  She raises and fattens them and then sells them in different fairs and markets.  She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm.  She already has five years' experience in this business and is doing very well.  Her dream is to have a place to sell animals.  She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

Virginia is happy for the loan and promises to meet her required payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. Juana has been in this business for 2 years now. 

In the future, Juana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman and has two children whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a farm products business, selling for the past three years to the community. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan 50,000,she is requesting she wants to purchase farm inputs and plough the farm. She decided to join Yehu to get financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and plough the farm

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se dedica al cultivar granos básicos y a la crianza de ganado, ella vive con su familia integrada por su esposo, dos hijas de 8 y 12 años de edad, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero; su negocio lo ha practicado toda su vida y lo heredo de su familia, trabaja junto a su familia en un horario de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde.
El préstamo lo invertirá en ganado e insumos agrícolas para cultivar granos básicos, serán de ayuda para tener una cosecha más abundante, con la que tendrá alimento para su familia y abastecerá a sus clientes del producto, espera ganar nuevos clientes para mejorar las ganancias y cancelar su deuda.
María comenta que sus sueños son tener recursos económicos suficientes para remodelar su vivienda y darles a sus hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Maria is dedicated to cultivating basic grains and breeding livestock.  She lives with her family which includes her husband, two daughters aged 8 and 12 years old.  They receive no external financial aid.  She has worked in agriculture all her life, a trade that she inherited from her family.  She works with her family daily on a schedule of 6:00 am to 13:00 pm.

The loan will be invested in livestock and agricultural supplies to grow grains. They will be helpful to have a bountiful harvest with which she will feed her family and supply her customers with products.  She hopes to win new customers to improve profits and pay off the debt.

Maria says that her dreams are to have sufficient financial resources to remodel her home and give her children a better education.

loans.use: invest in livestock and agricultural supplies to grow grains which will be helpful to have a more abundant harvest

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
MARIELA tiene 54 años. Ella vive actualmente con su esposo y 2 sobrinas. Su esposo es agricultor independiente y MARIELA se dedica a la cría de pollos ya que posee el lugar apropiado en el patio de su casa.
Varios amigos y vecinos tomaron la decisión de formar parte de un grupo para financiar sus negocios e idead a través de préstamos que brinda FODEMI.
Es el primer crédito que gestiona MARIELA. Varios de sus compañeros ya realizan el segundo crédito.
Con este crédito ella comprara 100 pollos- vitaminas para aves bebederos comederos. 
En 5 años ella espera tener un gran galpón donde pueda brindar trabajo a quienes no tienen la oportunidad en este pueblo.
INFORMACIÓN ADICIONAL.
El grupo “FE Y ESPERANZA” está conformado por 13 personas. 5 de ellas recibirán $500.00 y 8 recibirán $900.00
Es un grupo bien organizado y trabajan todos en beneficio del progreso de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Mariela, 54, currently lives with her husband and two nieces.  Her husband is an independent farmer and Mariela earns a living raising chickens, because she has a suitable place on the patio of her house.

Several friends and neighbors decided to form a group to finance their businesses and ideas with loans from FODEMI.  This is Mariela's first loan.  Several of her colleagues are already on their second loan.

Mariela's going to use the loan to buy 100 chickens and bird vitamins for water and food troughs.  She hopes to have a big chicken shed in five years so she can employ people who don't have the chance to work in this town.

Additional Information: Fe y Esperanza Group is made up of 13 people.  Five of them will receive $500 and eight will receive $900.  It's a well-organized group, and all the members work to benefit progress in their community.

loans.use: to buy 100 chickens and bird vitamins for food and water troughs.  She's going to fix up a shed for raising chickens

loans.name: Luis Gerardo

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 59 años de edad, el esta casado y tiene 11 hijos, mismos de los cuales  3 hijos  y también 3 nietos viven con Luis y su esposa, el se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a trabajar de albañil, el crédito lo  necesita para comprar chanchos, comenta que tiene una chanchera por la que paga arriendo para criar sus chanchos, lo que Luis espera de este negocio es que le vaya bien y siga siendo un ingreso adicional para los gastos diarios de su hogar y sobre todo para comprar la medicina que necesita su esposa ya que se encuentra delicada de salud.
texts.en: Luis, 59, is married and has 11 children. Three of his children and also three grandchildren live with Luis and his wife. Luis raises small animals and works as a mason. He needs a loan to buy pigs. He says that he rents a pig sty to raise his pigs. Luis hopes that this business will continue going well so that it can be an additional income to support his household and to buy the medicine that his wife needs, as she is in fragile health.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Evy

texts.en:
Evy is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of two children. She is from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a sari-sari (or variety store) business, selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This has been the source of her income for the past nine years. 

Evy is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soft drinks, condiments and more. This loan will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future, Evy hopes to make her business sustainable and productive.

loans.use: To buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, rice, soap and toiletries, soft drinks, condiments and more.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail shop where she sells soap, sugar, bread, flour, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will have a large scale business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. She also does farming to earn more income.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, and other items

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kiva borrower. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a barber shop. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable him do farming. He hopes that in the future, he will have a large scale business. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a married man. He has two children, aged two years and seven years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cooking fat, tea leaves, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for five years. 

His business is located in an area with good infrastructure and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor business premise. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cooking fat, soap, tea leaves, flour and other items. 

His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be stable, have a healthy family, and educate his children. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking fat, soap, tea leaves, flour and other items

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 41 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Leonora has a buying and selling tomatoes business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more tomatoes to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for five years. In the future, Leonora would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Bladimir Javier

texts.es: Javier es un joven  de 25 años de edad,  está casado, tiene 3 hijos de 4 meses, 1 año, 4 años, mismos de los que los cuales el mayor ya asiste a la escuela, su esposa se dedica a cuidar el ganado, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca ya que trabaja en una finca de  ganado y ahí le hacen tener su vaquita, la aspiración de Javier es seguir trabajando y que le sigan apoyando con los créditos para construir su casita.
texts.en: Javier is 25 years old. He is married and has 3 children who are 4 months, 1 year, and 4 years old. The oldest child attends school. His wife takes care of thier livestock. He will use the loan to buy a cow. He works at a cattle farm and they'll let him keep his cow there. Javier aspires to continue working and that he will continue recieving support via loans to build his house.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is 55 years old, married and has five children.

Rosalia is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosalia requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more livestock to raise. She has been raising livestock for thirty years.

In the future, Rosalia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to raise.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Anita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of umbrellas and clothing such as blouses, pants, socks, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of umbrellas and clothing such as blouses, pants, socks, and other ready-to-wear clothing

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Joyce, who is thirty four years old, married, and has five children whom she lives with.

She operates a grocery shop and also does maize farming in her village. Joyce received training from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on business development which enabled her to expand her business. 

She is borrowing the loan to add more stock of kale, cabbages, and onions to the grocery shop due to the products' high demand. Joyce hopes that the business will flourish, leading to improved income. 

She is very grateful for the loan and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of kale, cabbages, and onions that will help meet the rising demand for her products.

loans.name: Yam's Group

texts.en:
Yam, 30, lives with family members in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children; one is in school and one is too young. 

Nowadays, she can earn income to improve her family condition via rice cropping on a two hectares area and duck-raising to earn extra income. 

For Yam, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kia’s partner). As the group leader of three, she will spend her loan to buy rice seeds and duck feeds. 

She hopes that she can improve her business to get more income.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and duck feeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 42 years old, married and blessed with six children who are aged between ten and eighteen years old. He raises maize and potatoes. 

He has undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on savings and financial management, which has equipped him with knowledge and skills on saving consistently for future purposes. He is borrowing a loan from Kiva, which he intends to use in boosting his potato farming by buying planting seeds. 

He plans to use the income from his enterprise to educate his children and plough back some profits to help further expand his farming. Lawrence is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Margaret. She is 53 years old and blessed with five children. Margaret earns a living by farming maize and beans, and also by operating a cafe. She has been trained by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa on enterprise management, and utilizes the skills in running her business. 

She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to purchase utensils and seats for the cafe, to help accommodate the rising number of customers. This will lead to more income, thus enabling her to cater for family basic needs such as food and clothing. Margaret is very grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase cafe utensils and seats that will accomodate more customers.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis de 50 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y su hija de 18 años y su hijo de 19 años de edad, por lo que se siente orgulloso de poder ver a sus hijos grandes, lo cual consiguió con su esposa a base de esfuerzo y sacrificios. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida desde hace 7 años con su venta de cocos, actividad que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. Luis desea mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, por lo que desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado, y para ello ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, polines y pines para cambiar el techo de su vivienda, que ya brindo su vida útil.
texts.en:
Luis is 50 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and daughter, aged 18, and son, aged 19.  He feels proud to see their grown children, whom he, along with his wife, have raised with effort and sacrifice.

He is a hardworking man who has made his living for the past 7 years with the sale of coconuts.  This activity has allowed him to support his family.  Luis wants to improve their lives.  He wants to replace the damaged roof of the home.

He decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI to invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams and fasteners to replace the roof of his house, which already reached the end of its useful life.

loans.use: To invest in galvanized sheet metal, beams and fasteners to replace the roof of his home.

loans.name: Raton

texts.en:
Raton is a married woman. She has one child. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. 

Her business is located in an area favourable for business and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate capital. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of beauty products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es una mujer de 44 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 4 y 2 años y una hija de 1 año, y su negocio es la venta de verduras.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, buena madre, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la zona Sur de la ciudad, como la feria de; la costanera, san miguel y achumani., dichas ferias se realizan una vez por semana y los vendedores se agrupan en un sector dónde ofrecen sus productos en la calle, otros en camionetas y ambulando. De clima templado con una temperatura ambiente que ronda los 12-21 grados centígrados durante el día.
Lourdes es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymara y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que es mecánico de autos y sus hijos que aún no están en edad escolar. La familia vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de verduras, como; papa, zanahorias, cebolla, tomate, plátano de freír, ají colorado, pimiento morrón, zapallo, ajo, chuño, lechugas, espinaca, etc. día por medio se ocupa de trasladarse a las diferentes ferias con sus pequeños hijos, el resto de los días se los dedica a su familia. “las verduras son consumidas a diario y por temporada, como las frutas, y gracias a mi antigüedad en el negocio me conocen y tengo clientes fieles…” comenta. Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande y desea realizar una inversión en la compra de un vehículo para transportar sus verduras hasta las ferias, porque se le dificulta mucho el transporte y el cuidado de sus hijos. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lourdes solicita un préstamo para la compra de un vehículo para transportar verduras y cuidar a sus hijos sin problemas.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 44, is married and has two sons, ages 4 and 2, and a one-year-old daughter. She makes a living selling vegetables. She is enterprising, independent, consistent, a good mother, responsible and hardworking. She sells vegetables on foot in various markets in the southern part of the city, like those in La Costanera, San Miguel and Achuamni. These markets are held once a week and the sellers come together in an area where they offer their products in the street, in trucks or on foot. The climate is mild, with a temperature of 12-21 C during the day.

Lourdes has long dark hair, short stature and her native tongue is Aymara but she also speaks Spanish for her work. Her husband is in auto mechanic and her children are not yet school-aged. Her family lives in their own home made of brick and they have potable water, electricity and sewer.

Lourdes sells vegetables like potatoes, carrots, onions, tomatoes, plantains, peppers, pumpkin, garlic, potato starch, lettuce, spinach, etc. She spends a lot of days going to the different markets with her small children, and the rest of her time she spends at home caring for them. "The vegetables are consumed daily and seasonally, like fruits, and thanks to my history in the business people know me and I have loyal customers," she says. Her dream is to have a bigger business and she wants to invest in a vehicle to transport her vegetables to the markets, because it's very hard to do that and take care of her kids. This is the third cycle of loans with the institution in the 20 years she has been in business. For that reason, Lourdes asks for a loan to buy a vehicle to transport vegetables and take care of her kids.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to transport vegetables and take care of her children.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick and his wife have worked on their current farm situated in the outskirts of Kerugoya town, Kenya, since 2000. Since then, their farm and family have grown in more ways than one. In 2008, the couple started working on a run-down farm. Today, they are making money off the poultry and dairy animals they raise and also the maize and vegetables they grow. Patrick has further invested in transportation services to reduce their transportation costs and make money offering the service to other farmers. 

Patrick loves to dairy farm, especially since it was always a life goal of his to be a farmer. His wife understands this and together they joined hearts and hands to make the farm's success to date happen. Patrick is seeking a loan to purchase a pedigree dairy cow. There are more than 100 cattle breeds in Kenya. However, not all are good producers of milk. In fact, very few are. Cattle aside, the tastes and preferences of milk in the market is really growing in diversity in Kenya. Drinking milk is no longer a matter of pouring it into our cereal bowl, adding it to our coffee, or drinking it straight from the glass, we now have preferences in the type of milk we drink. Today, milk consumers are spoiled for choice. In the market, we have old-fashioned cow’s milk and lactose-free milk, not to mention non-dairy options such as soy, almond, rice and coconut milk. It takes dairy masters like Patrick to pick these shifts in the market and adopt ingenious techniques in farming to ensure that their product qualities adapt to the changes in consumer preference. 

Purchasing a pedigree cow goes to show how Patrick is keen on controlling lameness levels in his dairy cattle. He considers breeding to be the core of his overall strategy of ensuring that milk quantity is way above average and the milk quality is second to none in the market. He anticipates that feeding will be his highest cost of milk production. This, to him, is accepted because to get cows that milk well and remain healthy, they have to be fed properly.

Your loan will make a significant difference to Patrick's farm profitability. The couple will make use of the returns from this investment to pay for the loan, pay for their children’s education and the rest will be reinvested in the business. It has always been their ambition to share their passion about farming with their children. They hope the kids will be thrilled to join the business of running the family farm.

loans.use: To buy a high pedigree cow

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 33 years old and married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur.  

She earns a living by raising cow in the Philippines. Emelita requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her cow.

Emelita has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Emelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her cows.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over three years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a man with great drive and entrepreneurship. He is 25 years of age, a hard worker and always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He is based in Pioneer, a rural village in Eldoret, and has no children. He has been practicing farming for the past two years and has never looked back. 

His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops. Most of the small-holder farmers in Pioneer village own approximately half an acre per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. Thomas has been practicing mixed farming and he enjoys the income he gets, but he has been facing challenges delivering his products to the market. 

Pioneer village is a very remote area and the roads are in pathetic condition; this has hampered Thomas from making timely delivery of products to the market while still fresh. Thomas sells vegetables, milk and tomatoes, which are very perishable and require quick delivery if you are to fetch a high price. Thomas is seeking a loan to buy another motorbike that will help him deliver his products to the market in a timely way so that he can overcome the challenge of facing losses. 

Through the loan he will deliver the products on time to the market and this means he will never suffer losses, which will translate into an immediate increase in profits. Thomas plans to employ someone who will help him on the farm and deliver products to his large client base. Profits from the loan will be used to comfortably repay the loan fully and invest in a solid foundation for his family to come.
 
Thomas says that his greatest desire is to continue fighting to generate financial stability and to provide his parents and siblings with better living conditions and well-being.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike to be used in delivering his products to the market on time.

loans.name: Rosario Del Pilar

texts.es: Rosario tiene 44 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 7 hijos mismos de los cuales 5 aun viven en su casa, y son 3 los que asisten al colegio, Rosario es una señora colombiana que ya vive 10 años en Ecuador y comenta que se encuentra mas tranquila que en su país natal, ya que en Ecuador si hay donde trabajar y sobre todo el pago por su trabajo es justo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  chanchos y de ahí se apoya en los gastos diarios de sus hijos, su esposo es jornalero y la aspiración de Rosario es mejorar su negocio y comprar chanchas paridoras ya que comenta que este negocio es rentable debido a que se puede vender las crías.
texts.en: Rosario is 44 years old. She is married and has 7 children, 5 of whom still live at home, and 3 of whom attend high school. Rosario is from Colombia and has lived in Ecuador for 10 years. She explains that she feels more at home there than in the country of her birth because in Ecuador there are jobs and the pay for one's work is fair. She will use the loan to purchase pigs. This is how she takes care of her childrens' daily expenses. Her husband is a day laborer and Rosario aspires to improve her business by buying breeding sows, which she explains are profitable because she can sell the piglets.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es: Rosa es una señora muy trabajadora de nacionalidad colombiana, tiene 39 años y esta casada, tienen 4 hijos y todos se encuentran estudiando, Rosa juntamente con su esposo se dedica trabajar de cuidadores de vacas y de chanchos, son 12 años que ya vive en Ecuador y agradece el apoyo que le dan gracias a sus créditos, con el dinero del crédito va a comprar chanchos ya que se dedica a este negocio desde que era muy joven y es de ahí se apoya en los gastos que tiene en su hogar, lo que ella aspira es mejorar su negocio y seguir trabajando en Ecuador.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hardworking Colombian lady.  She is 39 years old and is married.  She has 4 children and all are in school.

Rosa, along with her husband, is dedicated to raising cows and pigs.  She has been in Ecuador for 12 years.  She appreciates the support given via this loan.  With the loan, she will buy pigs as she has been in this business since she was very young.

Thus, she helps with the expenses they have in their home.  She aspires to improve her business and continue working in Ecuador.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Ana Lucia

texts.es: Ana es una joven  de25 años, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 4 años y ya asiste a la escuela, Ana  vive con su  hijo en una casa que le arriendan, Ana se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y también trabaja de empleada domestica, el destino del crédito es para comprar chanchos y comenta que si es un buen negocio ya que cuida adecuadamente a sus animales, Ana es una chica que aspira seguir trabajando y mejorar su negocio y asi lograr tener los ingresos necesarios para su hijo.
texts.en: Ana, 25, is a single mother with a four year old son who is already in school. Ana lives with her son in a rented home. She raises small animals and also works as a domestic employee. The loan will be used to buy pigs, which she says is a good business because she takes good care of her animals. Ana is a woman who aspires to continue working and improving her business so that she can make enough money to care for her son.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Winfred. She is married and blessed with two children. She is a maize and beans farmer and also does poultry keeping. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. She needs a loan to add more poultry. She hopes this will increase her level of income and thus support her family by providing clothing, food and education.

Winfred is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy more poutry that will help improve her income.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has two children with ages 2 years and 7 years. She describes herself to be outgoing and ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a strategic location and her primary customers are of all types. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes to sell during the December peak season. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will provide quality shoes and live a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes to sell during the December peak season

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Josephine, who is forty two years old, married, and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Josephine operates a retail kiosk where she sells sugar, tea leaves, salt, and other household items. She is grateful for HiH EA's enterprise training that has enabled  her to manage the enterprise well. 

She is taking a Kiva loan to add more stock to her shop. She will be able to meet her customers' demand, thus increasing income to enable her to support basic family needs such as education, medical care and clothing.

She is happy for Kiva and their lenders for their financial help and promises to repay the loan promptly

loans.use: To buy more stock of sugar, tea leaves, and salt that will help serve an increased number of customers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es: A sus 52 años de edad, Laura es madre soltera y tiene  2 hijos que ya son i dependientes, ella vive con su madre y su padrastro, Laura  se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de chanchos, ya que esta es su fuente de ingresos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para seguir adelante en su negocio, la aspiración de Laura es de mejorar su negocio incrementarlo y que sus ganancias le permitan darle la alimentación y lo mas necesario a su madre y padrastro que ya son de la tercera edad.
texts.en:
At 52 years old, Laura is a single mother with 2 children who are now independent.  She lives with her mother and stepfather.

Laura is dedicated to the breeding and marketing of pigs, as this is her source of income.  With the loan, she is going to invest in the purchase of pigs to get ahead in her business.

Laura's aspiration is to incrementally expand her business and increase its profits.  This will allow her to provide food and whatever is necessary for her mother and stepfather who are already Seniors.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
