Everlyne is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 3 years to 17 years. She describes herself to be committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of a permanent  business premise. 

She will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes. Her business goal is to have more stock within five years. 

She hopes that in the future, she will live well. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of shoes

loans.name: Inessa

texts.en:
Inessa is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of Economics. Here is her story:

“A Kiva loan is a unique chance for me to get a good education in American University of Central Asia, which is considered as one of the most prestigious and prominent universities in the whole region. For me education is a vital aspect of my future life and certainly I want to find my place in this life. Your support is a significant assistance to my family to give me a higher education. I need the loan for three reasons: financial situation of my family, my active and vital position, and a base of my higher education.

The principal reason is my needy family. I live with my grandparents and my mother. Grandparents are pensioners at the age and my mother is at home due to her health condition. She gets a small compensation because of it. Before, my mother used to be a hairstylist and worked in one of the beauty salons in Bishkek. One day she felt ill, had five operations, and then stayed at home. I know that all her hopes rely on me.

While studying at school I did all my best to grasp knowledge. I was responsible and interested in taking part in various school activities like competitions, Olympiads, contests, and festivals. I managed to succeed in “Reciting” devoted to A.S.Pushkin, Olympiad in English, and contest in Russian grammar named “Gramotei,” and took a leading part in 8th All-School City Festival in Ethnography.  In the 11th grade I organized English and math courses at school for the students. All my diligence was estimated and I was one of the best school-leavers that year. 

I will try to stay such a positive and broad-minded person at university and repeat my motto: 'Cheer up!'”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a 45-year-old, divorced woman living in Irbid. She has been selling accessories, clothes and perfume in her home. Amal wants to add selling winter clothes for the season, so she has applied for this loan. She is hoping to open her own clothing store in the future.

loans.use: To add selling winter clothes for the season.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jackline. She is married and blessed with four children. She is thirty years old. Her economic activity is dairy farming. Jackline has improved her skills and knowledge in business management from training courses on enterprise management and financial planning offered by Hand in Hand Eastern Africa. She needs a loan to buy high quality fodder for her cows. This will increase the milk production and help her meet the milk demand. She hopes this will increase her income and thus she will be in a position to support her family.
 
Jackline is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: To purchase high quality fodder that will improve milk production for the dairy cows thus leading to an overall increase in milk production.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Josephine. She is twenty four years old and blessed with three children. Two of her children are in primary school while the other one is yet to start school. She is married and lives with her family. Josephine operates a mixed shop where she sells goods such as books, shoes, bags, sugar, flour, cooking fat and other household items. She received training on enterprise development and financial management from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, which has greatly helped her manage the shop. She also borrowed 10000/- Kenyan shillings from the  organization enterprise incubation fund (EIF) which she used to help boost her shop and repaid the loan promptly. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to continue expanding her business by adding more stock. She hopes the Kiva loan will also boost her business the way the previous EIF loan helped her earn more income.

Josephine is grateful for the Kiva loan and promises to make the established payment.

loans.use: To buy more stock of  books, shoes, bags, sugar, flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Ngeleno Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Henry, a married father of two children. He is a member of Ngeleno Women Group. Henry is twenty six years old and works hard to support his family. He owns a fuel filling station selling petrol and paraffin in Nakuru Kenya. He is taking a loan to invest in the business by adding more stock of fuel. This will greatly increase his sales and hence increase his income. The anticipated increased income will help in improving his family’s overall living standards, such as quality medical care. 

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fuel and paraffin that will help improve on sales volume.

loans.name: Sumboka Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photograph is Peter, a member of Sumboka Self Help Group. He is a forty-year-old father of four kids and lives with his wife. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to learn more skills on enterprise development and financial management, which helped him improve his knowledge in business management. He is a maize and beans farmer. Part of the produce is used for family consumption and the rest is for commercial purposes. He has applied for a loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and planting seeds to help improve on crop yield from the projected bountiful harvest. He hopes the loan will assist him to boost his business income thus enabling him to improve the living standards of his family, which includes quality education and modern housing.

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds that will help improve on crop yield thus enabling a bountiful harvest.

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung is a 48 year-old, widowed woman and lives with her two children. For the past eight years, Dung has been running a general store from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. Dung is the Group Leader of a 5-member loan group, all of whom live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, she is in the center wearing the red clothes. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Dung is requesting a loan to purchase better quality and a greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties that face her family.

loans.use: To purchase products. such as food and beverages, to restock her store.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en:
Trinh is a 40-year-old married woman living with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.  Her husband is a soldier. For 3 years, she has operated a business processing clothing.

Trinh would like a loan to purchase a new sewing machine.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Rey David Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REY DAVID” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rusmeri es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, taller de chapería, servicio de lavado de autos, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, venta de dulces.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rusmeri es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de lavado de autos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por impulso de una amiga quien le enseño la forma de trabajo de este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de compresoras) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo implementará en su espacio de servicio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los créditos, la capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Rey David" communal bank will begin its second loan cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch administrative office. It is made up of eight members and is guided by a steering group, of which Rusmeri is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied, and among them are: clothing sales, automotive body shop, car wash, small grocery store, food sales, sweets sales.

The loan will be used to benefit the small business owners where Rusmeri is a member. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer more than a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She has a business that washes cars. She says she learned the business several years ago at the urging of a friend who taught her how to work in this business.

The loan she now taking is to increase her capital and buy compressors, which she will purchase from the wholesalers in La Paz. She will then use them in her business. This work allows her to earn income so she can support her family economomically. She lives in a common law marriage and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds taht she likes the loans, the trainings, and the health care that are offered through the institution.

loans.use: to buy compressors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate the home.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, flours, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Juana Azurduy Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUANA AZURDUY” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de overoles, costura de deportivos, costura de chamarras, servicio de transporte, venta de pescado, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace diez años de un trabajo anterior, con un poco de capital decide emprender su negocio independiente. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Juana Azurduy" communal bank will begin its sixth loan cycle at Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani administrative office. It is made up of eight members and is guided by a steering group, of which Lidia is the president. The businesses that the communal bank members have are varied, and among them are: sewing overalls, sewing sports clothing, sewing coats, transportation services, fish sales, and knitting shawls.

The loan will be used to benefit the small business owners where Lidia a member. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She has a sewing business. She says she learned this business ten years ago at a previous job. With a little bit of capital, she decided to start her own business.

The loan she will take is to increase her capital by buying fabric at wholesale price, which she will purchase from the wholesalers in La Paz. She will then sell her products at her store. This work allows her to earn income so she can support her family economomically. She is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the trainings that are offered through the institution.

loans.use: to buy fabric at wholesale price.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a hardworking man who deals in motorcycle spare parts in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with six children, and four of his children attend school. 

He desires to develop his business by also dealing in motor vehicle spare parts and to educate his children to university level as a minimum qualification. Robert faces the challenge of high license fees and transportation costs. He will use the loan facility to buy more tires to sell.

loans.use: To buy more tires to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Mariela

texts.es: Sandra es una señora luchadora, tiene 3 hijos y todo están estudiando, Sandra es casada y su esposo trabaja al jornal, ella es empleada que abaja de costurera los 5 días de la semana y adicionalmente los fines de semana comercializa chanchos, el crédito lo necesita para comprar chanchos que comenta que los compra en el campo algo baratos para luego venderlos en el mercado de chanchos obteniendo una ganancia, la aspiración de Sandra es seguir trabajando duro para seguir dando lo necesario a sus hijos y sobre todo que terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sandra is a hardworking woman. She has three children who are all in school. Sandra is married and her husband is a day laborer. She works as a seamstress 5 days a week and on the weekends she sells pigs.

She needs a loan to buy pigs, which she says she will purchase in the country where they are cheap and later sell them in the market for a profit. Sandra's aspiration is to keep working hard to give her children what they need so that they can complete their education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Julia Luz

texts.es: Julia es una señora muy amorosa y responsable con sus 2 hijos y esposo que es chofer, son 33 años que se dedica al comercio de papas y el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en papas, la aspiración de Julia es mejorar sus negocio y por medio de las ganancias que le queden darles a sus hijos lo necesario para que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y puedan encontrar trabajo digno.
texts.en: Julia is a loving woman and a responsible mother and wife to her two children and her husband, who is a driver. For 33 years she has been selling potatoes, and she will invest this loan in buying potatoes. Julia's aspiration is to improve her business and to use the profits to give her children what they need so that they can finish their education and find dignified jobs.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Luis Floriberto

texts.es: Luis es un señor de 31 años de edad, está casado y tiene 2 hijos, un niño de 3 años y una hija de 6 años mismos que asisten a la escuela,  el se dedica a trabajar de albañil y junto a su esposa también cría animales menores, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chancos para que su esposa los cuide mientras él trabaja de albañil, la aspiración de Luis es mejorar su negocio y así incrementar sus ingresos para darles lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luis, 31, is married and has two children who attend school, a 3-year-old boy and a 6-year-old girl.

He earns a living working in construction and also raises small animals with his wife.  He's going to invest in buying pigs for his wife to take care of while he works as a bricklayer.

Luis wants to improve his business so he can improve his income and give his children what they need.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Forty-eight year old Reynaldo has been a fisherman for more than 20 years. He catches and sells fish to earn a living. He has two children ages 2 and 8 respectively. He lives in Mcarthur, Leyte.

Reynaldo is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase fishing material like fishing nets and fish feed. These tools are very essential for his day to day fishing activity and could generate high volume of yield and increase his earnings. With this, he could purchase good food and pay for school fees.

Reynaldo is hoping that this could be the start of his livelihood recovery and eventually help improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing material like fishing nets and fish feed.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is a 66-year-old married man. He lives with his two children and wife in Ho Chi Minh City. For 10 years he and his wife have run a general store that sells household items to people in their community, and they also have another business processing clothes to earn additional income.

Chan would like a loan to purchase a greater quantity of new household items and soft drinks to stock his store. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional customers. 

He also hopes that through his loan he will be able to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: to purchase household items and soft drinks to stock his store.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es: Narcisa esta casada y tiene 45 años, es una señora muy alegre y tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales una esta estudiando, ella trabaja con un señor en una carpintería  que es a medias, su esposo es albañil, Ella necesita el crédito para comprar madera para la elaboración de muebles,  la aspiración de Narcisa es seguir adelante con su negocio y que sus hija termine sus estudios para tenga una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en: Narcisa is married and she is 45 years old. She is a very happy person and she has 4 children, of whom one is studying. She works with another man in a part-time carpentry shop. Her husband is a brick layer. She needs the loan to buy wood for making furniture. Narcisa aspires to continue with her business and hopes that her daughter finishes with her studies so that she can have a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood.

loans.name: Zera Emilicia

texts.es: ZERA EMILCIA: Es una joven amable de 25 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, soltera. Cuenta con una experiencia de 3 años de ser docente de primaria. Con el propósito de mejorar la vivienda de tambo de madera de sus padres, solicita financiamiento para construir anexo de madera. Su sueño es establecer su propio negocio, para contar con otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Zera Emilicia, 25, is a friendly young woman. She is originally from Puerto Cabezas and is single. She has been a primary school teacher for 3 years. In order to improve her parents' wood home, she asks for a loan to build an addition out of wood. Her dream is to start her own business so that she can have another source of income.

loans.use: to build an addition out of wood.

loans.name: Villa Bolivar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA BOLIVAR” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vania es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: taller de electricidad, venta de prendas de vestir, heladería, venta de frutas, venta de cosméticos, tienda de barrio, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vania es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años por impulso de una amiga quien le enseño al comercio de estos productos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The lending group “VILLA BOLIVAR” will start its 6th cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Focal Center of Santiago II. The group is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board, of which Vania is the president. The group's members have varied business including: an electrical workshop; clothing sales; ice cream; fruit sales; cosmetics; neighborhood stores; and vegetable sales. The loan they will take out will benefit these small businesswomen, including Vania.

Vania has been a part of Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of a friend. Her business is selling cosmetics. She started several years ago at the urging of a friend who taught her the trade. Her part of the loan will be used to increase her capital by purchasing cosmetics at wholesale from the wholesale shops in the city of La Paz, which she will later sell at her stall.

This work helps her to generate resources to support her husband and two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the trainings and the health services that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Luong

texts.en:
Luong is a 57-year-old married woman living with her three children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam.  Her husband is now retired.  For 18 years, she has run a general store. 

Luong would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of household items and beverages to stock her store.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of household items and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Tam

texts.en:
Tam is requesting a new loan to buy fishing equipment to stock his shop. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and increase sales. 

He hopes that this new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, increasing his income and helping him improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fishing equipment to meet his customers' needs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental home that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She faces a major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan of 50,000 KES she is requesting she would like to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan es un joven que tiene unión libre con una joven con la que tiene una hija de 4 años,  viven pagando arriendo por un techo en el que residen, el  es un joven colombiano que se dedica a trabajar al jornal y también a la crianza de terneros, es crédito lo necesita para comprar terneros que los va a tener en un potrero por el que paga arriendo de la hierba, Juan junto a su esposa ya viven 10 años en Ecuador y lo que aspira es seguir trabajando y asi lograr tener los ingresos para que su hija se alimente y estudie.
texts.en:
Juan's a young man who lives in a common-law relationship with a young woman with whom he has a 4-year-old daughter.  They rent the house they live in.

He's a young Colombian who earns a living as a day laborer and also raising calves.  He needs this loan to buy calves he's going to keep in a pasture he rents for the grass.

Juan and his wife have lived in Ecuador for 10 years.  He wants to keep on working so he can have the income to feed and educate his daughter.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Eyvar Andres

texts.es: Andres es un joven colombiano de 23 años,  son 13 años que  ya vive en Ecuador formo su hogar y tiene una hija de un año, Adres juntamente con su esposa trabajan en una finca donde cuidan vacas  lecheras y ganado seco, cometa que su patrón le hace poner dos vaconas y no le cobran de la hierba que comen estos animales, con el dinero del crédito va a compra una vacona, Andres tiene planeado seguir trabajando en la ganadería y mas adelante comprar otra vacona,  para que al memento de venderlas le quede una buena ganancia y seguir incrementando la cantidad de sus animales.
texts.en: Andres is 23 year old Colombian man. He has lived in Ecuador for 13 years. He started a family and has a one year-old daughter. Andres and his wife work at a cattle farm where they take care of dairy cows and beef cattle. He explains that his employer lets him keep two cows there and doesn't charge him for the grass the animals eat. With the money from the loan, he will buy a cow. Andres plans to continue working in livestock and in the future plans to buy another cow, so that when he sells them, he'll have good earnings and be able to continue increasing his number of animals.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school.  She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of seasonality with her business. 

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to resell in her cosmetics store.

loans.name: Wei

texts.en:
Wei is a 35-year-old divorced man who is living with his parents without any children. He started to raise pigs five years ago, and at the end of the year, he will sell more than 50 pigs. So far, he has about 30 pigs to raise and they will be sold in the near future. He pays for the whole family's daily costs with the money he earns via raising pigs.
 
Last year, the cost of raising pigs increased, and his parents are getting older and cannot make a living for themselves. In order to improve their living environment and standards, besides raising pigs, Wei hunted for another job as a chef in a restaurant. 

Wei requested 20,000 from MicroCred. He will use the money to rebuild his house to provide a more spacious living situation for his parents so that he can enable them to enjoy old age well. In addition, he will make more effort at his job. He hopes that he will find the right bride in the future.

loans.use: to rebuild his house

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de San Ignacio, está en el ultimo año de mi carrera de administración de empresas, su sueño es poder recibirse  como una profesional y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta luchando y se esfuerza por poder sobresalir, ya que le permitirá ser una buena profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of San Ignacio. She is in her final year of study toward a degree in Business Administration. Her dream is to become accepted as a professional and to improve her quality of life.

Maria is striving and doing her best to move forward since this will allow her to become a successful professional. She is requesting this loan in order to pay the fees for her degree.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver. For four years, she has run a food stall that sells sugarcane juice and soy milk.

Hanh would like a loan to purchase a larger quantity of sugarcane and soy beans. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a larger quantity of sugarcane and soy beans

loans.name: Stephenson

texts.en: Stephenson is a 33-year-old, married man from Kasese, Uganda, who has two children. For two years, Stephenson has been operating a retail shop of general merchandise to earn a living. He begun the business to supplement the little salary that he earns as a teacher. He has a dream of completing his commercial house that will enable him to earn income by renting out. However, he is faced with the challenge of finding lenders and a lack of electricity to help him sell cold drinks. Stephenson wants money to buy doors, sand, and cement to complete his commercial house.

loans.use: to buy doors, sand, and cement to complete his commercial house.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman, and she has three kids, all of whom still attend school. She lives at a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Josephine operates a fruits and vegetables stall; she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of competition and seasonality in her business. 

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits, oranges, bananas and green vegetables for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 60-year-old male. He is married with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. John is a fishmonger and has been in that business for 10 years. 

John has a dream of expanding his business and finishing his residential house. However, he is faced with a challenge of market competition and inadequate capital to meet his dream; thus, he is opting for a loan facility to buy cement, sand and paint for plastering and painting his residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and paint for plastering and painting his residential house.

loans.name: Joife

texts.en:
Joife is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, living in Concepcion, Iloilo, in the Philippines.  She has operated a small repair shop for cellular phones as her source of her income for the past 15 years.  Her husband works as a technician in the shop.

Joife is asking for a loan to buy more cell phone batteries, chargers, and materials for repairs like nuts and screw drivers.  The loan will help her improve spare part availability for cell phones and materials needed to repair the phones.

In the future, Joife hopes to make her business more sustainable and productive.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone batteries, chargers, and materials for repairs like nuts and screw drivers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory for resale

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
This is Peter, who is 44 years old, married and blessed with three children aged between 12 and 20 years.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2012 to be trained in entrepreneurial skills. This has helped him run his butchery business more effectively. His customer base has expanded, making him apply for a loan to buy more beef. This will ensure he keeps up with the rising demand for beef from his customers. He hopes his business will thrive, and hence, generate more income. He plans to use the anticipated income to cater for his children's school fees.

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beef that will help keep up with the rising demand from customers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 35 years old, married with three children, and living in Kasese, Uganda. Julius has sold secondhand clothes for five years now in order to earn a living. Julius has a dream of expanding his business and educating his children to university level. However, he faces a challenge of debtors and market competition. Julius wants money to buy secondhand bedsheets for selling.

loans.use: to buy secondhand bedsheets for selling.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis is 39 years old and he lives with his family in the frontier village of Sevkar of Tavush region, Armenia.  Sargis is married and he has two children.  His elder son studies at college and his daughter is still school-aged.  

Sargis now works at the police station while also engaging with his wife in farming and agriculture.  In his farm he has 3 cows, a horse, a bull, 5 calves, 2 pigs and 20 beehives.  Their son also helps them with the farming business, and from their farm they sell milk, meat, honey, and eggs.  The income from farming greatly helps Sargis to sustain his family's needs, paying for his son’s education, and buying some furniture for his home.  Sargis is especially satisfied from the income from beekeeping, selling a lot of honey.  He hopes that with coming of New Year holiday, he will also manage to sell a lot of meat. 

This loan helps Sargis to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle for the long and cold winter months.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for his farm cattle for the long and cold winter months.

loans.name: Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Godfrey, a member of the Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group. He is 38 years old, married and has three children. He runs a cosmetics shop selling skin care products, body lotions and perfumes. 

Godfrey joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in February 2014, and he has received training on enterprise management and financial planning, which has helped him manage his enterprise more effectively. He needs a loan to add stock to his shop. This will increase his income and help provide for his family needs.

Godfrey is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to pay for more stock for the cosmetic shop, such as skin care products, body lotions and perfumes to help improve his income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase gengeduka stock.

loans.name: Erika Lisseth

texts.es: A sus 22 años de edad Erika esta casada y vive en la casa de su suegra, tiene un hijo de 2 años, su esposo trabaja de albañil, Erika se dedica a la crianza de pollos, el destino del crédito es para comprar  pollos que los adquiere pequeños y que los vende cuando ya están  listos para prepararlos, y es asi su negocio que le deja algo de ganancia, Erika ama mucho a su hijo y su aspiración es trabajar para darle por lo menos lo mas necesario a su bebe.
texts.en: At age 22, Erika is married and lives in the house of her mother-in-law.  She has a two-year-old son.  Her husband works in construction.  Erika works raising chickens.  The purpose of the loan is to buy chickens.  She will acquire them when they’re small, and will sell them when they are ready to cook.  That way, her business will give her some profit.  Erika loves her son very much, and her aspiration is to work to give at least the necessities to her baby.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Joash

texts.en:
Joash is a 72-year-old man, married, with five children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He buys and sells cocoa as his major business, but is also a cocoa farmer.  He is a hard working old man who has maintained his business despite his old age.  He hopes to start a wholesale business but is limited by capital and bad weather, which hinders his dream.  

Joash is requesting a loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Sara Catalina

texts.es: Sara es una joven muy inteligente, tiene 26 años de edad, a la vez que estudia también tiene su restaurante que lo atiende con una empleada, ella vive con sus padres y sus 3 hermanos que también están estudiando, Sara necesita el crédito para compra alimentos para prepararlos y venderlos en desayuno, almuerzo y merienda, lo que Sara aspira es mejorar su negocio y que sus ventas mejores y da las ganancias que le queden seguir pagando sus estudios y llegar a ser una buena profesional.
texts.en: Sara is a very intelligent young woman.  She is 26 years old.  She is in school, and at the same time, she also has her restaurant, which she looks after with an employee.  She lives with her parents and her three siblings, who are also in school.  Sara needs the loan to buy food to prepare and sell during breakfast, lunch, and as afternoon snacks.  Sara aspires to improve her business, improve her sales, and use the profits she keeps to continue paying for her studies and become a good working professional.

loans.use: to buy food for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stylish ready-made women's clothes to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Ross Anabel

texts.es: ROSS ANABEL: Es una joven luchadora de 28 años de edad, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, casada con dos hijos: El mayor de 11 años de edad, estudia su quinto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Su esposo es conductor de un taxi, trabaja como cocinera del Hospital de la Ciudad de Bilwi. Con el propósito de tener su propia vivienda, solicita financiamiento para comprar terreno, actualmente habita en casa de tambo de madera de su suegra.  Su sueño es construir su vivienda de concreto.
texts.en: Ross Anabel is a determined young woman, of 28 years of age.  She is originally from Puerto Cabezas, and she is married with two children.  The elder is 11 years old and is in the fifth grade of primary school, and the younger is 3 years old.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  She works as a cook in the Bilwi City Hospital.  She is requesting a loan to buy land in order to have her own house.  She currently lives in her mother-in-law’s wood stilt house.  Her dream is to build her own house of concrete.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.en:
Salvador is a fifty-five-year-old fish vendor living in Mcarthur, Leyte. He is married with two grown children. He has been engaged in fish vending for more than 20 years.
 
He is in need of capital to sustain his livelihood. Salvador is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP  to buy additional fish to sell and for fish storage. He could then sell more variety of fish. Hopefully, with this, Salvador could earn higher earnings. He could then pay his loan, and provide a healthy diet to the whole family.

In the future, Salvador is hoping that this could be the start to a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy additional fish and fish storage.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: The person appearing in the photo is Esther; she is married and blessed with six children. Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on savings mobilization and enterprise development. She needs a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and hybrid seeds. She hopes that this will improve on crop yield from the anticipated bounty harvest. This will lead to increased levels of income thus enabling her to continue to support her family by providing good clothing, food, and paying school fees. Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and  hybrid seeds to help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 25,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nsubuga

texts.en:
Nsubuga, aged 25, is a hard working Ugandan lady living in Kagadi. She used her previous loan to buy synthetic hair extensions and weaves to sell in her salon, which is her main business alongside selling clothes to supplement her daily income. 

She hopes to grow her business into a unisex salon offering bridal services.  This is due to the challenge of seasonality, especially during the festive season when demand is high and other days when it is low. She intends to use the loan to buy materials for her salon like braids and weaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy materials for her salon like braids and weaves.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
At the frontier village Vazashen of the Tavush region lives Armen with his family. He lives with his retired mother, wife and two small children. Armen has no specialty and it is has been many years that he has used his own car to make cargo transfers around his region. He is also engaged in farming and agriculture. 

On his farm he takes care of a cow, a calf, three pigs and 20 chickens. He has a plot of land on which he cultivates fruit trees and sells sweet harvests of cornel, mulberry, pomegranate and apples. With the help of his mother and wife, Armen sells his farm products such as milk, other dairy-products, meat and eggs. Armen will be greatly happy to receive this loan, since he wants to make his farm bigger and to buy two calves as well as some animal fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy two calves as well as some animal fodder for his all farm cattle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be visionary. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that she will be a successful business lady within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and belts for resale.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.fr: Madame Joséphine née en 1977 est revendeuse de produits d'alimentation générale et des produits de beauté. Pour renforcer son stock, elle demande un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Le gain qu'elle tirera de sa vente lui servira d'agrandir l'activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Son mari est aussi commerçant et ils ont 03 enfants en charge tous scolarisés.
texts.en:
Joséphine was born in 1977, and sells food and beauty products.  She has requested this first loan from the field partner, WAGES, in order to buy more stock.

Joséphine plans to use her profits to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.  Her husband is also a retailer, and they have three children who all attend school.

loans.use: to buy general food and beauty goods for sale.

loans.name: Hanou

texts.fr: Madame Hanou mariée vit avec sa famille à Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des pagnes de façon ambulante. Elle est dans ce domaine depuis 2010 et elle se plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge.  A l'approche des fêtes de fin d'année, elle sollicite un second crédit pour acheter des pagnes afin de satisfaire les clients. A l'avenir, madame Hanou espère ouvrir une boutique et assurer une meilleure éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Hanou is married and lives with her family in Lomé.  She has been selling pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) on foot, since 2010, and makes enough from this activity to support herself.

Hanou has requested this loan in order to prepare for the end of year festivities.  This will be her second loan, and will be used to buy pagnes for sale to her customers.

In the future, Hanou hopes to be able to open a shop and provide for a better education for her children.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits alimentaires, il y a 5 ans, Falilatou désire un cinquième crédit pour acheter des marchandises. Âgée de 32ans, elle a pour conjoint un tradithérapeute et en charge 05 enfants dont 04 scolarisés. Elle souhaite à l'avenir, agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Falilatou has been selling food products for more than five years.  She has requested this fifth loan in order to buy more stock for her shop.

Falilatou is 32 years old and married to a traditional healer.  They have five children, four of whom currently attend school.

In the future, she would like to expand her business and provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs for resale.

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Mariée à un chauffeur, Améyo revend depuis 2008 à domicile des céréales et des produits d'alimentation générale. Elle manque de fonds pour acheter des marchandises c'est pour cela, elle fait un troisième crédit à WAGES. Elle espère développer son activité et assurer la santé de la famille.
texts.en:
Améyo is married to a driver and has been selling cereals and general food products from her home since 2008.  However, she has insufficient funds available to buy more stock.  This is why she has requested this third loan from the field partner, WAGES.

In the future, Améyo would like to develop her business and provide for the health of her family.

loans.use: To buy cereal and food products.

loans.name: Zadock

texts.en: Zadock is a married man. He has six children. He operates a retail shop where he sells bread, sugar, flour and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of enough stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, bread, soap, cooking fat and other items. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, bread, soap, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Amitié 1 Group

texts.fr: Safiatou, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui ont tous été scolarisés et qui travaillent tous aujourd'hui. En tant que responsable du groupe, elle sensibilise les autres membres et les encourage à mener à bien leurs activités pour que le groupe n'ait pas de difficulté à rembourser le crédit. Safiatou a besoin de ce prêt pour acheter au moins 8 sacs d'arachide, du bois pour frire l'arachide,des petits sceaux pour conditionner la pâte et le reste de l'argent permettra de faire les autres dépenses liées. Après ventes, Safiatou dégagera un bénéfice qui lui permettra de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Safiatou is the representative of the 'Amitié 1' Group.  She is married and has five children who all attended school and are all now in work.  As the group representative, she advises the other members and helps them to improve their businesses so that they are all able to repay their loans.

Safiatou plans to use her loan to buy at least eight sacks of peanuts, wood to roast them and small buckets to work the paste.  The remainder of her money will be used for other expenses.

Once she has sold her product, her profits will enable her to further strengthen her business.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of shelled peanuts to prepare peanut paste for sale.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr: A 43ans, Véronique se bat chaque fois pour aider son conjoint dans les charges familiales. Ils ont ensemble 04enfants  dont 03 scolarisés. Elle revend des pagnes au marché et s'approvisionne au Grand Marché de Lomé. Son premier prêt l'aidera à acheter des pagnes afin de répondre aux demandes des clients. Elle espère  vendre en gros  et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
43-year-old Veronique struggles continuously to help her husband with family expenses. They have four children of whom three attend school.

She resells pagnes (colorful West-African fabric) at the local market and resupplies at the main market in Lomé.

Her first loan will help her to buy pagnes to meet customer demands. She hopes to become a wholesaler and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: buy pagnes (colorful West-African fabric)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Sidlawende Ii Group

texts.fr:
Madame LAMOUSSA est la  représentante  du groupe SIDLAWENDE II. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 15 ans et le moins âgé a 05ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Madame vend du bois de chauffe depuis 07 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces.
Elle veut  s’acheter  04 rangées de bois.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lamoussa represents the Sidlawende II group and is doing very well. She is the married mother of four children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old and the youngest is five. Three of them attend school.

She has been selling firewood for the past seven years. She stocks up in the surrounding provinces, and wants to buy four cords of firewood.

She wants to save her profits, and aims to expand her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: buy four cords of firewood

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a married man. He has four children. He operates a retail shop where he sells animal feed and agrovet products. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are farmers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of animal feed and other agrovet products he sells. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be a supplier. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of animal feed and other agrovet products he sells.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a retail shop where she sells sugar, flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in demand. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be a leading wholesaler. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour and other items.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Joyce, married and the mother of eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) in December 2012.

Joyce runs a grocery shop in her village where she sells kale, tomatoes, carrots and cabbages. She is grateful to HIH EA for enterprise training and for her first loan that enabled her to start the business. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to add more stock of vegetables to meet the demand from her customers. She hopes to get more profits to enable her to cater for her family needs such as food and school fees for her children.

Joyce is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more kale, tomatoes, carrots and cabbages to help meet the rising demand from her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy young chickens for rearing and resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric for resale and fruit to make juice.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des céréales (activité qu'elle mène depuis 1989) Ama fait un second prêt à WAGES. Elle revend dans un marché de la place et s'approvisionne au même lieu. Le gain tiré de la vente lui servira d'augmenter son stock et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle a 47ans a pour mari un commerçant.
texts.en:
Ama is requesting a second loan from Wages to buy grain (she has been in business since 1989). She conducts her retail sales at the local market and resupplies in the same location.

Profits from the sales will be used to increase her stock supply and improve her family's living conditions. She is 47 years old and is married to a merchant.

loans.use: buy cereals

loans.name: Dofinisé 2 Group

texts.fr: kassan est la responsable de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 7 enfants dont un travail, 3 filles mariées et les 3 derniers continuent l'école.Cette femme battante dont le mari est couturier, vend du bois de chauffe utilisé encore par beaucoup de ménages burkinabés. Avec ce prêt, elle voudrait acheter du bois vendre en détail. Pour que tout le monde ait accès, elle doit demander les services de bras valide pour fendiller le bois donc une partie de l'argent sera utilisé pour cela. Après vente, le bénéfice lui permettre de continuer son commerce et pourvoir à certains besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kassan is in charge of this group. She is the married mother of seven children: one is at work, three daughters are married, and the last three attend school. This spirited woman - whose husband is a tailor - sells firewood, which is still being used in many Burkinabé households.

She would like to use this loan to buy firewood for retail sales. To ensure everyone has access to her product, she will use part of her loan to have someone split the firewood.

After sales the earnings will enable her to pursue her activity and meet some of her family's needs.

loans.use: buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, tiene 42 años de edad, es una persona dedicada a la siembra de granos básicos, está acompañado, vive con su esposa y un hijo, todos subsisten con los ingresos generados por  la comercialización de una parte de la cosecha, trabaja en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 3:00 p.m., su ventaja es que así alimenta bien a su familia y puede obtener recursos económicos, la desventaja es clima que puede afectar el cultivo.
El capital será de utilidad para pagar mozos que le ayuden a recolectar la cosecha y preparar el terreno para la próxima siembra, de esta manera tener en el tiempo justo los granos básicos para distribuirlos a sus clientes y mejorar las ganancias.
Sus aspiraciones son irse preparando mejor para cada temporada de siembra y tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 42, is dedicated to growing basic grains.  He lives with his wife and a son and they all depend on the income generated by selling part of the harvested crops.  His work schedule is from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and the advantage is that he can feed his family well with the economic resources he obtains.  The disadvantage is the climate that can affect the crop.

The loan money will be used to hire workers to help harvest the crop and prepare the land for the next planting season.  This will allow the exact amount of time to distribute the basic grains to customers and to earn more income.

Miguel's goal is to prepare each planting season better than before and to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To hire workers for crop harvesting and to prepare the land for the next planting season.

loans.name: Rudy Florentino

texts.es:
Rudy de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, esta casado y es padre de dos hijos, su esposa se dedica a la venta de platillos tipicos, sus hijos estudian tercer y primer grado de educacion basica.

 Rudy sale de su casa a las 4:00 am de la madrugada para llegar a su trabajo temprano y regresa a las 7:00 pm él labora como jardinero en la capital del país, aunque le toca pesado viajar todos los dias para llegar a su trabajo él se siente bien porque obtiene buenos ingresos, antes trabajaba como corralero y motorista en una granja pero se vio limitado economicamente ya que tiene que cubrir las necesidades del hogar.

El préstamo lo necesita para construir su casa propia porque donde vive actualmente alquila, aunque no la construira de ladrillo, pero por lo menos vivira en lo propio y no tendra que preocuparse en pagar alquiler. Comprara, arena, cemento, adobe, tejas, madera.

 Rudy sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad convertidos en profecionales, cuidar a su esposa y seguir trabajando con entuciasmo.
texts.en:
Rudy, 29, finished third grade. He is married and is father to two children. His wife is dedicated to selling typical food dishes. His children are in third and first grade at elementary school.

Rudy leaves his house at 4AM so he can arrive at his job early and returns homes at 7PM. He works as a gardener in the country's capital. Although it is a pain to travel every day to get to work, he feels good because he earns good income. Before, he worked as a cowboy and driver on a farm but he thought it was economically limited since he needed to cover his home expenses.

He needs the loan to build his own house because he rents where he currently lives. While he will not build with brick, he will at least live in his own place and not have to worry about paying rent. He will buy sand, cement, adobe, tiles and wood.

Rudy dreams of seeing his children graduate from university and become professionals, of taking care of his wife and of continuing to work enthusiastically.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, adobe, tiles, and wood to build his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy paint, clay sculptures to make retouches to clay dolls.

loans.name: Felicita Antonia

texts.es:
Felicita, desempeña el rol de madre y abuela en su familia, ella vive junto a dos nietos de 12 y 15 años de edad, y un hijo de 29 años de edad, todos son dependientes económicamente. Felicita se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, cuenta con un puesto en el mercado, trabaja todos los días, le respaldan 15 años de experiencia en su negocio.
Comprará guineos, manzanas, sandías, aguacates, papas, pepinos y otros productos para fortalecer la venta, espera recuperar la inversión con mejores ganancias y atraer a nuevos clientes.
Sus metas son mantener su negocio para sacar a su familia adelante, cancelar su deuda y que tanto su hijo como nietos culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Felicita plays the role of mother and grandmother in her family. She lives with her two grandchildren who are 12 and 15 years old and a son who is 29. All of them are economically dependent on her. Felicita is dedicated to selling fruits and vegetables. She has a stall in the market and works every day. She is supported by 15 years experience in her business.

She will buy bananas, apples, watermelons, avocados, potatoes, cucumbers and other products to strengthen sales. She hopes to pay back the investment with improved earnings and attract new customers.

Her goals are to maintain her business in order to get her family ahead, pay back her debt and that her son and grandchildren finish a university course.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, watermelons, avocados, potatoes, cucumbers and other products to strengthen sales.

loans.name: Ana Esperanza

texts.es:
Ana tiene 50 años edad, esta casada y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 estan en el extranjero y los dos mas pequeños se encuentran estudiando, Ana y su esposo han logrado salir adelante juntos trabajando siempre para que nada les faltara a sus hijos, Ana posee una tienda donde ofrece articulos de primera necesidad. El esposo de Ana se dedica a la agricultura cultiva frijoles, maíz y maicillo. Ana tiene varios años de poseer la tiendita, ademas tiene un molino y venta de pollos de engorde en este oficio ya tiene tres años. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar pollos ya que se acerca la temporada navideña que es cuando mas se logra vender más y ya tiene varios encargos por sus clientes. En un futuro Ana desea que sus dos hijos que aun estan con ella culminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Ana is 50 years old. She is married and is mother to six children. Four are overseas and the other two youngest are in school. Ana and her husband have managed to get ahead working together always so that their children lack nothing. Ana has a shop where she sells basic necessity items. Ana's husband is dedicated to farming, growing beans, maize and sorghum. Ana has owned her little shop for many years. Additionally, for three years, she has owned a mill and sells chickens.

She needs the loan to buy chickens since the Christmas season approaches which is when she manages to sell more and she already has many orders from her customers. In the future, Ana wishes that her two children who are still with her finish their university educations.

loans.use: to buy chickens since the Christmas season approaches which is when she sells more.

loans.name: Rayito De Luna Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “RAYITO DE LUNA” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Heydi es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: macramé de mantas, venta de coca, venta de comida, venta de polleras, venta de viguetas, tienda de barrio, compra de verduras.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Heidy es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de viguetas; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cemento por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y vive con sus padres.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Rayito de Luna' will begin its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as a part of the regional office of Patacamaya. The group has 8 members and is directed by a governing board on which Señora Heydi sits as treasurer. The members of the group undertake a diverse range of work: macramé blanket making, running a general store, vegetable buying, and the sale of cocoa, food, joists and beams, and traditional Andean skirts. 

This loan will benefit a group of small business owners of which Señora Heydi is a member. She has indicated that this is her first time working with Pro Mujer, and that she was invited to join by a promoter of Pro Mujer who came to visit her in her home. At the moment, she has a business which produces and sells beams and joists for construction. She tells us that she learned this business from her parents, as when she was a girl she helped out with the family business. Now that she has a family of her own, she has decided to start her own business. 

She will use the loan to increase her capital, buying cement at wholesale, which she plans to purchase from wholesalers in El Alto (a city neighbouring El Paz). After preparing it for sale, she will sell it in the markets of her community. This type of work allows her to make a better income to help her family, since she is single and lives with her parents. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training courses that they offer.

loans.use: to buy cement at wholesale.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 41-year-old married man who operates a habal-habal (simply a motorbike with driver for rent). He earns by imposing a certain fee for a particular distance. He has six children. His oldest child is 20 and the youngest is four month old. Aside from that, he is engaged in a bread vending business. He sells bread to the nearby households to augment his income. He has been engaged in this kind of business for five years now.

Reynaldo is asking for a loan to buy more bread to sell and additional capital for the motorcycle services like fuel, extra tires and maintenance. This will provide his passengers a hassle-free ride. In this way, he can buy and sell more bread, thus increasing his income and eventually he can afford to buy good food and have better living conditions.

In the future, Reynaldo would like to expand both of his businesses to improve his livelihood and support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy more bread to sell and pay for motorcycle services like fuel, extra tires and maintenance

loans.name: Eglis José

texts.es: Eglis, actualmente esta trabajando como guardia de seguridad en una constructora inmobiliaria, su   negocio inició porque identifico un potencial en sus compañeros de trabajo quienes se encuentran trabajando como obreros de la constructora y tenían que buscar restaurantes aledaños donde almorzar, fue desde entonces que Eglis comenzó a llevar almuerzos para la venta y hoy día vende en promedio 45 almuerzos diarios, de hecho tuvo que contratar a un ayudante para la elaboración de los almuerzos. Estos exquisitos platillos se les entregan a sus compañeros en su sitio de trabajo y se les ofrece facilidad de pago a los que lo requieran, él vende de lunes a sábado en el horario de 5 a.m. a 2 p.m., sus compras las realiza de contado en Granabastos (central de abastos) por lo que  en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo capital que utilizará en la compra de víveres como arroz, aceite, azúcar entre otros para la preparación de sus comidas, así como para la adecuación de la cocina y  dos mesas industriales.  Él tiene un hijo de 23 años y una hija de 18 años a quienes desea que continúen estudiando por eso él trabaja con compromiso y dedicación en estas dos actividades. Eglis espera que con esta inversión logre una mayor agilidad en la preparación de los alimentos y con ello pueda obtener mejores beneficios financieros.
texts.en:
Eglis is currently working as a security guard at a construction company.  He set up his business upon discovering the potential for it among his co-workers who had to look for restaurants in the area to have lunch.  Eglis began taking meals to sell and now he serves an average 45 lunches a day.  He even had to hire an assistant to make the meals.  He delivers his delicious dishes to his co-workers in their workplace and offers them easy payment terms.  His sales take place Monday through Saturday, from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.  He makes his purchases in cash at Granabastos (wholesale market) so he is currently applying for a CrediKiva loan, his first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  He will use the capital to buy goods such as rice, oil, sugar and others to prepare his meals.  He will also renovate his kitchen and buy two industrial tables.

Eglis has a 23-year-old son and an 18-year-old daughter who he wants to continue studying.  That is why he works with such commitment and dedication to his two jobs.  He hopes that this loan will give him greater flexibility when preparing the food he makes in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, oil, sugar and others to prepare meals, as well as renovate the kitchen and buy two industrial tables.

loans.name: Mina De Las Flores Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MINA DE LAS FLORES” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Dora es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de lubricantes, venta de rellenos, venta de carne ovina y vacuna.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Dora es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; nos cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió con un capital pequeño, posteriormente fue expandiendo su capital pero se estaciono es por ello que solicita crédito para seguir su ampliación.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de heladera y helados por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es viuda y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución
texts.en:
The "Mina de las Flores" community bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board where Dora is the Treasurer. The businesses that the members of the community association manage are varied. Among them are: selling food, neighborhood grocery store, selling lubricants, selling fillings, selling poultry and beef.

The loan taken will benefit the small businesses where Dora is a member. She indicates that this is the first time she has joined Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a promoter of the institution who visited her at home. Currently, she has a neighborhood shop. She tells us that she started this business with a small amount of capital. Later she was expanding but her capital was limited. It is for this reasons that she is requesting a loan to keep expanding.

The loan that she will now take is to buy a refrigerator and ice cream at wholesale that she will acquire from wholesale vendors from the city of El Alto and later she will sell from her store. This form of work allows her to generate the resources to support her family since she is a widow and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and ice cream at wholesale.

loans.name: Ludy

texts.en:
Ludy is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. She runs a small sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income.

Ludy is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, rice. soda and beverages. With this loan, Ludy will be able to improve her inventories, thus allowing her to attract more buyers in her store. 

In the future, Ludy hopes to make her business stable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap and toiletries, rice, soda and beverages

loans.name: Daila Luz

texts.es: Daila, emprendedora mujer de 48 años de edad, quien desde muy joven aprendió a cocinar y su gusto por este oficio la encaminó a trabajar en varios restaurantes en la ciudad de Barranquilla. En el año 2012, basada en sus experiencias anteriores y con toda ésta trayectoria en la preparación y manipulación de alimentos, inició su restaurante en el cual ofrece una carta de comidas variadas y exquisitas, que brinda a sus principales clientes que son operarios de empresas aledañas, vecinos, amigos y familiares, quienes cancelan de contado o algunos solicitan facilidad de pago.  Sus compras las realiza de contado en tiendas y expendios de carnes ubicados en la ciudad de Barranquilla, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en insumos para la preparación de sus comidas como arroz, aceite, carnes, verduras y aderezos y en activos fijos; estufa industria, carpa, sillas y mesas. Daila trabaja todos los días en el horario de 7 a.m. a 2 p.m., con la certeza de vender todas las comidas que elabore y su positivismo hace que su negocio sea exitoso.  Su meta familiar es mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daila, 48, is an entrepreneur who learned to cook when she was very young; and she liked it so much that she worked for several restaurants in the city of Barranquilla.  In 2012, based on her previous experience and food handling expertise, she opened a restaurant where she offers a varied menu of exquisite dishes.  Her main customers are workers from nearby companies, neighbors, friends and relatives who pay in cash.  Sometimes someone requests credit terms.  She makes her purchases in cash at shops and meat distributors in Barranquilla.  So she is applying for a CrediKiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to buy food ingredients such as rice, oil, meat, vegetables, and condiments as well as fixed assets such as an industrial stove, a tent, tables and chairs.

Daila works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. with the knowledge that she will sell all the food she makes and the certainty that her business will be successful.  Her goal is to improve the family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, oil, meats, vegetables and condiments.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is a resident of Baybay, Leyte where she raises hogs to support her family. She is 21 years old and married but without a child. For two years, Antonia has been engaged in farming sweet potato, banana and cassava. She is also into hog raising. Antonia plans to expand her business by selling prepaid loads to mobile users and selling barbecue at night. She is asking for a loan to buy piglets, feed, prepaid loads, pork, soy sauce and spices.

If she has more hogs to sell, then she will make more money. Some of the funds will also go towards purchasing a good supply of feed to keep the hogs healthy and fatten them up before they are sold.

Antonia dreams of being a successful businesswoman so she can save for her future children.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, prepaid loads, pork, soy sauce and spices

loans.name: Marta Herminia

texts.es:
Marta, tiene 39 años de edad, es casada, su esposo tiene 42 años de edad y tienen dos hijos, la familia vive junta, ella se dedica a vender empanadas, pastelitos, tamales y otras meriendas, el oficio lo aprendió con su madre, lo fundo hace 3 años, trabaja todos los días en colaboración con su madre, de esta manera puede generar ingresos para apoyar en la disminución de las necesidades familiares.
Invertirá en plátanos, elotes, azúcar, aceite, gas propano, harina, etc., para elaborar la venta, mantendrá su trabajo estable y sus ingresos serán mejores, espera que la productividad aumente y que los clientes sean más.
Sus sueños son fortalecer más su negocio, cancelar sus deudas y darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Marta, 39, is married.  Her husband is 42 years old and they have two children.  The family lives together and Marta earns a living selling meat pies, small pastries, tamales and other snack foods.  She learned the trade from her mother and established her business three years ago.  She works with her mother all day long and earns a good income to cover household needs.

She will buy bananas, corn, sugar, oil, propane gas, flour, etc. to continue with her sales work.  This will keep her job stable and improve her income.  She hopes to increase productivity and attract more customers.

Her goal is to strengthen her business, pay off debt and give her family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy bananas, corn, sugar, oil, propane gas, flour, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rosa Armida

texts.es: Rosa tiene 35 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura tiene 3 años. Vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abonos orgánicos y fertilizantes para empezar a sembrar maiz y obtener una producción buena ya que es la única actividad que realiza. Realiza las compras en Ventanas, su sueño es sacar adelante a sus hijos , le gusta leer y pasear con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 35, has been working in agriculture for three years.  She lives in Ventanans in the province of Los Rios.  The loan she is requesting is to buy organic fertilizers to start planting corn in the hopes of obtaining an abundant harvest since this is the only activity she has.

She makes her purchases in Ventanas and her goal is to raise her children.  She enjoys reading and taking walks with her children.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria, de 21 años, tiene muy claro que es lo que quiere para su vida y está decidida a culminar sus estudios para salir adelante y tener una buena vida.

Ella desea desempeñarse como vendedora de mercancía variada tales como ropa, accesorios como billeteras y algunos cosméticos, entre otros, en el municipio de La Dorada.
