Esta actividad desea iniciarla con el afán de buscar los recursos necesarios para su sostenimiento y para sus estudios, además de poder contribuir con los gastos en su hogar.
Es una mujer emprendedora y muy disciplinada.

Ella solicita un crédito para comprar un amplio surtido de ropa al por mayor y de este modo aprovechar la oportunidad que le presenta la Corporación Interactuar de ser independiente.

Tiene la esperanza de poder progresar como empresaria y tener unos ingresos más estables y agradece a todas las personas que puedan contribuir con su sueño.
texts.en:
María is 21 years and is very clear about what she wants in life. She wants to finish her studies and wants to get ahead and have a good life.

María wants to work as a vendor in the municipality of La Dorada; she would like to sell various merchandise such as clothes, accessories, such as wallets and some cosmetics, and more.

María wants to start this work in order to earn the money to support herself and pay for her education, as well as help with household expenses.

María is an enterprising and very disciplined woman.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy stock (clothes) in bulk to sell and take advantage of this opportunity from "Corporación Interactuar" to be independent.

María hopes to be able to move forward as a businesswoman, and to have a more stable income. She is grateful to all those who can contribute to this dream.

loans.use: to buy stock (clothes) in bulk to sell.

loans.name: Ghazi

texts.en: Ghazi is a 50-year-old married man living in Zarqa. Ghazi has opened his own mini-market after getting experience from working at different mini-markets and working as a salesman. He is asking for a loan to buy more food products and detergents to sell.

loans.use: to buy more food products and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Kayi est revendeuse de charbon de bois  depuis 2006. Elle a une famille (mari et 02 enfants de 16 et 12ans qui sont scolarisés à Lomé). Elle sollicite un quatrième crédit pour acheter des marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Comme perspectives d'avenir, elle souhaite agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille. Elle est âgée de 29ans.
texts.en:
Kayi is a retailer of charcoal since 2006. She has a family (a husband and two children 16 and 12 years of age, attending school in Lomé).

She is requesting a fourth loan to buy merchandise so she can meet her customers' needs. Her future prospects are to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions. She is 29 years old.

loans.use: buy charcoal

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie vit avec son conjoint plombier et leur enfant à Lomé. Elle est couturière de profession et revend des boissons. Elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour acheter des boissons afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients.  A l'avenir, elle souhaite réinvestir et subvenir les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Marie lives in Lomé with her husband, a plumber, and their child. She's a seamstress by trade and resells beverages.

She's seeking a third loan to buy beverages in order to meet customer demand.

In the future, she would like to reinvest and provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy beverages

loans.name: Dior's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 27 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 03 septembre 2013. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier et les environs. Les membres sont solidaires et vivent dans la bonne entente. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Arame, debout en cinquième position à partir de la droite en pullover rouge à rayures et Pantalon jean bleu est âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont 01 garçon. Elle gère un salon de coiffure. Elle est coiffeuse de profession et fait cette activité depuis près de 05 ans. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine et s'en sort parfaitement bien. Cependant, avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter du parfum et du lait de toilettes. Elle achète pour une valeur de 20000 FCFA de parfum et 20000 FCFA de lait de toilettes. Le reste de l'argent va lui servir de fonds de roulement. Elle achète le parfum à 600 FCFA et le revend à 1000 F; le lait de toilettes lui coûte 1500 F et elle le revend à 1750 FCFA.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce son épargne, paie ses intérêts et le reste pour ses besoins personnelles.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on September 3, 2013. It is made up of 27 members who live in the same neighborhood and its surroundings. The members help each other and live in good harmony. Their main business is retail.

Arame, age 29, is the fifth woman from the right in the standing row. She's wearing a red pullover with stripes and a blue jean. She's married and the mother of two children, one boy and one girl.

She's a trained hairdresser, and she's been running a hair salon for the past five years. She's very much experienced in this field and manages perfectly well.

She intends to use her loan to buy XOF 20'000 worth of perfume and XOF 20'000 worth of cosmetic milk. The remainder of the money will be used as working capital.

She buys perfume for XOF 600 and resell it for XOF 1'000. Cosmetic milk costs her XOF 1'500 and she resells it for XOF 1'750.

She will use her profits to bolster her savings and repay the loan. The remainder will be used to provide for herself.

loans.use: to buy perfume and cosmetic milk

loans.name: Iriba Ryiza Group

texts.fr:
Ally  fait partie du groupe  Iriba ryiza et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il a 43 ans et est mariée à Pierrette, une comptable. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 11 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Il a sous sa charge un orphelin qui étudie. 

Il fait le commerce de  boissons et charbon  depuis  2 ans. 

Il est à  son deuxième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup  de caisses de bière à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait faire le commerce de verres, et voir se enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Ally lives in Bujumbura and is a member of Iriba Ryiza Group. He's 43 years old and married to Pierrette, an accountant. They have four children together, aged 1 to 11. Three of them go to school. Ally also has an orphan who goes to school in his care.

Ally has been selling beverages and charcoal for the past two years. He's seeking his second loan from Kiva's partner, Turame. He will use it to increase his working capital and buy may beer cases to resell in order to earn more.

In the forthcoming years, he would like to sell glasses and see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many beer cases

loans.name: Julia Virginia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 37 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos de 21, 19 y 9 años, y su negocio es la venta de productos naturales para la salud.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, responsable, generosa, comprensiva, paciente y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ’16 de julio’ un área caracterizada por su populosa feria que se lleva a cabo los días jueves y domingos, donde se puede encontrar desde una aguja para coser hasta un tractor para arar. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura promedio de 2-18 grados centígrados que varía durante el día.
Julia es de tez morena, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y para el comercio. Su vida la realiza con su esposo que se dedica al transporte interprovincial como chofer asalariado, y con sus hijos; los mayores trabajan y estudian, y el menor estudia en la escuela. La familia vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo, que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de productos naturales como; hierbas que ayudan a bajar de peso, otras que ayudan a recuperar la energía y a despejar la mente, también compuestos de aloe vera que ayudan a limpiar el estómago y a cicatrizar heridas en él, está la malteada que es como el plato fuerte porque tiene muchas proteínas, pero lo mejor de todo es que no sólo ayuda a estar bien por fuera si no por dentro, entre sus novedades están los productos para el cáncer, para la gripa para muchos males porque es una nutrición completa, pero todo esto tiene que estar vigilado por un distribuidor autorizado. “mi negocio es la venta de productos naturales para aliviar todo tipo de males, son garantizados porque los clientes  vuelven a comprarme una y otra vez…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una tienda de  venta en un lugar fijo y desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de productos naturales por mayor, para abastecer a sus clientes y aprovechar las ventas de fin de año. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 7 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de medicina natural por mayor para abastecer a sus clientes de la temporada.
texts.en:
Julia is a 37 year old married woman, who has three children, ages 21, 19 and nine years old.  Her business is the sale of natural health products. She is a good mother, enterprising, responsible, generous, kind, patient and hard-working.   Julia's business is in the  "July 16th" area, which is known for its well-attended market which takes place on Thursdays and Sundays, where one can find everything from a sewing needle to a tractor for plowing.  The climate is cold and dry with an average temperature between 2 and 18 degrees Centigrade in the course of day.
  
Julia has brown skin and is short in stature.  She dresses in traditional style wearing a hat, shawl and multi-layered skirt.
 Her mother tongue is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish through general knowledge and for business purposes.  She spends her life with her husband who earns a living in interprovincial trnsportation as a salaried chaufffeur, and with her children.  The older children go to school and work, and the youngest is in school.  The family lives in their own house built of bricks, with running water, electricity and gas.  

Julia's business is the sale of natural products such as herbs to help people lose weight, others to help one renew energy and clear one's mind, and mixtures of aloe vera which help to clean out the stomach and heal lesions.  Her products include a milkshake which is like a  main meal because it has lots of protein, but  best of all  helps to make one well outside and inside.  Among the items she sells are ones for cancer treatment, for colds, and for many illnesses because of providing complete nutrition.  All this must be watched over by an authorized distributor.
  
"My business is selling natural products to relieve every kind of problem; they are guaranteed because the customers return to buy them from me again and again," she comments.  Julia's dream is to have a store as her fixed place of sale and she wants to make an investment in her business by buying natural health products wholesale, to fulfill her customer's needs and take advantage of the end of the year sales.  Julia has been in business for seven years, and this is the first loan she has sought with this institution.  This  is  the reason that Julia is seeking a loan: to buy natural medicine products in bulk to meet here customers' needs in this season.

loans.use: to buy natural medicine products to meet her customers' needs in this end-of-the-year season

loans.name: Mareme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 35 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été créé le 03 septembre 2013. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier et les environs. Les membres sont solidaires et vivent dans la bonne entente. Leur principale activité est le commerce.
Amy, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est veuve et est mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles. Elle fait comme activité principale la teinture et le commerce. Elle teint des pièces de tissus qu'elle revend dans sa localité et les grandes villes. Elle fait cette activité depuis longtemps et a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. Elle va acheter des pièces de tissus à 20000 FCFA la pièce; la teinture lui revient à 50000 FCFA et la main d’œuvre à 2500 F. Elle revend les tissus teints entre 16000 et 17500 FCFA les 3 yards.
Les bénéfices lui permettent des participer à des tontines et aussi de pourvoir aux besoins de la famille du fait qu'elle est veuve et se retrouve seule soutien de famille.
texts.en:
This group is part of the Banc Villageois that was established on September 3, 2013. It is made up of 35 members who live in the same neighborhood and its surroundings. The members support each other and live in good harmony. Their main business is retail.

Amy, age 57, is standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's a widow and the mother of seven children, three of them girls. Her main business is dyeing and retailing.

She dyes pieces of fabrics that she resells in her village and in larger cities. She's been running this business for a long time, and she's very much experienced in this field.

She will buy lengths of fabrics costing XOF 20'000 a piece. The dye costs her XOF 50'000, and labor costs XOF 2'500. She resells the dyed fabrics between XOF 16'000 and 17'500 for three yards. 

Her profits enable her to participate in tontines, as well as provide for her family's needs. Indeed, being a widow, she's the family's only breadwinner.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and dyes

loans.name: Mitedio

texts.en: Mitedio is a 60-year-old man married with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is a very hardworking man who deals in cocoa buying and selling to supplement what he harvests from his cocoa garden. He has been in this business since 2000 and is proud of it after realizing some good profits from it. His business dream is to expand his cocoa garden and become a leading cocoa producer in his town although he complains of seasonality changes. Mitedio intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood and nails, and pay for the labor needed to finish building her house.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es:
El señor Jose es un hombre muy emprendedor y creativo, desde hace mucho tiempo ha querido ser independiente y tener su propio negocio de taller y montallantas

Actualmente puede materializar su sueño gracias su gran capacidad de trabajo, al apoyo que recibe de la Corporación Interactuar y de las personas que deseen que él salga adelante con su negocio.

De este negocio dependerán su esposa y sus hijos a los cuales desea enseñarles del negocio y dejarles un legado.

Solicita un apoyo económico para comprar un compresor, hidrolavadora, herramienta de mano y elementos de limpieza.

Con un préstamo podrás a poyar a un veterano lleno de vida y empuje para su familia!
texts.en:
Jose is a very enterprising and creative man. He has wanted to go off on his own and have his own mechanic shop and tire change business. Right now, he can make his dream come true thanks to his great work capacity. to the support he receives from the Corporación Interactuar, and from the people who want to see him get ahead with his business.  

His wife and his children will depend on this business. He wants to teach them about the business and leave them a legacy. He is asking for financial support to buy a compressor, a power washer, hand tools and cleaning supplies. 

With a loan, you can help support a veteran full of life and drive for his family.

loans.use: to buy a compressor, a power washer, hand tools and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Leydi Elizabeth

texts.es: Leydi de 29 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se desempeña como cocinera de un restaurante de playa y es gracias a ello que ha logrado sostener la economía de su hogar y apoyar a su compañero de vida que se desempeña como jornalero de una hacienda cercana. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que habita al lado de su compañero de vida y sus 2 hijos de 3 y 14 años de edad, y es por ello que tanto se esfuerza. Leydi sabe que para construir una casa de cemento debe realizar una gran inversión, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, hierro y mano de obra para construir pilares y encementar el piso de su vivienda y lograr así construir poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leydi, 29, is an entrepreneurial woman who works as a cook for a beach restaurant. Thanks to this activity, she has been able to sustain her family and help her life partner, who works as a day laborer for a nearby farm. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her life partner and three children aged 2, 3, and 14. They are the reason why she works so hard.

Leydi knows that she has to invest a lot if she wants to build a cement house, and this is why she is requesting a loan at FUSAI. She will use it to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron bars, and pay for the labor needed to build the foundations and lay the floor. She will be able to build her house, step by step.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and iron bars, and pay for the labor needed to build the foundations and lay the floor.

loans.name: Judith Raquel

texts.es:
Judith, se dedica a vender tortillas y antojitos, en sus inicios solo se dedicaba a vender tortillas, con las ganancias ha ido progresando y hoy cuenta también con la venta de pastelitos, enchiladas, etc.; tiene casa propia, vive con su esposo quien es empleado y dos hijos que están estudiando.
Comprará sartenes, cucharas, moldes, etc., así tendrá los medios para mejorar la productividad, continuara realizando las ventas día con día para tener ingresos fijos.
Sus aspiraciones son cancelar su deuda, ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Judith sells tortillas and snacks. At first she only sold tortillas, and with her profits she progresses and today she sells pastries, enchiladas, etc. She has her own house and lives with her husband, who is an employee, and their two children, who are in school.  

She will buy pans, spoons, molds, etc. That way, she will have the tools to improve productivity. She will continue to sell day to day to have stable income.  

She aspires to pay off her debt, expand her business, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pans, spoons, molds, etc. so she can have the tools to improve productivity.

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es: Juan vive en Ventanas provincia de los Rios, tiene 23 años de edad vive con su hijo y se dedica a la agricultura ya que no tiene otra fuente de trabajo, solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas de maíz e insumos para luego sembrar y obtener una buena producción para así solventar los gastos de su familia . Realiza las compras en Ventanas. Su sueño es comprarse un terreno y una maquina para la agricultura. En su tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en: Juan lives in Ventanas, Los Rios province. He is 23 years old and lives with his son. He works in agriculture and since he has no other source of income, he is asking for the loan to buy corn seeds and materials for planting to obtain a good yield so he can pay his family's expenses. He makes his purchases in Ventanas. His dream is to buy a plot of land and a machine for agriculture. In his free time, he likes to play sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials.

loans.name: Amitié 2 Group

texts.fr: Marie Florence, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous scolarisés. Elle fait le commerce des draps de lit et cela fait plus de 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Marie Florence et les autres membres, utilisent consciencieusement leur prêt. Elles font des épargnes au sein de notre institution et remboursent leur prêt sans problème. Avec ce prêt, Marie Florence compte acheter des draps de différentes qualités pour vendre à sa clientèles.les bénéfices lui permettront de continuer son activités.
texts.en: Marie Florence, the group representative, is a married mother to four children who are all currently receiving an education. She has been selling bedsheets for over 10 years. Marie Florence and the other group members are very conscientious when it comes to spending their loan money. They invest savings within our institution and pay back their loans without any problems. With this loan, Marie Florence is planning to purchase bedsheets of varying qualities which will be resold to her customers. The profits will allow her to carry on her business.

loans.use: to purchase bedsheets which will be resold

loans.name: Rina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rina de 48 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora dedicada a su hogar, su esposo y sus hijos. 

Su esposo quien se dedica a la pesca artesanal, es el pilar del hogar de Rina. Ella vende el pescado que su esposo saca diariamente del mar, Rina sale cada día a vender casa por casa, ella sabe que el comercio del pescado es una fuente de ingreso muy importante; ademas de proporcionarle alimentos a sus pequeños hijos. Rina con el efectivo del crédito invertirá en arreglos de su apero y arreglos de sus redes, los cuales son un medio muy importante en la pesca que su esposo diariamente realiza.

A futuro desean tener una calidad de vida estable, que les permita mas comodidad y bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Rina is 48 years old. She is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her home, her husband and her children. 

Her husband, who is a small scale fisherman, is the pillar of Rina's home. She sells the fish that her husband gets every day from the sea. Rina goes out every day to sell door to door. She knows that the fishing business is an important source of income, in addition to providing food to her small children. Rina will invest the money from the loan in repairing her tools and fishing nets. They are very important tools for the fishing that her husband does every day. 

In the future, they want to have a stable quality of life which will allow for more comfort and well being for their family.

loans.use: to make repairs on her tools and her nets. They are a very important for the fishing  that her husband does every day.

loans.name: Ma Famille Group

texts.fr: Fatoumata, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 3 enfants qui ont tous été scolarisés et qui travaillent présentement. Cette dame âgée de 49 ans a commencé a vendre les pagnes à l'age de 12 ans et continue de le faire aujourd'hui. Avec ce crédit, elle aimerait acheter des pagnes de qualité( Hitarget, real) et des coupons pour vendre surtout avec ses fêtes.Le bénéfice lui permettra de renforcer son activités et faire ses petites dépenses.
texts.en: Fatoumata, the group representative, is a married mother to three children who all received an education and who are all currently employed. This 49-year-old vendor started selling traditional pagne cloth when she was 12 years old and she continues to do so to this day. With this loan, she would like to purchase pagne cloth of varying qualities (Hitarget, Real) as well as offcuts which will be resold for important celebrations. The profits will allow her to strengthen her business and pay for her necessities.

loans.use: to purchase traditional pagne cloth which will be resold

loans.name: Marbelly Del Socorro

texts.es: Marbelly ha logrado salir adelante con su pequeño negocio de pulpería, este es el segundo crédito que obtiene con KIVA-MICREDITO y le ha sido de mucha ayuda es por eso que solicita el crédito para comprar Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Gaseosas, Jugos entre otros productos.  Este segundo préstamo le será de mucha ayuda porque podrá obtener buenas ganancias y lograra surtir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Marbelly has managed to get ahead with her little grocery store business. This is her second loan that she is getting with KIVA-MICREDITO and it has been very helpful. It is for this reason that she asks for a loan to purchase rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks and joice among other products. This second loan will be very helpful because she will be able to get good income and will manage to supply her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase rice, benas, sugar, soft drinks, and juice, among other products.

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia es una mujer emprendedora que cuenta con 50 años de vida y desde hace 18 años se desempeña como atención al cliente en una venta de electrodomésticos, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con esta fuente de ingresos económicos. Ella habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su hijo, desde hace 18 años por lo que se siente agradecida de poder contar con un lugar donde vivir. Eusebia desea construir una pila en su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con un deposito adecuado en el cual guardar agua para el uso de su hogar, además desea instalar ladrillo de piso en la misma y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo de piso, y hierro para construir una pila e instalar ladrillo de piso en su vivienda.
texts.en: Eusebia is an enterprising woman who is 50 years old, and for the past 18 years, she has worked as customer service in household appliance sales, for which she is happy to have this source of income. She has lived in her own house with her husband and child, for the past 18 years, for which she is grateful to have a place to live. Eusebia wants to build a pila [a large outdoor water basin] in her home, since she doesn't have an adequate place to store water for household use. In addition, she wants to install a brick floor in the same house, and for this she is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, floor bricks, and iron to construct a large water basin and a brick floor in her house.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, floor bricks, and iron to build a pila [a large water basin] and install brick flooring in her house.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de campo y madre de 2 hijos por los que ha tenido que pasar por muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para salir adelante y continuar progresando con su familia.
Desde hace tiempo ha querido montar un negocio de cría y venta de pollos.

Es por eso que solicita un gran aliento económico para comprar algunos pollos para cría y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.

Con este nuevo negocio podrá generar ingresos para su familia que es todo para ella y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposo y sus hijos.

Trabajara todos los días para impulsar su negocio y hacerlo una actividad sostenible y rentable.

Apoya a una mujer trabajadora con un préstamo!
texts.en:
Maria is a woman of the countryside and mother to two children, for whom she has had to go through many adversities in her life. However, she has always had the strength to get ahead and continue progressing with her family.

For some time, she has wanted to undertake a business raising and selling chickens.

This is why she asks for a great economic support to purchase some chickens to raise and materials to build a shed.

With this new business, she will be able to generate income for her family, who is everything for her, and will be able to impve the quality of life of her husband and their children.

She will work every day to boost her business and to make it sustainable and profitable.

Support this hard-working woman with a loan!

loans.use: to purchase some chickens to raise and materials to construct a shed.

loans.name: Dadiana Milena

texts.es:
Dadiana, radicada zona rural del municipio de Támesis, siempre se ha desempeñado en el sector agropecuario al lado de su familia donde aprendió estos menesteres. 

Lleva unos meses con su propia cría de cerdos de engorde para la venta y distribución en varias zonas del su pueblo. 

Sueña con mejorar el número de cerdos para criar y solicitó a la Corporación Interactuar un crédito con el que adquirirá varios Porcinos y los insumos para la alimentación y sostenimiento de estos.

Las ganancias obtenidas por el aumento de sus animales será mucho mayor lo que le permitirá tener un mejor nivel de vida sin tanta dificultad económica.

De este negocio dependen sus padres a quiénes ayuda mucho con los gastos de su hogar.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una casa propia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dadiana lives in the rural area of Támesis, Colombia and has always worked in agriculture along with her family, from whom she learned about farmwork. 

For the last few months she's been working on her own raising pigs to sell in various areas of the town where she lives. Her dream is to buy more pigs to raise and so she is asking for a loan from Interactuar [Kiva Field Partner] to buy these pigs, and feed for their care and maintenance. 

Having more pigs will mean better earnings for Dadiana, and this will allow her to improve her life without too much economic hardship. Her parents also depend on this income, as she helps out quite a bit with household expenses. 

Dadiana's biggest dream is to have her own house and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy pigs, and feed for their care and maintenance.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 30-year-old woman living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She is married and has four children and they all attend school. 

She deals in used clothes and this is her major source of income, together with her cocoa garden.

She is a hardworking woman who loves her job. She has great hopes of having a bigger business despite the challenge of weather changes, especially the rainy seasons when she can't work since she operates from an open place. 

Joyce has asked for a loan to buy second-hand clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 39-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works in a local company. 

For eight years, she has run a business of selling drinking water. Thanh would like a loan to purchase more drinking water to better serve her customers and to also buy materials and equipment to open another business of making clothes in order to earn some additional money. 

She hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase drinking water to sell and to buy materials and equipment to make clothes to sell.

loans.name: Taghreed

texts.en:
Taghreed is a 22-year-old single lady living in Mafraq. She is trying to finish her fourth year studying child care. Taghreed wants to help her mother with her four siblings since her father passed away. The only income they have is her father’s death pension. 

Taghreed is applying for the loan to pay her semester fees. She’s hoping to find a job in her field.

loans.use: to pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Hilal

texts.en:
Hilal has a wholesale oil and ghee (clarified butter) business in Karachi. He is a hardworking and fair person. He has gained good experience in this business and feels it’s the right time to invest more in the business to make it more profitable given the increasing demand for oil and ghee.
 
Hilal is 51 years old and the father of two children. He wants to start saving money for his children’s marriages and has therefore requested a loan to arrange for the financing to increase his sales. He is hopeful for his business and thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for their ready assistance.

loans.use: to purchase oil and ghee for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy food products and charcoal

loans.name: Monday Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 32 years old, married, and has four children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

Solomon operates a secretarial bureau along side teaching as his profession to increase his family income. He has been in that business for eight years. Solomon has a dream of offering the best secretarial services in the whole area, which will earn him more income from high customer retention. However, he is faced with the challenge of market competition and high transport costs. 

Solomon wants money to buy cement and sand for plastering his residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement and sand for plastering his residential house.

loans.name: Nongtaaba Group

texts.fr: Aminata est la responsable de ce groupe de femme. Elle est mariée et a 8 enfants. Elle et les autres membres travaillent avec ACFIME depuis Octobre 2011 et jusque là, les remboursements se font correctement. Ce groupe fait parti des bons clients de l'institution. Avec ce prêt, Aminata compte acheter des plats, des assiettes et des céréales pour vendre. Cette brave dame fait plusieurs activités à la fois, elle compte embauché à l'avenir au moins un employé pour l'aider. le bénéfices lui permettra de s'occuper de sa famille et de continuer son activités.
texts.en:
Aminata is the person responsible for this group of women. She is married and has eight children.

She and the other members have been working with ACFIME since October 2011 and until now, reimbursements have been made correctly. This group is one of the institution's better clients.

Aminata will use this loan to buy dishes, plates and cereals to resell. This fine lady runs several activities at the same time, and in the future envisions hiring at least one employee to assist her.

Profits will enable her to take care of her family and pursue her activities.

loans.use: buy dishes, plates and cereals to resell

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft-drink retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of soft-drinks to sell to customers.

Rubilyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Rubilyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft-drinks to sell

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is 48 years old and married with eight children. Four of her children are in school.

Shirly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Shirly has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from vegetables vending.

Shirly aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 39-year-old married man with seven children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He operates a retail shop and it has helped him to look after his family.  He has stayed in the business for six years and he is proud of it because he has been able to take his children to school.  He hopes to educate his children though he is affected by limited capital.

He wants a loan to buy merchandise for his shop like sodas, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise for his shop like sodas, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Marta Luz

texts.es: Marta de 49 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida, por lo que se siente feliz de tener un lugar digno donde descansar. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que desde muy temprano se prepara con los ingredientes para elaborar los tamales que luego pasa vendiendo por las calles de los cantones cercanos, además  vende ropa interior y productos de belleza para obtener así ingresos extra, lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar junto a su compañero de vida que se dedica a la albañilería. Marta desea que sus diversas ventas sean mejores e instalar una pequeña granja de pollos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa interior, blusas, faldas, camisas, pollos, vitaminas y concentrado. Para invertir en sus negocios, además instalar una pequeña granja de pollos en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marta is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner. She feels happy about having a decent place to sleep. 

She is a very enterprising woman: very early in the morning she starts preparing the ingredients to make the tamales that she takes onto the streets to sell in the nearby districts. She also sells underwear and beauty products to make a bit of extra money, which has allowed her to financially support the household with the help of her life partner who is a bricklayer. 

Marta hopes to add more variety to what she sells and to install a small chicken farm which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in: underwear, blouses, skirts, chickens, vitamins and chicken feed. She wants to invest in her businesses as well as install a small chicken farm on her premises.

loans.use: to invest in: underwear, blouses, skirts, shirts, chickens, vitamins and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ananias

texts.en:
Ananias is 52 years old from Baybay, Leyte.  He is married with one adult son. 

For the last five years, Ananias is operating a copra business from his coconut trees.  He is also engaged in raising hogs for a living.  He usually earn 6000 PHP per month.  He works hard on his farm and is raising hogs in order to expand his business in the future and have other business options.  

Ananias is asking a loan to buy more piglets and feed to keep them healthy.

Any income will be utilized for family daily consumption, pay for electricity and water.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Sanaa

texts.en:
Sanaa used her previous loan to increase her merchandise for her clothing business that helped her improve her house and add more furniture to it from the income she made.   

Now Sanaa is applying for another youth loan to prepare for winter season by buying more blankets and winter clothing items to sell to cover her neighborhood's needs.

loans.use: To buy blankets and winter clothes to resell

loans.name: Yvonne

texts.en:
Yvonne is 42 years old. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 16 and 20 years old.  All of them go to school. 

She sells food items and has been doing this for 10 years.  With the loan requested, she would like to buy more beans, cassava and bananas to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standards of living.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cassava and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement and building wood to renovate the house.

loans.name: Andrea Evelin

texts.es: ANDREA EVELIN: Es una mujer amable, originaria de Puerto Cabezas, tiene 43 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos: Dos mayores de edad y el menor de 19 años estudia su primer año de secundaria. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos y contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 2 años vende ropa usada, en un tramo en el mercado. Formo parte del grupo solidario Solteras por un periodo de año y medio, permitiéndole diversificar sus productos. Solicita su primer financiamiento en la modalidad de crédito individual para comprar en Managua una paca de vestidos y una paca mixta, venderla a precios accesibles en la ciudad de Bilwi. Su sueño es tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en: ANDREA EVELIN is a friendly woman and a native of Puerto Cabezas. She is 43 years old, a single mother of 3 children. Two of them are adults and the youngest who is 19 years ls studying first year secondary school. With the goal of getting her children ahead and having her own source of income she has sold used clothing in a stall in the market. She has been part of the communal bank "Solteras' for a year and a half. allowing her to diversify her product. She is requesting her first loan as an individual to buy a bale of clothing and a mixed bale in Managua to sell them at accessible prices in Bilwi. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing and a mixed bale in Managua.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga de 44 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija y su madre, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en: Olga is 44 years old and lives in her own house with her daughter and her mother. She works selling clothing. Her business is located in her place of residence. She has lots of clients because of the quality of her clothing and her good prices. She is requesting a loan to buy more clothing wholesale to be able to continue with her sales and have more income.

loans.use: to buy more clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is an entrepreneur, who engages in running a sari-sari (variety) store.  She sells basic items ranging from biscuits, noodles, soap, eggs and cooking oil, to beverages and canned goods. 

She is forty-four years old, married and has six children.  Her youngest child is 16. Her husband earns by operating habal-habal (a motorcycle that has an extended seat that is used to transport to remote areas). She also raises hogs, as supplemental income.

Rosita is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional stocks for the store and for pig feed. She can now display more stock that could help attract more customers.  In the coming few months, she will be able to raise and sell more hogs. Thus she can continue to send her youngest child to college.

Rosita is hoping that she will manage her current business successfully for sustainable living.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for the store  and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thread, a variety of fabric, buttons, elastic, etc.

loans.name: Maysa

texts.en:
Maysa could not get the required GPA in high school that would allow her to enroll in a public university that is cheaper, so she has registered in a private university. Her goal is to get a bachelor's degree in Educational Guidance, as she believes that a lot of students sometimes need guidance to clear their mind and take off on their life path. Her plan after graduating is to work in schools.
 
Maysa is now 25 years old, and she is in her last year at the university. She took a long time to complete her degree because she occasionally had to take a semester off. Her family could not always afford the tuition, especially as the costs kept rising. Her mother works at one of the universities, and her father drives a taxi. To be able to save money for her semester fees, Maysa used to take all of her classes three days a week and stay at home for the rest of the week. By doing that, she saved a little bit of transportation expenses. She also convinced her mom to start a small business at home selling snacks and some basic food items to make some money that she saved to pay for her university fees.
 
Her plan after graduation is to find a job in one of the schools and to get a higher degree in the same field. But now Maysa is requesting a loan to help her pay for her next semester to come one step closer to graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her next semester tuition

loans.name: Erinest

texts.en:
Erinest is a 29-year-old married man with one child living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His main business is buying and selling cocoa in Bundibugyo. Erinest has been in this business since 2007 and has benefited a lot from it. His business has helped him look after his family and pay school fees for his child. Erinest also has a cocoa plantation and he gets good yield.

Erinest is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell. He will use the profit from his loan to pay school fees to educate his child up to a degree level and to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Setkobor Tuiyobet Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Josephine, a member of Setkobor Tuiyobet Women Group.  She is twenty eight years old, married and blessed with three children.

She is a maize and potato farmer.  Having undergone Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, she acquired skills of managing her enterprise more effectively.  

She is borrowing a loan from Kiva to start a cereals shop selling maize and beans. She hopes her business will thrive and bring increased income.  

She plans to use the anticipated profits to expand the business further and pay school fees for her children.
 
Josephine is very grateful to Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy cereals such as maize and beans.

loans.name: Maendeleo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photograph is Lydiah, a member of Maendeleo Women Group. She is twenty eight years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Lydiah is a vegetable farmer and also has a grocery shop which has been running for the last six months. Having gone through HiH EA enterprise training she is now able to successfully manage her enterprise, effectively earning more profits.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds. This will improve on her crop yields, hence earning additional income and helping educate her children. 
 
Lydiah is happy for Kiva and their lenders for their support and she promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds that will help improve the crop yield

loans.name: Akadi Group

texts.fr:
Madame ALIZETA est la  représentante  du groupe AKADI. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé à 25 ans et le moins âgé a 17 ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Madame est tricoteuse de laine maintenant car le temps n’est pas favorable à son commerce précédent depuis 04 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  10 paquets de laine.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Mrs. Alizeta represents the Akadi group and is doing very well. She is the married mother of four children. The oldest is 25 years old and the youngest is 17. Two of them attend school.

Madame currently knits wool since her previous business over the past four years was not flourishing. She gets her supplies from surrounding markets, and wants to buy 10 wool skeins.

She wants to save her profits, expand her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy ten wool skeins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buid a modern dairy

loans.name: Claudia Haydee

texts.es: Claudia de 36 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida criando y vendiendo pollos desde hace 6 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre buscan sus productos, es por ello que se siente muy feliz de poder sostener a su familia, por medio de su negocio de venta de pollos. Ella habita en vivienda propia al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos una niña de 11 años y dos varones de 6 y 2 años de edad. Claudia sabe que sus ingresos económicos en su mayoría dependen de su negocio, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, vitaminas y concentrado para que su negocio le brinde mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Claudia at 36 years old is an enterprising woman who has been making her living raising and selling chickens for 6 years. So she has a good quantity of clients who always look for her products. So she feels very pleased to be able to sustain her family through her sale of chickens. She lives in her own house alongside her husband and her 3 children, a 11 year old daughter and two boys aged 6 and 2 years old. Claudia knows that her economic income depends mainly on her business so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in chickens, vitamins and concentrated feed so that her business generates more profit.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vitamins and concentrated feed.

loans.name: Basnewende Group

texts.fr:
Madame MARIE est la  représentante  du groupe BASNEWEND. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé à 11 ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. 03 vont à l’école. 
Madame vend des fruits et légumes depuis 03 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de fruit.
Elle veut  s’acheter  02 caisses de banane ; 01 carton de pomme ; 01 sac d’arachide.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Marie is the representative of the Basnewend group. She is doing very well. Marie is married and the mother of 3 children, the oldest of whom is 11 years old and the youngest of whom is 7 years old. All 3 children attend school.

Marie has been selling fruits and vegetables for 3 years. She gets her supplies at the fruit market. Marie would like to purchase 2 crates of bananas, 1 box of apples, and 1 bag of ground nuts.

Marie hopes to save her earnings. Her dream is to grow her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchases 2 crates of bananas, 1 box of applies, and 1 bag of ground nuts.

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул, 52 года, замужем, мать 2 детей школьного возраста, они активно помогают по хозяйству. Образование у Бактыгул среднее, вместе с супругом они занимаются животноводством и полеводством уже 32 года. По характеру она очень приятная и отзывчивая женщина, очень общительная и трудолюбивая. В хозяйстве есть 1 корова,  на 2,70 Га собственной и 1,0 ГА арендованной земли Бактыгул выращивает зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации оптовым покупателям. Бактыгул решила развить свою деятельность. Для этого она обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 бычков. На прибыль от кредита Бактыгул планирует и дальше развивать ее деятельность.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 52, married, and a mother of two school-aged children who never hesitate to help her with chores.  She has the equivalent of a high school education, and, together with her husband, has been a crop and livestock farmer for 32 years.  By nature, Baktygul is very easygoing, very sociable, enjoys helping others and appreciates a hard day's work.  She currently has a cow as well as a 2.70-hectare plot which she owns and a 1.0-hectare plot that she rents for growing grains and sainfoin to use on her farm and sell as cash crops to wholesalers.
 
Baktygul has decided to expand her business.  To do so, she's seeking a loan of 50,000 som from Bai Tushum Bank to buy two bull calves.  With her increased income due to the loan, she'll continue to invest in her farm and contribute to its further growth.

loans.use: buy two bull calves for fattening and resale

loans.name: Carlos Mauricio

texts.es: Carlos de 47 años de edad es un hombre emprendedor que ante la falta de un empleo decidió ganarse la vida por medio de la venta de vitaminas que realiza en los alrededores de su municipio, su esposa le apoya con la economía de su hogar apoyada en su trabajo. Él habita al lado de su esposa y sus 3 hijos dos jovencitas de 21 y 15 años de edad y un varón de 17 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace 14 años. Carlos sabe que con su negocio ha logrado mantener la estabilidad económica de su hogar, pero él desea obtener mejores ingresos, por lo que desea adquirir las vitaminas que vende por mayoreo, además desea invertir en electrodomésticos y así obtener mejores ingresos para apoyar a sus hijos con su estudios, es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: vitaminas y electrodomésticos para tener mejores ganancias y seguir sosteniendo la economía de su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos at 47 years old is an enterprising man who because of the lack of a job decided to make his living through the sales of vitamins that he does around his municipality. His wife helps him with the family economy supporting his work. He lives with his wife and his 3 children, two daughters aged 21 and 15 and a 17 year old son. He has lives in his own house for 14 years.

Carlos knows that his business has managed to maintain an a economic stability in his house but he wants to make more income. So he wants to add vitamins to sell wholesale. He also wants to invest in household appliances and make more income to support his children in their studies. For this reason he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in vitamins and appliances to have more profit and continue to sustain the household economy.

loans.use: to invest in vitamins and household appliances.

loans.name: Vita

texts.en:
Vita  earns a living by engaging in a food vending business. She makes and sells bibingka (rice cakes),which is made with rice flour and coconut milk or water; it is placed over preheated coals. She is a 56-year-old married woman with six dependents. Two of her children are still attending school. In addition to that, she also grows and sells rice. 

Vita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional supplies like flour, coconut, sugar, and farm supplies like fertilizer. This will help improve the growth of her rice production, enabling her to make and sell more rice cakes.

In the future,Vita dreams of expanding her business to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies like flour, coconut, sugar, and farm supplies like fertilizer

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith used the previous loan to buy clothes for selling. Faith is 35 years old, female, and married with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Faith has  been operating a general merchandise shop to earn a living for two years now. 

Faith has a dream of expanding her business. However, she is faced with a challenge of market competition and limited capital. 

Faith intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap, yellow bananas, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, yellow bananas, and other merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Jaime Eduardo

texts.es: Jaime de 54 años de edad es un hombre que se esfuerza cada día para brindar lo mejor a su familia, por medio de su negocio de venta de quesadillas el cual realiza desde hace 20 años por lo cantones cercanos y sus alrededores. Él es un hombre responsable que habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una joven de 23 años y un varón de 16 años de edad, además vive con ellos su pequeño nieto de 2 años de edad, por lo que se siente muy feliz de contar con una familia tan extensa. Jaime debe comprar las quesadillas que vende, lo que no le tiene muchas ganancias, es por ello que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: un horno, latas, una batidora y materia prima para elaborar quesadillas en su vivienda y obtener así mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Jaime, age 54, is a man who puts forth great effort every day in order to provide the best for his family.  He does this through his business of selling quesadillas.  He has been doing this for 20 years in the nearby cantons and surrounding areas.

He is a responsible man who lives in his own house with his wife and two children.  He has a 23 year old daughter and a 16 year old son.  His little two year old grandson also lives with them.  He is very happy to have such an extended family. 

Jaime needs to buy the quesadillas that he sells.  What he does not have is a lot of earnings.  That is why he has made the decision to request a loan from FUSAI.  He will use the loan to buy an oven, tin plates, a mixer, and raw materials to make quesadillas at his house.  This way he will get better income.

loans.use: to buy an oven, tin plates, a mixer, and raw materials.

loans.name: Maritza Yamileth

texts.es: Maritza de 20 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora que se gana  la vida apoyada en su negocio de crianza y venta de pollos, actividad que realiza desde hace 2 años por lo que cuenta con una buena cartera de clientes que siempre solicitan sus productos. Ella habita al lado su madre de 47 años  y su padre de 48 años de edad, ya que es soltera se siente feliz de poder apoyar a sus padres. Maritza sabe que la venta de pollos es su única fuente de ingresos, es por ello que desea solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos, concentrado y vitaminas que le permitan tener mejores ganancias para su negocio de venta de pollos de engorde.
texts.en:
Maritza, age 20, is an enterprising woman who earns a living with her business of raising and selling chickens.  She has been doing this for two years.  Therefore, she has a good customer base that always requests her products.

She lives with her 47 year old mother and her 48 year old father.  She is single, and she is happy to be able to support her parents.

Knowing that selling chickens is her only source of income, Maritza wishes to request a loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to buy chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins.  These will allow her to have better earnings for her business of fattening chickens and selling them.

loans.use: to buy chickens, concentrated feed, and vitamins.

loans.name: Mohammad Shaibaz

texts.en:
Shaibaz is 25 years old. He owns a thread shop. He is hardworking and honest. Given the growth in business, Shaibaz wants to purchase thread in bulk for his shop to satisfy his current customers, increase their loyalty, and attract more customers. Due to insufficient financing, he has requested a loan to purchase the thread.

This loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase thread for his shop

loans.name: Rufus

texts.en:
Hello, lenders, meet Rufus. For five years and counting, Rufus has been practicing mixed farming. He is very content with the conservative nature of the farming lifestyle. He is mostly appreciative of the fact that farming has enabled him to sustain his family of three children over the years. 

On his farm, he keeps dairy animals and grows maize/corn. He also engages in other businesses outside but related to farming to earn extra shillings. Rufus is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. Like many farmers, he is only planning to keep single poultry: chickens. From the hens, he will be able to sell meat and eggs to the local hospitality industries. The demand for chicken products in Kapsowar has never been higher. With your loan, Rufus will be in a position to acquire several chickens and establish his mark in this lucrative space. 

He stated that the money from the new venture will be dedicated to the education of his children. He believes with proper schooling as the foundation for his children, they will certainly lead a better life in their future and for the generations to come.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is married with four children. She operates a drug shop to earn a living. Elizabeth is a midwife, from which she earns a salary. She wishes to educate her children, but she has got little funds to support her to meet her dream, since she is the main breadwinner of her family.

Elizabeth wants a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Mwanahamisi

texts.en:
Mwanahamisi is a married woman who has three children, all whom attend school. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family. She lives in an owned house that has electricity, but no piped water.

She has operated a poulty business for the past two years, and she faces a challenge of seasonality in a business.

She is requesting  a loan of 20,000 to purchase a stock of chicks to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of chicks

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 42 years old and from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with three dependents, ages 4, 8 and 14. Her husband is a driver. 

As a supportive spouse, Juliet also engages in businesses. She buy tuba (coconut wine) and sells it for a profit. She also operates a sari-sari (variety) store business where she sells basic household needs like condiments, seasoning, toiletries, noodles and canned goods. She is asking a loan to buy more coconut wine, shampoo, coffee, cooking oil, canned goods and noodles. 

Any profit generated will be for the school fees of her children and her family's healthy diet.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine, shampoo, coffee, cooking oil, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Jovani

texts.en:
Jovani is 34 years old. She is married with six children, aged between 3 and 15 years; all of them go to school. She sells shoes and has been running her business for two years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more shoes for sale. As she sells in the market, it's not easy to get a photo of her alone. The profits from the business will used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more shoes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase women's clothes for resale

loans.name: Joel Nehemias

texts.es: Joel de 29 años de edad es un hombre muy reconocido en su comunidad por ser una persona responsable y trabajador, que habita en vivienda propia, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecho. Él se gana la vida como albañil, actualmente esta contratado para construir una vivienda de su comunidad, demostrando la confianza con la que cuenta. Joel desea ampliar su vivienda, ya que la parte de atrás no está construida por lo que desea realizar la ampliación, la cual realizara el mismo por lo que no invertirá en mano de obra, solo en los materiales necesarios, y es para ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para ampliar la parte de atrás de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Joel, 29, is very well known in his community for being a responsible and hardworking man.  He's happy and satisfied that he lives in his own home.  He earns a living as a bricklayer.  Currently he has a contract to build a house in his community, which indicates the trust he enjoys.

Joel wants to expand his house because the back part isn't built.  He'll do the expansion himself so he won't have to pay for labor, only the necessary materials.

He's requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to expand the back part of his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, bricks, and rebar to expand the back part of his house

loans.name: Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group

texts.en:
Dickson, raising his hand in the photo, is a member of Angaza Kamiruri Youth Group. He is 33 years old, married and blessed with two children. 

Dickson operates an electronics shop in his hometown, selling items like mobile phones, phone chargers, flash discs, memory cards and mobile phone spare parts. He is grateful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management that has enabled him to manage his business effectively. 

He is borrowing from Kiva to purchase additional stock for his shop. This will increase his income level, and he will therefore be in a better position to support his family.

Dickson is grateful for the loan and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phones, phone chargers, flash discs, memory cards and mobile phone spares parts to help improve his income.

loans.name: Kamu-Kamu Kasambya Group

texts.en:
Senyonjo is a Ugandan married woman, aged 43 years and very honest. She lives in Kagadi where she operates a restaurant and hopes to grow her business despite a price-fluctuation challenge. 

Senyonjo is requesting a loan to buy foods like bananas, rice, and sodas to sell. She is a member of Kamu-Kamu Kasambya where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy foods like bananas, rice, and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Waqas

texts.en:
Waqas runs a carpentry shop in Karachi where he does woodworking and makes many wooden products. He is 47, married and the father of two children. He is gaining more experience with time and has improved his business a lot. He is organized and disciplined. 

Waqas wants to boost his sales in order to become financially stable. He wishes to buy more wood to be able to take maximum orders. For his purpose, he has requested a loan to arrange for the capital and to get more established and improve his living standard.

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase wood for his carpentry work.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Margaret. She is sixty years old, married and a mother of nine. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2013.

Margaret farms maize and beans as her main business. With the training she got from HiH EA, she has been able to commercialize her farming business and make more profit. 

She is taking out a Kiva loan to purchase more quality fertilizer, and more chickens for a poultry project she is intending to start. This will greatly boost her crop yield, thus increasing her income, which will enable her to cater for her basic needs.
 
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and more chickens to help improve crop yield and poultry productivity, thus increasing income.

loans.name: Semu

texts.en:
Semu is a thirty-nine-year-old, married man with four children, living in Kasese Uganda. 

Semu runs a retail shop of general merchandise to earn a living. He dreams of constructing his own commercial premises to save the cost of rent. However, he is faced with the challenge of high transportation costs and bad debtors. 

Semu is a hardworking man who needs a loan to buy sugar, rice, millet flour, soap and other merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, millet flour, soap and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more coffee and tea to sell at his stall

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en:
Vestine is 40 years old. She is married with seven children between two and 19 years old. All of her children go to school. For the past ten years, Vestine has run a mini-market.

Vestine is requesting a loan to buy more milk and soap to sell. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy milk and soap to sell

loans.name: Munanda Jijenge Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Sabera, a member of Munanda Jijenge Women Group in Nakuru, Kenya. She is fifty-two years old, married and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in November 2013.

Sabera farms maize and beans. With the training she got from HiH EA, she has been able to commercialize her farming and she is now able to get more profit from her business. 

She is taking out a Kiva loan to purchase more quality fertilizer and seeds to expand her business. This will greatly boost her farm yields and thus her  income, which will enable her to cater for her children’s school fees and other basic needs.
 
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders, and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds to help improve on the yield of beans and maize.

loans.name: Patrus

texts.en:
Patrus is a young businessman who is 25 years old. He owns a sports shop and is hardworking and honest. Given the growth in his business, he wants to purchase sports items in bulk to attract more customers and business. Patrus wants establish himself in the market but he has insufficient financing.

Patrus is requesting a loan to purchase sports items in bulk. His loan will help him boost his business and increase his market outreach. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase sports items for his shop

loans.name: Rehman

texts.en:
Rehman is 43 and married. He is the father of seven children. Rehman owns an auto repair shop and is hardworking and honest. He does not have sufficient financing to increase his business. 

Rehman is requesting a loan to purchase spare auto parts for his business. His loan will help increase his business and attract more customers. Rehman will use his loan to boost his business and increase his market outreach. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase auto spare parts for his business

loans.name: Theophile

texts.en:
Theophile is 30 years old and not married. He sells foodstuffs and has been in this business for 8 years. 

With the loan requested, he would like to buy more beans, sorghum and maize to resell. The profits from the business will be used to expand his business and renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more beans, sorghum and maize to resell.

loans.name: Ma. Elva

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Elva works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 37,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Elva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda, 37, is married and has three children who are in school.

Brenda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Brenda requested a 8000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Brenda has been raising pigs for 5 years now and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Brenda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alecia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Alecia works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending. Alecia is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Alecia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 60 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them.She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future Helen would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Daniel. He is twenty-five years old and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Daniel earns his living by doing a poultry business, which he has been running for the last five years. He is grateful for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise management and savings mobilization, which has enabled him to gain skills in running his enterprise more effectively.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy chicken feed and renovate the poultry housing structure for maximum benefits. This will earn him more income, and thus enable him to pay school fees for his child.

Daniel is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.


Daniel is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and pay for renovation of the poultry house.

loans.name: Nyamirembe Tweyombeke Group

texts.en:
Protazio is a 54-year-old Ugandan man living in Kagadi. Since 2000, he has been selling beans and maize to generate income. Protazio hopes to grow his business despite bad weather that destroys his produce and bad roads that hinder his service delivery. 

Protazio is requesting a loan to buy beans and maize to sell. He is a member of the Nyamirembe Tweyombeke Group. Group members guarantee each other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 59-year-old married man and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. For the past 11 years, he has sold hardware to cover the needs and expenses of his family. Due to the low social and financial conditions of Palestinians, especially those who live in camps, Mohammad's income is not enough anymore to cover his increasing living costs.

Mohammad is requesting a loan through the Kiva field partner Al Majmoua to repair his car which he uses to transport his hardware. This loan is very important to Mohammad for it will facilitate his business. He hopes to open his own hardware shop in the future.

loans.use: to repair the car he uses for his business

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario de 22 años de edad es un joven trabajador que desde muy joven ha aprendido a ganarse la vida, por medio de su trabajo como panificador, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años, por lo que se siente feliz y orgulloso, además se desempeña como repartidor de gas propano. Mario habita en vivienda propia desde hace 3 años, aunque esta tiene deteriorado el techo, está feliz de contar con un lugar propio donde vivir, por lo que desea reparar el techo lo antes posible, además desea ampliar la parte de atrás que no está construida para aprovechar los espacios, y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: duralita, pines cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para cambiar el techo y ampliar la parte de atrás de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mario, 22, is a hardworking young man.  His job as a baker taught him to earn a living for himself at a very young age.  He's happy and proud to have had the job for several years.  He also distributes propane gas.

Mario has lived in his own home for three years and, although the roof is somewhat deteriorated, he's happy to have a place of his own.  He wants to repair the roof as soon as possible and to expand the back of his house, which isn't built yet, to make the most of the space.  That's why he's asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in Duralite roofing, pins, cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to put on a new roof and expand the back part of his house.

loans.use: to buy Duralite roofing, pins, cement, sand, gravel, bricks, and rebar to put on a new roof and to expand the back part of his house

loans.name: Ulpiana

texts.en:
Ulpiana is a married woman who operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household merchandise like canned goods, soft drinks, biscuits, soap, coffee, and seasonings. She is 48 years old and has five children. Two of her children are still attending school. To earn additional income, she raises and sells pigs.

Ulpiana is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for the store and to purchase pig feed. In the coming months, Ulpiana plans to display a variety of merchandise in her store and produce more healthy pigs to sell. 

She is hoping that someday she can manage both of her businesses successfully to be able to finance the schooling of her two youngest children for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy inventory for the store and to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Harusi

texts.en:
Harusi is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Harusi operates a grocery and vegetables selling stall. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future.

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. Since 2006, he has sold electronics for his daily income. 

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to ease his transport costs and save time. He hopes to grow his business and have a healthy family in spite of high transportation costs and bad roads.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Naderah

texts.en:
Naderah is a 43-years-old married woman from the city of  Nablus. She has two sons, both  attend school. Her husband is employed in a local firm and earns a low income.

Naderah wants to complete her studies at the university to earn a BA degree, in social science, but she could not afford it. 

Naderah took a USD loan from FATEN to buy a new laptop for her studies.  Naderh will be able to do her home work and watch the lectures online. 
NAderah appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for coursework.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. The eldest child is 13 and the youngest is 3. Evelyn runs a small sari-sari or retail store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. 

Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods. This loan will help her improve her stock, thus attracting more buyers in her store. In the future, Evelyn hopes of making her business sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, rice, biscuits and snack foods

loans.name: Happy

texts.en:
Happy is a mother of one kid who is small. She is married and aged in her late 20s. She has been a businesswoman since 2011. She runs a shop selling cosmetics of different kinds. She starts working from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her third credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She managed to repay successfully her previous credits. Happy used those loans to buy missing cosmetics for her shop, the ones mostly demanded by her daily customers. She is so happy now and thankful for Kiva's support. She earned an extra income which she used to cover household expenses. In the coming years, Happy says she would like to make her shop look bigger. 

She is now requesting a new credit to buy stock of cosmetics for her shop so as to make it attractive. She will hold herself accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of cosmetics for her shop so as to make it attractive.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
