Imelda is 46 years old and has four children. Imelda is married, and all of her children are in school.

Imelda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Imelda requested a 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Imelda has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Hello lender, meet Regina. Regina is a 50-year-old dairy farmer from the outskirts of Kapsowar, Kenya. She is a mother of two and has been farming for eight good years. On her 1.5 acre of land, Regina grows maize, potatoes and vegetables. She also keeps poultry and dairy cattle for selling eggs and milk. 

Regina is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase a high quality breed of sheep. Her passion for sheep farming is deep-rooted and she finds selling sheep meat and wool to be very enjoyable. Your loan will help Regina to significantly improve her livelihood. The sheep will increase the amount of wool sold at the market. With more wool and sheep meat, Regina can also look into value additions to grow her profit margins. The money she makes off her investment will go toward her children’s education. When asked how this loan will be of benefit to her family, she replied, “It will increase the income of the family.”

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of  sheep

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 31 years old, married with four children, and living in Kasese, Uganda. Moses sells clothes and also practices farming, growing crops such as rice, cotton, maize and others for selling to improve the levels of his income. 

Moses has a dream of expanding his business into a shopping center. However, he is faced with the challenge of high transport costs and the ever changing fashions and designs on the market. Moses wants money to buy clothes for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for selling during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Ruphence

texts.en:
Ruphence is a married mother and has children that attend school. Her house has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a  business to sell clothes  door-to-door. She is  challenged by the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She requests 30,000 KES to purchase three bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bales of clothes to resell.

loans.name: David Eliseo

texts.es:
David de 22 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, su pareja es ama de casa solo ella y su hijo viven y depende de él.

David es agricultor, aprendió trabajando con sus padres que también son agricultores y además crían ganado. Actualmente es empleado y trabaja como cocinero en un restaurante de comida rápida, viaja cerca de 40 kilómetros para llegar al lugar de trabajo y labora turnos diarios de 8 horas continuas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar ganado de engorde en repasto para después de engordarlo venderlo a mejor precio del que lo compró. Una de las aspiraciones más grandes de David es continuar con sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old and has a partner and one-year-old son. David completed high school. His partner is a housewife and both she and the couple's son depend on David.

David is a farmer. He learned the trade from his parents who are also farmers and raise cattle. David currently has a job as a chef in a fast food restaurant. He travels around 40 kilometres to arrive at his workplace, completing non-stop, eight-hour shifts.

David is applying for this loan in order to buy cattle to fatten up on pasture and later sell at a better price. One of David's biggest aspirations is to continue with his university studies.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten up on pasture.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman and owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
 
Esther has operated a tailoring business for the past four years. She makes women's suits and men's suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials and sewing thread for her business.

loans.name: Maa Pataneswari Group

texts.en:
In Oct. 2014, ten active women from Risigaon village, located in the Khariar block of Nuapada district, one of the poorest districts of India, stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families with their contributions. They formed a group named Maa Pataneswari to access credit from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses.

Dulani is one of them. She is standing third from the right with her hand raised in the photo. She is 35 years old and lives with her husband, two sons of 17 and 14 years, one daughter of 10 years, and her father-in-law and mother-in-law. The elder son of Dulani is taking pharmacist training in a private institution, and the other son and daughter are continuing their studies in local schools.

Dulani hails from a poor family. For the last ten years, she has been running a general grocery shop along with vegetable vending. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 5,000, which is not sufficient to maintain her family, business, and educational expenses. Dulani wants to grow her business to earn more income.

To give a secure life to her children, she has also admitted her elder son for a pharmacist training course in a private institution. So, the present loan will be used to purchase study materials and pay the tuition fees. She has also planned to use a part of the loan for purchasing lentils for her general store.

Dulani hopes to give better education to her other son and daughter and construct a good house for her family.

The other members of the group are doing stone chopping, vegetable cultivation, and broom businesses for their livelihoods.

loans.use: to purchase study materials and pay for tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, in the Department of Journalism and Mass Communication. Here is her story:

“I have studied hard at school and dreamed to apply to the JMC Department of AUCA, because AUCA's system is useful in a way that the subjects are taught by U.S. textbooks and in the sphere of PR, this is really relevant.

Whatever depended on me I did, and I am not afraid of difficulties, which I face. I had high grades and good results in Olympiads; I also was very active in school’s social life. Unfortunately, there are things that I am not able to manage. One of them is money.

It is impossible for my family to afford the tuition fee at AUCA. For us, it’s huge money and we will need several years to save it. In 2011, we lost my father and this tragedy totally changed my family’s life. I live with my mother and brother; my other two siblings are married and live separate from us. My mother is retired and gets a small pension. My brother is 24 years old and got a job not long ago. His salary is not enough to support three of us and to pay my university tuition.

I need a Kiva loan, because I want to dream, to set my own purposes and to achieve them. First, the loan will be a good start for my education. Second, education will help me to achieve my life goals. Finally, I will be able to make a contribution to further life not only my family, but also other people in my country.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris, 43, has a small farm based in the village of Kipsaiya , which is situated in the North Rift region of Kenya. 

She has been a farmer for six years to provide for her family of four children. Her primary income sources are selling milk and crops. Damaris enjoys farming a lot. Looking after her cattle, however, is quickly becoming a serious challenge because her cattle stray  from the designated grazing area into other people's farms. The consequences  can be very severe, leading to disputes which can escalate to violence and hostility. Damaris seeks a loan to pay for a fencing wire to enclose her farmland. 

The loan will enable Damaris to have small fenced paddocks  to make stock more intensive. The paddocks will also be used to build up feed supply, which will also force the stock to graze a wider range of plants, and allow the plants to recover after grazing. The fence will also protect her crops from pests such as hares.

 When asked how the loan would benefit her family, she replied, "Improves security in my compound, improves stock management, and keeps my neighbors happy."

loans.use: to fence her farmland.

loans.name: Hovik

texts.en:
Hovik is 29 years old and lives with his parents, brother, and sister at the frontier village Lusadzor of Tavush region. This young man does not have a higher education but he has had  a  small bread production  business. 

Hovik’s father is a forester and also participates in farming and agriculture. They have a pleasant farm to care for 2 cows, a calf, 2 pigs, and 30 chickens. Their plot of land is a source of income for the family.  They produce with milk, dairy-products, meat, eggs, figs, persimmons, and apples.

Hovik  likes farming and  wants to enlarger it.  He will use the loan to purchase 2 bulls and feed for  his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 bulls and feed for all his farm cattle.

loans.name: Reziel

texts.en:
Reziel is 39 years old and married with three children.

Reziel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc. Reziel has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Reziel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Kyanaisoke Tweheyo  Group

texts.en:
Solome is a divorced woman who  lives in Kagadi-Uganda. She sells produce to generate income. 

She  hopes to build a permanent house and educate her children in spite of fluctuating prices and unpredictable weather conditions. Solome intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell. 

She is a member of Kyanaisoke Tweheyo group and each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don’t pledge securities.

loans.use: to buy maize.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has been blessed with children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

For the past 8 years, Rose has operated a dairy farming business, selling as retail and at the market to her local residents and restaurant operators. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of adding more dairy cows for her business. 

With the 20,000 KES, Rose wants to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine for livestock and cow feed

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca de 40 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 5 hijos de 9, 19, 20, 22, y 24 años de edad 3 viven todavía con ella, estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica debido a que su familia no tenía como costear sus estudios. Su pareja es agricultor y solo él y sus tres hijos viven con ella.

Blanca apoya a su pareja en las actividades agrícolas, aprendió trabajando con sus padres que también eran agricultores, también tiene ganado lechero. Camina cerca de un kilómetro para llegar a la parcela sembrada, también le apoya un hijo, trabajan de 6:00 am a 11:00 am, luego hace los oficios de sus casa.

Solicita el préstamo para cancelar una deuda personal que tiene en una institución financiera donde cree que está pagando demasiado. Sus sueños son sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar su casa para vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 40 years old, partnered and has five children who are nine, 19, 20, 22 and 24 years old. Three still live with her. She went to school until the 6th grade of basic education because her family couldn't pay for her studies. Her partner is a farmer, and only him and her three children live with her.

Blance supports her partner in agricultural activities. She learned the work with her parents, who were also farmers and also had dairy cattle. She walks abut a kilometer to go to the planted land and is supported by one of her sons. They work from 6-11 a.m. and do household work later.

She's seeking this loan to cancel a personal debt she has with a financial institution where she believes she's paying too much. Her dreams are to move her children forward and improve her home to live comfortably.

loans.use: to cancel a personal debt she has.

loans.name: Digna Catalina

texts.es:
Digna de 26 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de 9 años de edad que estudia 3er grado de educación básica. Ella interrumpió sus estudios por falta de recursos económicos y tiempo, su esposo emigro al extranjero para buscar mejores condiciones de trabajo y apoyar económicamente a su familia. Solo su hija vive con ella.

Digna desde muy pequeña, acompañaba a su madre al negocio que tienen en el centro del pueblo, esta es una mini tienda donde venden licuados, tortas, gaseosas, frutas entre otros productos.
Todos los días se levantan a las 5:00 am para hacer los oficios del hogar y estar lista a las 7:00 am en el negocio, después de un día de trabajo regresa a las 7:00 pm a su hogar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa de diversos estilos tallas y para ambos sexos, con esto aprovechara la época navideña que se acerca que es cuando más se vende este tipo de producto. La mercadería la comprará en la capital para que le salga más barato. Su mayor sueño es que su esposo regrese para tener completa su familia, si mejoran aquí las condiciones no habrá necesidad de que él este fuera del país.
texts.en:
Digna is 26 years old, married and has a nine-year-old daughter, who is in third grade. Digna stopped her own studies as she had neither the money nor the time for them. Digna's husband has moved abroad in search of better work conditions and to support the family financially. Only Digna's daughter lives with her.

From a very young age, Digna accompanied her mother in her small business in the centre of her town. This business was a small shop selling smoothies, cakes, fizzy drinks, fruits and other items.

Every day Digna wakes up at 5am in order to do the household chores and to be at the business by 7am. After her day at work, Digna returns home at 7pm.

Digna is applying for this loan in order to buy clothes of various styles and sizes, and for both sexes. With these items, she can take advantage of the approaching Christmas season when sales of these products increase. Digna will be the merchandise in San Salvador, the capital of El Salvador, where it is cheaper.

Digna's biggest dream is for her husband to return and for the family to be whole again. If conditions improve her in El Salvador, Digna's husband will no longer need to live abroad.

loans.use: to buy clothes of various styles and sizes, and for both sexes.

loans.name: Samuel David

texts.es: Samuel vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la jardinería y fontanería, traba en diferentes casa y ya tiene clientes establecidos por el buen trabajo que realiza, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de una maquina para cortar cesped ya que la unica que tiene ya esta muy deteriorada y asi poder seguir con su trabajo que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Samuel lives in his own house with his two children and his wife.  He has earned a living for several years in gardening and plumbing.  He works in different houses and has steady customers because of his good work.

Samuel's requesting a loan to buy a lawnmower because the only one he has is run-down.  That way he'll be able to continue doing his job, which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy a lawnmower

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mary operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over five years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mary dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Pembe

texts.en:
Pembe is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Pembe operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale.

loans.name: Nerys Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nerys, una mujer de 50 años de edad llena de sueños y aspiraciones en su vida, vive en una finca en el municipio de Puerto Escondido y se gana la vida con la producción y venta de pollos y huevos.  

Con este trabajo intenta sostener a su familia compuesta por su esposo y 5 hijos.

Es un trabajo que ha venido ejerciendo desde hace aproximadamente 20 años con el fin de salir adelante.

Pide un apoyo económico para la compra de pollos, gallinas ponedoras, alimento y materiales para su galpón.
Con este préstamo podrá tener un negocio más sostenible y consolidado.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Nerys!
texts.en:
Nerys is a 50-year-old woman full of dreams and aspirations for her life.  She lives on a farm in the town of Puerto Escondido and earns a living producing and selling chickens and eggs.  With this job she supports her family, made up of her husband and five children.  She has been doing this job for approximately 20 years so she can get ahead.

Nerys is requesting economic support to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for her coop.  She'll be able to have a more sustainable and stronger business with this loan.

Lend today and you'll be able to improve Nerys's life and her business!

loans.use: to buy chickens, laying hens, feed, and materials for her coop

loans.name: Hamoud

texts.en:
Hamoud is a 45-year-old married man with five children. His oldest child is 20  and the youngest one is 3.  He lives with his family in Sana'a city, Yemen. He is from a poor family and lives in  very difficult conditions.

 In order to improve the living standard of his family, Hamoud decided to start his own business selling many kinds of simple food items, spices, canned foods, and soft drinks in a grocery near his home. He earns little, has a low inventory, and can't meet the demands of his customers. 

Hamoud wants to enlarge his business but he doesn't have enough money. He applied for  200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase many different kinds of items for his a grocery store to  meet his customer's demands. Increased sales  will help him to meet his family's needs. 

Hamoud looks forward to expanding his business  to attract a lot of customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food items for his  grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop computer..

loans.name: Jessamin

texts.en:
Jessamin is grateful that he was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which he used to buy gardening materials (wire and baskets) and supplies (seed and fertilizer) needed in his farm. Through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would now like to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan which he will use to buy fertilizers and more farm inputs in order to yield a better harvest of bananas and coconut to improve his sales and earnings.  It will definitely help cover his family’s daily needs. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to him. He wishes everyone a Blessed Christmas!

Jessamin hopes to plant more kinds of fruits and vegetables to grow his farm. He prays for good health and to be able to save for his old age. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies for a bountiful harvest to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosita is 48 years old and all of her children are in school.

Rosita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money in order to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 59-years-old married woman with eight children. 

Felisa has raised  pigs for 10 years and requests  5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  She has previously  borrowed 2 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Felisa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
This nice and charming lady’s name is Narine and she lives in Vnadzor city of Lori region. Narine has two sons. She has higher education; she graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, faculty of Mathematics and Sociology. For 20 years already she has been working at the Vanadzor State University in the physical mathematical faculty as a secretary-lab assistant. After her work at the university she has paid group courses during which she greatly helps the students to get prepared for their diploma work and term papers. 

As Narine says, it is very hard nowadays to work without a computer, unlike several years ago. So she will use this loan amount for the purchase of a computer and also some professional literature. She is thankful beforehand and hopes for support.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some professional literature

loans.name: Maria Beyanid

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer humilde y trabajadora que ha dedicado gran parte de su vida al cuidado de sus hijos, vive en el municipio de La Dorada desde donde se desempeña espectacularmente en la cocina ya que su negocio es la preparación de comidas por encargo como lo son los tamales, chorizos, empanadas, entre otros.

Estos alimentos los venden principalmente a vecinos del sector quienes conocen la sazón de Maria y saben que siempre obtendrán alimentos deliciosos y muy bien preparados.

Maria desea aumentar su venta de alimentos y desea trabajar de una manera más cómoda, por esta razón solicita un préstamo para la compra de algunos utensilios de cocina, compra de una estufa y compra de insumos para continuar realizando sus recetas.

Este préstamo le permitirá sacar adelante su negocio para obtener así los ingresos necesarios que le den la oportunidad de continuar sosteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
María's a modest and hardworking woman who has devoted a big part of her life to taking care of her children.  She lives in the town of La Dorada, where she acquits herself spectacularly in the kitchen.  Her business is preparing food on order, including tamales, chorizo, and empanadas.  She sells these dishes mainly to neighbors in the area who are familiar with her cooking and know they'll always get delicious, well-prepared dishes.

María wants to expand her food business and work more comfortably, so she's requesting a loan to buy some kitchen utensils, a stove, and ingredients to keep on making her recipes.

This loan will allow her to make progress with her business and earn the income she needs to keep supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy some kitchen utensils, a stove, and ingredients to keep on making her recipes

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 26-year-old married woman and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, she started eleven years ago selling cosmetics and perfumes from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family.

Despite the hard economical situations inside the camp, Fatima is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner AL Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with more requested cosmetics and perfumes which will satisfy her customers in the upcoming Christmas season.

Fatima hopes to expand her business more in the future through opening her own cosmetics shop which will increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with more requested cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rosa is 52 years old now.

Rosa has a rice farming business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosa has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Rosa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo de 37 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 6 hijos de 1, 6, 10, 16, 19, y 20 años de edad pero solo uno vive con él. Solo pudo estudiar hasta 6° grado de educación básica debido a que su familia era de escasos recursos económicos. Su pareja es comerciante y se dedica a la venta de mariscos; solo ella y su hijo viven con él.

Guillermo es empleado en una hacienda, su trabajo es cuidar el ganado actividad que haca desde que era niño, además tiene 20 años de trabajar en agricultura y lo ayudan dos de sus hijos mayores. Para llegar a la hacienda viaja en bicicleta 2 kilómetros y su horario es de 4:00 am a 11:00 am, luego regresa a su casa o a su parcela para trabajar en lo suyo.

Solicita el crédito para comprar pollitos de engorde, alimento y medicinas para desarrollarlos y tener los a la venta en diciembre para los días de navidad y año nuevo. Sus aspiraciones son dar estudio a su hijo y tener ganado lechero para mejorar el ingreso de la familia con la venta de leche y sus derivados.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 37, has a companion and six children, ages 1, 6, 10, 16, 19, and 20, but only one lives with him.  He was only able to attend school up to sixth grade because his family had limited economic resources.  His partner's a merchant and she sells shellfish; only she and his son live with them.

Guillermo is employed on a hacienda.  His job is taking care of the livestock, work he has done since he was a child.  He also has 20 years of experience working in agriculture, and two of his older children help him.  He rides his bicycle two kilometers to get to the hacienda; he works from 4 a.m. until 11 a.m., then goes to his house or his plot of land to do his own work.

He's requesting the loan to buy chicks to fatten, and feed and medicine to raise them for sale in December for Christmas and New Year's Day.

His goals are to give his son an education and to have dairy cows to improve his family's income with the sale of milk and its derivatives.

loans.use: to buy chicks to fatten, and feed and medicine to raise them

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a married female who lives in Masindi. She runs a restaurant and has rental property to earn additional income. 

She wants to improve  her restaurant and attract customers by painting it and buying seats. She is challenged by competition and  fluctuating food prices.

She needs a loan to renovate her restaurant.

loans.use: to renovate her restaurant.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a married woman who owns a house without electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated a home-based open air food selling business. She is  challenged by weather conditions. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Sandra es una bella mujer de 22 años de edad, madre soltera de un hijo de 6 años, criada con unas muy buenas costumbres y desde el colegio desarrollo una gran pasión por todo lo relacionado con la belleza.
  
Inicio su etapa productiva en realizando cursos y capacitaciones hasta que un día se aventuró y decidió ir en busca de su propia clientela montando un negocio de salón de belleza en su hogar. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de un secador y algunos productos de belleza.

El crédito para ella será muy importante pues terminara de consolidar su empresa completándola con todos los insumos necesarios para operar y ofrecer cualquier servicio que lleguen a solicitarle.

Su sueño es que su empresa progrese de la mano de Interactuar y tenga muchos clientes ya que será determinante porque dejo su hogar para aventurarse en la ciudad buscando un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Sandra is a beautiful, 22-year-old woman. She is the single mother of a 6-year-old boy. She was raised with very good habits and began to develop a great passion for everything related to beauty while she was in high school. She began her career by taking courses and training until, one day, she decided to look for her own customers and started a beauty salon in her home.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a hair dryer and some beauty products. The loan will be very important for her because she will be able to finish setting up her business by purchasing the rest of the necessary equipment so that she can offer any service that her customers would like.

Her dream is that her business continues to progress with Interactuar's help and to have many customers. This will be decisive for her because she left her home to travel to the city in search of a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer and some beauty products.

loans.name: Amangul

texts.en:
Amangul is a freshman at the American University of Central Asia, Department of International and Comparative Politics. Here is her story:

“This year I finished AUCA New Generation Academy, which gave me an excellent education and great international experience. I was among 70 winners of donors' scholarships, so studied free of charge. Those 70 students came from the different parts of Kyrgyzstan and were in need of aid.

Now I am a freshman and my family is not able to pay my tuition fee by itself. There are four of us: my mother, me and 2 sisters. My mother is a kindergarten teacher and the only bread-winner in my family. My elder sister graduated from the university last year and wasn’t able to find a job other than doing household. My younger sister goes to the kindergarten and she loves drawing. 

Receiving a Kiva loan will enable me to continue to make progress in my degree and preparation for a career. James Autry said: “Millionaire has a tremendous ability to reach the borders of your society and help to provide opportunities for everyone.” I do agree with him. One can’t be happy when people around are starving. When I get an education, I will day by day try to improve my life and the life of people around me. 

I am a person of society, deeply interested in the political and social life of my country. Please note that the loan will make a significant positive impact on my ability to continue to study at AUCA.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Her name is Remedios, 56 years old and a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She is married to Jerardo and has one child. She manages her household while operating a business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet the family's daily personal and household needs and to send her child to school. 

Remedios has operated a variety store for a number of years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Remedios earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,200 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store business, Remedios is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items, such as sacks of rice, cookies, noodles, pasta, soda, and other grocery items. She expects an increase in sales since Christmas is fast-approaching. Her earnings is the income source to meet the family's daily expenses and to send her children to school. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and the financial help that will be given to her. She is wishing everyone a blessed Christmas!

Remedios aims to grow her business and hopes to own a big grocery store someday. She strives to hard to give her children the best education and prays for a quiet and happy life. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Salina

texts.en:
Forty-five year old Salina does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but she is an accomplished farmer from the Kapsowar area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. She is happily married and, together with her handsome husband, they are blessed with one child. For the past 15 years Salina has been involved in mixed farming, sheep farming, and goat farming and because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, farmers from their village and neighboring villages troop to her home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques. 

Salina has identified free space on her farm and wants to fully utilize this space by keeping a good-quality dairy cow. Dairy farming in Kenya is a very profitable venture and milk prices have been going up in the recent past, so Salina, being a visionary and entrepreneurial woman, wants to take full advantage of this. She has chosen the breed of cow that she will keep, and she knows that she will get not only milk from the cow but also manure, and this will boost the fertility of her farm. Selling her milk will never be a problem because there is a ready market and she will also be selling to big dairy processing firms. 

Salina said she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer agricultural-based loans, and their interest rate is low and is on a reducing basis. She underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and from this training she learned that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Salina hopes that through the accumulated profit she will be able to start adding value to her milk by starting services such as packaging and the production of other dairy products. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going child and ageing parents.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a 3- year-old married man with a three-year old son. He is a fish  and  operates a sari-sari (variety) store. He has sold noodles, canned goods, salt, soy sauce, soap, tooth paste, and soft drinks for five years. Together with his family, he lives in Mcarthur, Leyte.

Reynaldo requests 20,000 PHP to buy stock for the store and obtainl capital for his fish vending business. He wants to attract more buyers and sell more fresh fish.

He hopes that his current business will be  more successful and provide his family with a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy stock items.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 40 years old, separated, and has children who attend school. She is a resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She works hard to provide for the family's daily household needs and school needs of her children.

Rosario makes and sells native delicacies, which she has been doing for two years. She makes cassava cake from cassava and coconut milk and buko pie from grated coconut, coconut milk, and sugar. They are among the favorites of Filipinos and foreign tourists. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 700 PHP in sales every day.

Rosario requested a loan for 11,000 PHP, which she will use to buy raw ingredient such as cassava, coconut milk, sugar, and flour. She expects an increased demand of her native delicacies this coming Christmas. Rosario wants to expand her business and hopes to own a vehicle to easily transport her rice cakes. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase cassava, coconut, sugar, milk,  flour, and other ingredients

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman with four children. She lives at a house without  electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Catherine operates a fruit and vegetables stall at the market and sells to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces competition and changing weather in her business. 

She will use 50,000 KES to purchase oranges, bananas, and green vegetables to resell. She dreams of expanding and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  oranges, bananas, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a married mother with four children, all attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, she has operated a door-to-door  clothes selling business. She is challenged by the  high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She will use the loan  to purchase large quantities of clothing. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bulk quantities of clothes.

loans.name: Nil

texts.en:
Nil is a hardworking and industrious housewife who has sold  towels and placemats.  Sales have been slow because her products are handmade and it is hard for her to buy ready-made products. 

She will use the loan to buy wholesale products to increase her stock and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy products.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es: Ana cuenta con 40 años de edad y desde muy joven aprendió a ganarse la vida, es por ello que hace 7 años decidió dedicarse a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, actividad que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar. Ella habita junto a su 3 hijos de 19, 16 y 13 años de edad en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo, por lo que se siente feliz y satisfecha que a pesar de ser madre soltera le ha dado lo necesario a sus hijos, apoyándolos también para que estudien. Ana desea que su negocio prospere sobre todo porque cada día son más los clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lociones, desodorantes, perfumes, maquillaje, cremas, y joyería de enchape para que su negocio le brinde mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old and learned from a very young age to earn her own living. Therefore, she decided 7 years ago that she would work selling beauty products by catalogue. This has allowed her to support her household financially. She lives with her three children, aged 19, 16 and 13 in a home of their own. Ana is happy and proud that this has been the case for a long time and that she has been able to give everything necessary to her children and support their studying although she is a single mother.
Ana hopes that her business will prosper as day by day the demand for her products augments. Therefore, she is asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in: lotions, deodorants, perfumes, make-up, creams and costume jewelry so that her business will become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy lotions, deodorants, perfumes, make-up, creams and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Jamaica - Kibaha Group

texts.en:
Fatuma  is a 42-year-old divorced woman  with five children, two attend school. She has been working hard to improve her life and has a business selling fabric,  fruit, vegetables, and soda. She has depended on income from these businesses for 2 years and works from 8am to 7pm.   Fatuma is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

 Fatuma approached Tujijenge Tanzania, as Kiva's partner to request financial support. This is her first request to be apportioned among Jamaica-Kibaha, nine members group. The group members will hold each other accountable to repay the loan. 

She will use her loan to buy stock for her both businesses.  In the coming years, Fatuma would like to buy a plot of land and build house for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her  businesses.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina, 33, is a resident of Coron, Palawan. She is married to Remy, a tricycle driver, and has three children who are in college, high school and elementary school. She and her husband manage their household and they both work hard to provide for their family and support their children's education.

Christina has been selling fish for a number of years already. She buys fish from a wholesaler at a local fish port early in the morning and sells it by the kilo at the town market. Many patrons prefer her product since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has a tricycle, which her husband drives to provide transport service for additional income. She earns a minimum of 1,300 PHP in sales every day.

To help continue and expand her business she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan, which she will use it to buy more barrels of fish. She will also use part of the loan for the maintenance of her tricycle unit. 

Coron, Palawan is one of the best island in the Philippines. It not only offers the best beaches in the world but also offers the freshest supply of fish. Her earnings in her fish stall are a great help in meeting the family's everyday needs and for the schooling of her children. Christina hopes for her business to flourish so she can help her children achieve their dreams. She aims to send her children to the best schools until college. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God that she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more barrels of fish to sell and for the maintenance of her tricycle unit

loans.name: Kavutha

texts.en:
Kavutha is a married mother with two children, all  attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a door--to-door clothes selling business. She is challenged by the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

She will use t25,000 KES to purchase bulk quantities of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of clothes.

loans.name: Nzara

texts.en:
Nzara is a married woman with two kids, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

Nzara operates a stall where she sells grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 25,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Idelma Dolres

texts.es:
Idelma de 46 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos pero ninguno vive con ella y dos están fuera del país, estudió hasta bachillerato. Actualmente trabaja como cocinera en la cafetería de una escuela, con un  horario de lunes a viernes de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm, también recibe ayuda económica de sus dos hijos que están en el extranjero. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar duralitas y reparar el techo de su casa que se vio bien afectado con la recién pasada época lluviosa, también construirá un gallinero para meter 10 gallinas, el gallinero que tiene actualmente está en muy mal estado y unos perros le mataron 8 gallinas.

Idelma sueña con reparar totalmente su casa, para que cuando sus hijos la visiten se sientan cómodos, además quiere tener nuevamente su gallinero y cuidar sus animales.
texts.en:
Idelma is 46 years old, is single, and has 3 children. None of her children currently live with her and two live outside of the country. She attended school through high school. She currently works as a chef in the cafeteria in a school. She works Mondays through Fridays from 6:00 am until 4:00 pm. She also receives remittances from her two sons who live abroad.

She is requesting this loan to purchase duralite roof tiles, to repair the roof of her home that was damaged greatly during the past rainy season, and to build a chicken coop to house 10 chickens. Her current chicken coop is in very bad shape and some dogs killed 8 of the chickens.

Idelma dreams of completely repairing her home so that her children will be comfortable when they visit. She would also like to have a new chicken coop to care for her chickens.

loans.use: to purchase duralite roof tiles, to repair the roof of her home, and to build a chicken coop to house 10 chickens.

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de experiencia, sabiduría y mucha paciencia.
Es madre de 1 hijo y ha trabajado prácticamente toda su vida para sacarlo adelante.

Ella tiene una pequeña chaza en la que vende frituras, golosinas y refrescos, adicional a esto trabaja en producción y venta de comidas que ella misma prepara en su casa. 

Trabaja todos los días de 5:00 Am  a 3:00 Pm para tener su producto listo y fresco para sus clientes que en su mayoría son los vecinos del sector donde vive.

Ella desea capitalizar su negocio y tener un gran avance de insumos e inventario de productos, por eso acude a un préstamo para comprar surtido de bebidas y frituras, además desea comprar insumos para su producción de alimentos.

Una de sus principales dificultades es la falta de dinero para invertir en su negocio pero confía en la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar y el buen corazón de los prestamistas de Kiva para sacar su actividad adelante.
texts.en:
Luz is a woman with experience, wisdom, and a lot of patience. She is the mother of one child and has worked for practically her whole life to move her family forward. She has a small stand where she sells fried food, snacks, and beverages. She also makes and sells food from her home. She works every day from 5:00 am until 3:00 pm in order to have fresh products ready for her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors.

She hopes to add capital to her business and have more supplies and inventory, so she has requested a loan to purchase beverages and fried food. She would also like to purchase supplies for food preparation. 

One of the greatest challenges that she faces is a lack of money to invest in her business, but she trusts in the assistance of Interactuar and the good hearts of Kiva lenders to bring her business forward.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and fried food, and to purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Chamroun's Group

texts.en:
Chamroun, 28, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province, and she is a mother of one child. To earn a living, she grows rice on a two hectare area as a single source of income. She has been involved in her business for two years and earns about 36,700 KHR per day. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get new loan. As a leader of the group, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Hilda is a married woman and a mother of three children ages five to sixteen. She is from Baybay, Leyte, Philippines. For ten years, she has been raising hogs earning her 4000 PHP per month. Hilda is asking for a loan to buy more piglets and feed. When a reliable supply of feed is obtained, she can focus on looking after her hogs. This will be a big help because she will not have to resort to buying feed on a per kilo basis at a sari-sari store (local convenience shop), which is more expensive. Her income will take care of her children's school fees and healthy meals for her family. Hilda has hopes of expanding her business and making it a success to make a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 33-year-old farmer based in Kitale, which is a small agricultural center near the famous Rift valley. He and his lovely 28-year-old wife own a small piece of land. They have been blessed with three lovely  children. 

They have raised dairy cattle and grow vegetables for 10 years. Their main income sources are selling milk and crops. They recently ventured into a farm-produce-motorcycle-transportation business. 

 David is seeking a  40,000 KES loan to grow his horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, as  evidenced  by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford David access to a loan facility that will aid him to grow his horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, David’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: to expand his  farm.

loans.name: Hernanita

texts.en:
Hernanita is a 28-year-old married woman with four children.

She has earned a living growing  rice for 7 years. Hernanita requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and  seeds.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and  seeds.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a 59-year-old  married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Lucena has had a charcoal making business for 8 years and requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more coconut shells.

 In the future, Lucena would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut shells to use in her business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Saturnina works hard to support her family. She has a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines, and also earns income from selling vegetables. Saturnina is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

Saturnina has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Maria Janett

texts.es:
Maria vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos a quienes les garantiza una buena calidad de vida gracias a su negocio con el cual intenta generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente, junto con su compañero, para que en su hogar mejoren las condiciones económicas y puedan tener una vida plena. 

Desde hace dos años comenzó con gran esfuerzo un negocio de papelería y venta de variedades en un local ubicado en el municipio de Medellín.

Debido a que sus clientes están aumentando y cada vez demandan más productos, Maria busca un préstamo para comprar surtido de papelería y ofrecer a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos en su negocio.

Con este préstamo la actividad de Maria tendrá un gran impulso pues mejorara su inventario y sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her partner and two children, whom she can guarantee good living conditions thanks to her business.
She seeks to make enough profit to contribute to the household economically, as does her partner, so that the economic conditions of their household improve and they can lead fulfilling lives.

With great effort she began her stationer's business two years ago, also selling other varieties of things, in a shop located in the municipality of Medellín.

As the number of customers and their demand is growing, Maria seeks a loan to further stock her stationer's shop and offer her customers a greater variety of products in her shop.
This loan would boost Maria's business as it would increase her stock and her sales.

loans.use: to stock her stationer's shop

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa is a married woman; she lives in her own house, which has no electricity or piped water. 

Jumwa operates a charcoal and firewood selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators.
 
With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Dzhafar

texts.ru: Джафар, 36 лет, женат, отец 2 детей. Он работает в мясном павильоне, закупая мясо у односельчан для перепродажи.  Также сам занимается животноводством в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи. Начав свою деятельность 17 лет назад, на сегодня в хозяйстве Джафара есть 4 коровы, заготовлено 700 тюков сена для скота. Он полон сил и энергии развивать свой бизнес и заниматься любимым делом, так как нужно растить своих детей, обучать их. В целях расширения бизнеса, Джафар обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку мяса для увеличения товарооборота в павильоне. Доходы от кредита он планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en: Dzhafar is 36 years old, married and a father of 2 children. He works at a butcher shop and buys meat from his neighbors for resale. He is also involved in animal husbandry to provide an additional source of income for his family. He started his business 17 years ago and today has 4 cows and a stock of 700 bales of hay. He is full of strength and energy to develop his business and be involved in an activity he loves because he has to raise and educate his children. In order to expand his business, Dzhafar requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy meat to increase his shop's product turnover. He plans to invest the earnings from this loan into further developing his business and building a barn for his livestock.

loans.use: to purchase meat for resale in his shop

loans.name: Kry

texts.en: A famer living in Battambang province, Kry is 29 years old and a mother of one child. She earns an income to support her family by planting and harvesting rice and pineapples. This is Kry's fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs. She hopes that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and to pay for labor costs

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert, aged 35 years, is an agriculturalist, mainly in poultry farming. He started farming in 2008 in Nyakatuntu, a rural Mitooma district. He is married with four children, ages ten, six, four and one. Three children attend school at the moment. Robert is also a head cook at a seminary for an additional source of income to support his family.  

Robert has applied for a loan of UGX 1,200,000 (one million two hundred thousand shillings) to buy more birds for his business. He is a hard-working man who works for 12 hours a day and seven days a week. His clients are egg traders and their continued support and his tireless efforts have enabled him to grow. He is faced with the challenge of competition, but he has learned to manage it through hard work. 

He hopes to be financially stable and to educate all his children for a better future.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a two-needled machine

loans.name: Jose Mario

texts.es:
José de 53 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 3 hijos, estudió hasta 2° grado de educación básica, su pareja es ama de casa, ella y sus tres hijos viven con él.

José es agricultor de granos básicos, aprendió de su padre que también era agricultor, también trabaja como jornalero para otras personas por lo que le pagan el día de trabajo, además es pescador artesanal en una laguna que hay en su comunidad y es de esta forma como provee lo necesario a su familia.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales eléctricos para instalar la energía eléctrica en su casa, pagar la instalación y el derecho a la empresa que la suministra. Su meta es dar el estudio a sus hijos para que tengan mejor oportunidad en la vida.
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old, lives common law and has 3 children.  He studied until 2nd grade of elementary education, his wife is a housewife.  She and the three children live with him.

Jose is a farmer of basic grains.  He learned from his father who was also a farmer.  He also works as a labourer for others as they pay the workday.  He is also a fisherman in a lagoon found within his community and this is how he is able to provide what is necessary for his family.

He requests a loan to buy electrical materials to install electricity in his home, pay for the installation and rights to the supplying company. His goal is to provide study opportunities to his children in order for them to have a better chance in life.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials to install electricity in his home

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Pheap is 50 years old and a mother of four children. To improve her family's living conditions, she grows rice on one and half hectares. She has been involved in this business for ages and it brings her about 25,900 KHR per day. 

This is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid back her past loans wisely and has improved her living condition at a gradually pace. 

In a group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend her loan to buy fertilizers, rice seed and pay for labor costs. She hopes that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seed and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats to increase his business.

loans.name: Chim's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Battambang province, Chim is 54 years old and a mother of seven children. To make a living, she grows rice on an area of six and half hectares. Moreover, she can earn extra income from working for others for a fee. 

This is Chim's sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She is leading a group of three to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income from her rice farm to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Mubarek

texts.en: Mubarek is a 24-year-old Internally Displaced Person. She is married, and her husband works as a butcher. They have children of school age. Mubarek loves her family and works for the sake of their well-being. She makes a living by engaging in animal husbandry. Mubarek has bred cattle for the past 3 years with the help of her husband and children. She enjoys her business because she likes domestic animals. With the loan, Mubarek wants to increase the number of livestock in her business. Mubarek hopes for the loan so can increase the income from her business.

loans.use: to increase the number of livestock in her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Hayk

texts.en:
Hayk is 42 years old and lives with his lovely family in the village of Goravan in Ararat region. Hayk’s main occupation for the past many years has been in agriculture; he is specifically involved in apricot production. This year’s frostbite damaged the apricot harvest, and he had serious financial losses. In addition to his agricultural activities, he also has a small business producing iron doors, gates, and fences. 

He plans to use this loan to recover from his agricultural losses. He will use the 350,000 AMD loan to buy corn seed, to plan the sowing of the seed, and to do land-smoothing activities.

loans.use: to buy corn seed, to plan the sowing of the seed, and to do land-smoothing activities

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000 she wants to purchase four bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase four bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.ru: Майрам, 56 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У Майрам высшее образование, она работает в школе учителем. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, 20 лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Майрам есть 4 коровы, 2 лошади и 20 овец. На земельном участке мерою 1,50Га она выращивает ячмень для реализации.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Майрам обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и теленка. Доходы от кредита Майрам планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Mairam is 56 years old, married and has 5 children. Mairam has a college education and works as a school teacher. To provide the primary income for her family, she became involved in agriculture 20 years ago, starting this business with 10,000 som (KGS). Mairam's farm contains 4 cows, 2 horses and 20 sheep. She grows barley for sale on 1.50 hectares of land. In order to further develop her business, Mairam requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy sheep and a calf. Mairam plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep and a calf for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Dario Antonio

texts.es:
Dario es un hombre casado, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable, trabajó con su familia en  diferentes negocios donde adquirió experiencia en las ventas. 

Desde hace 4 años inició con una tienda de abarrotes para trabajarla como independiente y  labora desde las 7:00 am a 10:00 pm  

Dario sueña con tener un supermercado a futuro, por lo pronto con el crédito solicitado desea adquirir al por mayor una gran variedad de productos como verduras, granos, frutas, hortalizas etc., y poder brindarle a sus clientes artículos de excelente calidad. 

Con este negocio ha podido salir adelante poco a poco e intentara mejorar su vida y la de su familia al lado de la Corporación Interactuar y los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Dario is a married man and is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He worked with his family in different businesses, where he acquired experience in sales. 

Four years ago he opened a grocery store in order to work independently, and he works from 7am to 10pm.  Dario reams of having a supermarket in the future.  For now, with the credit requested, he wants to acquire a great variety of products in bulk such as vegetables, grains, fruits, and other fresh produce, in order to offer his customers high quality items. 

With the business he has been able to get ahead little by little and he will try to improve his life and that of his family through the help of Kiva partner Interactuar and the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to acquire a great variety of products in bulk such as vegetables, grains, fruits, and other fresh produce, in order to offer his customers high quality items.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Rosmery es una mujer de 33 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 13 años y una hija mujer de 10 años, y su negocio es la venta de desayuno y sándwiches.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, buena oyente, solidaria, fuerte, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Chuquiaguillo’ un área caracterizada por encontrarse en una zona recién urbanizada, de clima frio y seco, con una temperatura ambiente entre 2-18 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Rosmery es de tez morena, baja estatura, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español para el comercio. Su vida la  comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia familiar que cuenta con agua potable, electricidad y gas. Su negocio es la venta de desayuno y sándwiches, su negocio inicio porque observó que cerca de su casa se asentaron dos paradas finales de minibuses, y como no existen tiendas ni restaurantes por el lugar, vio la oportunidad de vender desayunos a los choferes. Sus desayunos consiste en; café, mate, trimate o te, acompañado de; pan con queso, sándwiches de huevo frito, palta, fiambres, mermelada o mantequilla. “mi negocio es próspero, me dedico a servir alimentos ricos y me esfuerzo por no perder clientes, ellos me conocen y ya saben el menú diario, les gusta comer…” comenta. Su sueño es implementar la venta de almuerzo y cena, ella desea realizar una inversión en su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora para poder conservar alimentos congelados y ampliar su negocio. Esta es la segunda secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Rosmery solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora para ampliar su negocio y vender almuerzo y cena.
texts.en:
Rosmery is a 33 year-old woman who lives with her life partner and has a 13 year old son and 10 year old daughter.  Her business involves selling breakfast and sandwiches.  She is a good mother, is independent, entrepreneurial, a good listener, helpful, strong, responsible and hard-working.  Her business is conducted in the zone called "Chuquiaguillo," an area characterized by being recently settled with a cold and dry climate and a temperature between 2 and 18 degrees Celsius all year long. 

Rosmery has dark skin, is short, has long dark hair, and her maternal language is Aymará.  She speaks Spanish for doing business.  She lives with her partner who works in construction, and her children study in school.  They live in their own family home and have running water, electricity and gas.  Her business involves selling breakfast and sandwiches.  She started her business because she observed that close to her home there were two final minibus stops, and since there were no restaurants or stores nearby, she saw an opportunity to sell breakfast to the drivers.  Her breakfasts consist of coffee, mate (a traditional drink made with water and coca leaves), trimate (another traditional drink made with chamomile, coca leaves and anise), and tea.  She serves these beverages with cheese bread, fried egg sandwiches, avocado, cold cuts, marmalade or butter.  

She notes that "my business is prosperous.  I dedicate myself to serving tasty foods and I work hard to avoid losing customers.  They know me and know the daily menu. They like to eat." Her dream is to add the sale of lunch and dinner.  She hopes to invest in her business through the purchase of a freezer in order to conserve frozen foods and grow her business.  This is her second loan sequence with Kiva's field partner in the four years that she has been working in this business. 

For these reasons Rosmery is requesting a loan in order to buy a freezer to grow her business and to be able to sell lunch and dinner.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer in order to grow her business and be able to sell lunch and dinner.

loans.name: Severa

texts.en:
Severa is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Severa is 59 years old now.

Severa has a coconut wine-vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Severa has been in this business for 22 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Kodrai 2 Group

texts.fr: Worokia, membre représentatif est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 font toujours l'école et les 2 autres font le commerce. En effet, la famille de Worokia est engagée dans le commerce puisque son époux aussi est commerçant. Avec ce prêt elle voudrait acheter 4 sacs de maïs, 1 sac de petit mil et 1 sac de mil pour vendre en détail. Elle exerce dans ce domaine depuis 4 ans.Présentement au Burkina Faso, la période est propice à l'achat des céréales puis que le coût est un peu bas. Avec le bénéfice de ses ventes, Worokia pourra renforcer son commerce et s'occuper aussi de sa famille.
texts.en: Worokia, a representative member, is a married mother of four children, of whom two are still in school, and the others work in commerce. Worokia’s family is basically dedicated to commerce, since her husband is also a merchant. With this loan, she would like to purchase 4 sacks of corn, a sack of pearl millet, and a sack of millet to sell retail. She has been operating in this domain for four year. Presently in Burkina Faso, the time is right to purchase grains, since the cost is rather low. With the profits from her sales, Worokia will be able to bolster her business and also take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase 4 sacks of corn, a sack of pearl millet, and a sack of millet to sell

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is a 27-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children from Ormoc City, Leyte. She is engaged in food vending business. She cooks snack foods like sweetened bananas and sells them to her customers. She has been in the business for more than two years now.

Tita is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil and others. With a loan, she will be able to cook and sell more to her customers. In the future, Tita hopes to invest in a more profitable venture and save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Orozbuu

texts.ru: Орозбуу, 50 лет, замужем. У Орозбуу- среднее образование, она с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Орозбуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 10 овец и 7 коз. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Орозбуу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита позволят Орозбуу развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи.
texts.en: Orozbuu is 50 years old and married. Orozbuu has a secondary education. Since 2010, she has been practicing farming, providing for her family with the earnings. Thanks to Orozbuu's hardwork, she currently has 2 cows, 10 sheep and 7 goats on her farm. Her average monthly income from this business is 15,000 som (KGS). Orozbuu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan. She is requesting a loan for 60,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle to fatten up and resell. The earnings from this loan will allow Orozbuu to develop her business and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Gabriel De Jesus

texts.es:
Gabriel, de 60 años, inicio con un negocio de estampados hace muchos años con el afán de buscar una actividad que le generara ingresos para poder sobrevivir.

En el momento en nació su hijo, encontró su motivación para trabajar incansablemente y así ofrecerle lo mejor para su vida y desarrollo.

Hoy en día su hijo tiene 20 años y se ha convertido en la alegría de este hombre trabajador.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como tintes, moldes de plantillas y otros elementos que le permitan mantener su servicio disponible y poder llevar el sustento para su hogar.

Con este préstamo podrá sostener  a su hijo y a su esposa brindándoles una calidad de vida mejor.

Apoya a Gabriel para que pueda continuar con su actividad!
texts.en:
Gabriel, who is 60 years old, started a screen-printing business many years ago with the ambition of looking for an activity that would generate income for him to be able to survive.

At the moment of his son's birth, he found his motivation for working tirelessly to give him the best for his life and development. Now, his son is 20 years old and has become this hardworking man's joy.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of inks, stencils, and other elements that will allow him to keep his service available and to provide sustenance for his household.  With this loan, he will be able to sustain his son and his wife, providing them with a better quality of life.

Support Gabriel so that he can continue with his activity!

loans.use: to buy supplies like inks, stencils, and other elements that will allow him to keep his service available

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Mme AMINATA est mariée et mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 07ans. 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 06 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes et chaussures depuis 06ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés en ville.
Elle veut s’acheter  40 chaussures et 10pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour s’acheter  un hangar et ajouter d’autres activités. Mme ambitionne pouvoir voyager elle-même à Lomé, Cotonou pour acheter ses marchandises.
texts.en: Ms. AMINATA is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 25 years old, and the youngest is 7. Four go to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. AMINATA has been selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and shoes for six years. She gets her supplies from the market in town. She wants to purchase 40 shoes and 10 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth. She wants to use her profits to purchase a shed and to add other work. Her ambition is to be able to travel to Lomé and Cotonou herself in order to purchase merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase 40 shoes and 10 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Habibou

texts.fr:
Mme HABIBOU est mariée et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 08ans car sont des jumeaux. Les 02 vont à l’école. Elle a  06personnes en charge.
Mme fait la transformation de la farine de pain de singe et des céréales depuis 08ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages.
Elle veut s’acheter 05 sacs de pain de singe et 02 sacs de sucre.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une alimentation.
texts.en: Ms. HABIBOU is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 8 years old, and the youngest is 8, since they are twins. The two go to school. She has six persons to support. Ms. HABIBOU has been producing flour made from ‘monkey bread’ [the fruit of the baobab tree] and grains for eight years.  She gets her supplies from the villages. She wants to purchase 5 sacks of ‘monkey bread’ and 2 bags of sugar. She wants to use her profits in order to expand her business. Her ambition is to open a grocery store.
