loans.use: to purchase 5 sacks of ‘monkey bread’ and 2 sacks of sugar

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen, 25 years old, is in the hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs. Aside from raising hogs, she also engages in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish to the nearby community. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 2 years old respectively.

Aileen is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy an additional pig, pig feed and to have additional capital for her fish vending business. These tools will help Aileen raise and sell more healthy pigs in the coming months. This will also help improve her earnings in her fish vending business. Thus providing her family with good food and better living conditions. In the future, Aileen is hoping that she can handle both of her livelihoods to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy an additional pig, pig feed, and have additional capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Karidjatou

texts.fr:
Mme KARIDJATOU est mariée et mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 32ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle n’a  personnes en charge.
Mme vend des prêt à porter depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé, Abidjan et au Mali.
Elle veut s’acheter 60complets habits, 20sachets de chaussures et 10pièces de pagnes.
Elle veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son commerce. Mme ambitionne construire une maison d’habitation dans sa  parcelle.
texts.en: Ms. KARIDJATOU is a married mother of two children. The oldest is 32 years old, and the youngest is 18. One goes to school. She has nobody to support. Ms. KARIDJATOU has been selling ready-to-wear clothing for five years. She gets her supplies from Lomé and Abidjan and from Mali. She wants to purchase 60 outfits, 20 pouches of shoes, and 10 lengths of 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa). She wants to use her profits in order to expand her business. Her ambition is to build a house on her parcel of land.

loans.use: to purchase 50 outfits, 20 pouches of shoes, and 10 lengths of ‘pagne’ cloth.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 40-year-old, married woman and a mother of three dependents, ages seven, nine, and 14, from Baybay, Leyte. She has been engaged in a hog-raising business for 13 years now. 

Gemma is asking for a loan to buy feed for the pigs and additional piglets to raise. With this loan, Gemma will be able to enhance her profit and income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a farmer from Baybay, Leyte. He is a father to a 3-year-old son. Gabriel primarily grows rice to sell to his community. He works hard to keep his farm productive and his income stable. His harvest also provides food for his family. He requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for his farm. Gabriel hopes for his business to succeed and for the loan to help increase his harvest. He hopes for his family to experience a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his farm.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes esta estudiando la carrera de ingeniería agroindustrial, aspira ser una buena profesional, poder trabajar en su area y tener un salario digno para poder ayudar a su familia.
Quiere ser una profesional útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a los demás, es por ello que se esta esforzando tanto.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la carrera, y poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lourdes is studying for a degree in Agroindustrial Engineering. She aspires to become a successful professional, be able to work in her chosen profession, and have a decent salary so that she can help her family.

Lourdes wants to be a useful professional, not only for herself, but also for other people. For this reason, she is striving to do her best.

Lourdes is requesting this loan so that she can pay her degree fees. This will allow her to continue with her studies.

loans.use: to pay her degree fees.

loans.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Agripina has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the KES 80,000 loan, Agripina wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Amsardine Group

texts.fr:
Madame MARIAM est la  représentante  du groupe AMSARDINE. Elle  se porte très bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé à 27 ans et le moins âgé a 13 ans. 01 va à l’école. Elle a 01 personne en charge.
Madame est restauratrice depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans le marché de son quartier, ces clients sont les habitants de son quartier. 
Elle veut  s’acheter  01 sac de riz ; 01sac de maïs ; 01 bidon d’huile.
Madame désire épargner ces bénéfices. Elle ambitionne agrandir son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Ms. MARIAM is the representative of the group AMSARDINE. She is in good health. A married woman, she is the mother of two children. The oldest is 27 years old, and the youngest is 13. One goes to school. She has one person to support. Ms. MARIAM has been a restauranteur for eight years. She gets her supplies from the market in her district. Her customers are the residents of her district. She wants to purchase a sack of rice, a sack of corn, and a container of oil. She would like to save her profits. Her ambition is to expand her business and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, a sack of corn, and container of oil for her restaurant

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili is a married woman with three children, all attending school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to pay for goods bought on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting of KES 100,000, she wants to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a businessman selling timber. He is married with three children ages 7, 5 and 2 years. He has applied for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy trees for cutting. He also trades in tea from his own plantation where he earns additional income to supplement his monthly earnings. He is a hard-working man who works eight hours a day and five days a week. He started farming in 2004 in a rural setting but has seen it grow from one level to another through his hard work.The business is in the Kyamuhunga, Igara, Bushenyi District. His customers are timber traders and builders while their continued support and his tireless efforts have helped his farming to grow. He started this business to have a source of income to meet his family's needs. His major challenge in the business is competition from other farmers but is ready to grow through his hard work. He hopes to educate all his children in the future. He is grateful for the loan opportunity.

loans.use: To buy trees for cutting into timber

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José  de 29 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, sus esposa es comerciante, en la casa tiene una venta de refrescos. 

José es Agricultor de granos básicos, también es empleado encargado de distribuir los recibos de teléfono y de energía eléctrica en la comunidad, tiene dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad, pero de igual forma apoya a su esposa con la venta de refrescos, golosinas y pupusas en la cancha de la comunidad cada vez que hay algún encuentro futbolístico o evento.

Solicita el préstamo para cubrir los gastos de cosecha del maíz, pagando mano de obra y el desgranado, además comprar bebidas y golosinas para su negocio. José sueña con mejorar la venta de su negocio para algún día construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jose is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. He studied a basic education through 6th grade. His wife works as a merchant; she has a beverage sale business at home.

Jose is a farmer of basic grains. He is also in charge of distributing the phone and electric bills in the community. He has been working this job for two years. In addition, he helps his wife sell beverages, snacks, and pupas (stuffed corn tortillas) at the community field every time there is a soccer match or an event.

He is requesting a loan to cover the expenses associated with cultivating corn, to pay manual laborers to remove the kernels, and to buy beverages and snacks for his business. Jose dreams of improving the sales of his business so that one day he can build his own house.

loans.use: to cover the expenses associated with cultivating corn, to pay manual laborers to remove the kernels, and to buy beverages and snacks for his business.

loans.name: Nim's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham province, Nim is 45 years old and a mother of four children. To support her family living, she earns income via rice cropping on a one-hectare area and also, working for others for a fee. She can earn income about 26,300 KHR per day. 

This is Nim’s sixth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans wisely to improve her living condition in a gradually pace. She leads a group of four members to request a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizers and pesticide. She hopes that she can buy a decent motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticide.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 27-year-old, married man from Gaza City. He lives with his wife in a small house. He has worked as an electrician for one year. It is a good business, but he still needs more experience in this field. He would like to improve himself and expand his job. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a mobile phone for his electrical workshop, so that his clients can call him. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to take more orders and increase his income.  Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a mobile phone for his electrical workshop, so his clients can call him.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 23-year-old mother of two children, ages 3 and 5. She and her family live in Baybay, Leyte. She currently runs a hog-raising business. She finds it profitable and improving. She works hard in her business, hoping that it will help her meet her family's financial needs for daily living. Presently, Jane needs  additional capital for her business. She is asking a loan of 4,000 PHP to pay for her hog fattening. She is certain that through this loan she can buy what she needs to grow and develop her business. Jane is looking for a better future for her business and she hopes that one day it will expand into a higher-yielding investment. With the income, she can provide a better future for her children and put some money aside for future use.

loans.use: to pay for hog fattening

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anwer

texts.en:
Anwer is a 55-year-old married woman, and a mother of two children. The income earned by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses; therefore, Anwer started her business of selling milk. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business. Currently she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo in order to sell milk to more customers. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo, in order to sell milk to more customers.

loans.name: Abanyarukundo Group

texts.en: Donathille is a group leader; age 46, and married with  four children ages 11 to 22 and all in school. The group is called Abanyarukundo, which means “beloved” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses for a better future. Donathille is a tailor and has been in business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes and machines for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to expand in her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and machines for tailoring.

loans.name: Mwambuni

texts.en:
Mwambuni is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, power bills, and school fees.

Mwambuni has operated a pig-selling business for the past three years. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her business. 

With the loan of KES 40,000, Mwambuni wants to purchase pig feed and additional pigs. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and additional pigs.

loans.name: Husnan

texts.en:
Husnan is a married woman and a mother of three children. 

The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a driver, providing transportation services, using his rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for the last four years to meet the day-to-day expenditures of his family. But, due to some maintenance issues, he is unable to provide service to more customers and, ultimately, he earns less profit. 

Therefore, Husnan has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000 for her son. Her son will utilize this loan amount to repair his rickshaw in order to provide better service to his passengers and also to be able to generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to repair her son's rickshaw, so he can provide better service to his passengers.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан, 59 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей. У Уулкан среднее образование, она на пенсии, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав в 1999 году благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Уулкан, на сегодняшний день у нее есть: 2 коровы и земельный надел мерою 0,60 ГА, где она выращивает хлопчатник. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 4,000 сом (KGS), также Уулкан получает пенсию. однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому Уулкан в преддверии весенне-полевых работ обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для закупки семян, удобрений, часть средств будет потрачена на покупку скота. Уулкан намерена улучшить благосостояние своей семьи и доходы от кредита направлять на развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Uulkan is 59 years old, a widow and has 3 children. Uulkan has a secondary education. She is retired and, to provide the primary income for her family, has been involved in farming and animal husbandry since 1999. Thanks to Uulkan's persistence, drive and hard work, today she has 2 cows and 0.60 hectares of land, where she grows cotton. The monthly business income amounts to about 4,000 som (KGS). Uulkan also receives a pension, but this money is not enough for a decent life, and this is why Uulkan, in anticipation of spring field work, requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy seeds, fertilizers and livestock. Uulkan intends to improve her family's well-being and direct the earnings from the loan toward developing her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock, seeds and fertilizers in order to increase her income and improve her family's well-being

loans.name: Olia

texts.en: Olia is 46 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Olia works as a cook at a local restaurant and gets a monthly income. She decided to start a trading business in order to generate additional income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 USD. With the received credit she will purchase a stock of clothes and will resell them at a higher price. Olia plans to expand this business in future. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to start a trading business in order to generate additional income.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married mother of three children ages 9, 6 and 4. She is 35 years old and a resident of Mcarthur, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling noodles, canned goods, eggs, vinegar, cooking oil,and soft drinks.

Emily is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional stock like canned goods, beverages, seasonings and toiletries. In this way, she could display and sell various merchandise that could attract more consumers. Hopefully, she could gain profit that she will be able to invest in possible business opportunities. She could now afford to buy good food for the whole family.

In the future, Emily dreams to expand her business to make it productive and profitable for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like canned goods, beverages, seasonings and toiletries

loans.name: Skin Success Group

texts.en:
Farida is 37 years old, married and has two school-age children. She has run a  beauty salon for six years now. Working from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily, she is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is her first credit request from Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Skin Success, a nine-member group. The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 
Farida will use this loan to buy hair products for her beauty salon. She dreams of opening another beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Liana

texts.en:
Liana is a 33-year-old, married woman, from Sartichala, in the Kakheti region of east Georgia. She lives with her husband, brother-in-law, and pensioners' parents-in-law. 

Liana's husband is a driver and he transports people in a minibus, from Sartichala to the capital city. Liana is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has a cow and she milks the cow everyday to produce dairy products. 

The family owns a commercial space, where Liana decided to open a small shop. She already started renovation of this space and needs money to finish it and also to purchase products, such as washing powder, soap, and shampoo. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and LLC Micro Finance Organization Credo, enables her to get a loan of USD 4,000. As the shop is opens, Liana will work hard to increase the income and she plans to expand the shop in the future, with the increased income. She is very motivated to earn more money and to be involved in her own business. 

Liana awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a small shop, where she will sell washing powder, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra de 35 años de edad, tiene una familia la cual esta conformada por su único hijo y su esposo, su hijo tiene 14 años y esta estudiando 1º ano de bachillerato y su esposo el cual esta postrado en una cama debido a un accidente que le causo daños en la columna vertebral, lo cual lo ha dejado sin poder caminar.


 Sandra tiene diez años de tener una pequeña tienda, ella desde muy pequeña le enseñaron a trabajar sus padres y solo logro estudiar séptimo año de educación básica, desde que sus esposo tubo el accidente a ella le a tocado mantener a su familia humildemente; tiene una tienda la cual vende algunos productos de la canasta básica de la cual la ganancia le sirve para  alimentar a su hijo y su esposo. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar estantes para tener su mercadería y para comprar artículos navideños. El sueño más próximo de Sandra es que su hijo se gradué de bachillerato.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old. Her family consists of her husband and their only child. Her son is 14 years old and is studying in his first year of high school. Sandra’s husband is bedridden because of spinal damage that he suffered from an accident. He is not able to walk.

Sandra has managed a small store for the past 10 years. Her parents taught her how to work at a very young age and she was able to complete her basic education through the seventh year. Since her husband had his accident, Sandra has been to sustain her family through modest means. In her store, she sells a few basic household products. The income she earns enables her to feed her husband and child.

Sandra is requesting a loan in order to buy shelves for displaying her merchandise. She will also buy Christmas products. Her next wish is to see her son graduate from high school.

loans.use: to purchase shelves for displaying merchandise and to buy Christmas products.

loans.name: Katana's Group

texts.en:
Katana is a 46-year-old, Komaza tree farmer. He has six children, three of whom are in school. Katana is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Katana also cultivates maize, cassava, cowpeas and green grams. He also supports his family through carpentry. 

He decided to join Komaza to get money for educating his children.  He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees and start dairy farming. Katana’s favorite part about working with Komaza is seeing positive changes in the environment. Katana is the farmer with his hand up in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support.

loans.name: Talaat

texts.en:
Talaat is 53 year-old man who lives in Baniswef, Egypt. He is married to a housewife and has three elementary school kids. He is the only breadwinner of the family. He works in the Egyptian local council with a very low salary and it is not enough to cover the family's monthly expenses. Six years ago, he started a small electrical accessories project. However, the items in his store are not enough to continue his sales so he needs a loan to buy more products to sell in his small store. Talaat requested a 4000 EPG loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due date.   
Talaat is requesting another 6000 EPG loan to buy more wires, cables, and lamps for his store to meet the customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy wires, cables and lamps for his store to continue his sales.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old lives in the village of Mundri. A loan of 3,200 SSP would help him pay for a new stock of skin care products to keep up with customer demand..

loans.use: to buy skin care products

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 28 year-old man who lives in Baniswef. He is married to a housewife with no kids. The only source of the family income is a fruit store he started 2 years ago but he buys the fruit for his store on credit. Buying fruit on credit decreases Mustafa's business income and his family's monthly income. As a result, he might not be able to continue his sales because traders might refuse to sell him more fruit for any reason.
Mustafa needs a 5000 EPG loan so that he can pay cash for the fruits to buy them at reasonable prices. This loan will help him raise his monthly income and improve the living condition of his family.

loans.use: To pay cash for the fruits he buys such as bananas, apples, and oranges

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 31-year–old single man from Baniswef. His father is on pension and has three younger siblings. Adel's mother is a housewife. She suffers from serious illness and has been on medication for many years. The monthly income of the family can cover neither the cost of the mother's medications nor their monthly expenses. Adel can't afford the money he needs to get married as well. Consequently, five years ago, Adel started a small grocery store business. He requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to buy a refrigerator and some groceries such as sugar, rice, and pasta to increase his income and cover his family's monthly expenses.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator and some groceries such as sugar, rice, and pasta to increase his income and cover his family's monthly expenses.

loans.name: Thoraya

texts.en: Thoraya is 37 year-old married woman with a daughter in preparatory school and a son in elementary school. She went to a commerce high school in her governorate. 5 years ago, she started a small poultry and sheep project by a 2000 EPG loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on due date. Then she requested another 4000 EPG loan from TADE and successfully repaid it, as well. Thoraya is a very ambitious, optimistic, inspiring and hard working woman. She looks forward to expanding her business so she requested a 5000 EPG loan to purchase more sheep and poultry.

loans.use: To purchase hens, ducks and goats to expand her project.

loans.name: Hasnaa

texts.en: Hasnaa is a 38 year-old married woman with 2 daughters and 2 sons (3 in elementary school and the oldest in preparatory school). She went to a commerce high school in her governorate. 5 years ago, she started a small poultry and sheep project by a 2000 EPG loan from TADE and successfully repaid it on the loan's due date. Then she requested another 4000 EPG loan from TADE and successfully repaid it as well. Hasnaa is a very ambitious, optimistic, inspiring and hard working woman. She looks forward to expanding her business so she requested a 5000 EPG loan to purchase more sheep and poultry.

loans.use: To purchase hens, ducks and goats to expand her project

loans.name: Mina

texts.en: Mina is a 22-year-old single young man from Baniswef. His father is a part-time farmer (an activity that doesn't generate a consistent income), and his mother is a housewife and he has three younger sisters. After high school, Mina decided to start a small sheep and goat fattening business to help his father with the family expenses. He prepared a suitable place in his house for the project. Mina's sisters are going to help him in fattening the sheep and he will be responsible for This will provide a consistent monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy livestock such as goats and lambs to fatten for sale in the local market

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 47 year old man, from Banisuef, Egypt, married to a housewife with two daughters and one son (all in school). He used to work in house pre-painting preparations (part-time) but now he became unable to do the same job because of his deteriorating health condition. He decided to start a new business because prices are high and he can't afford to pay the expenses of his children. Mohammad and his wife have prepared a place to use for fattening cattle and they requested a 5000 EPG loan to buy their first head of cattle. Mohammad believes that this project will soon be a good source of income for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle to start his fattening project and have a real source of income

loans.name: Said

texts.en: Said is a 54-year–old man from Baniswef. He is married to a housewife and has three children. He has been selling fruits for 20 years. In spite of his old age, his children are still in school as he got married in a very old age. His children are growing up and their monthly expenses are increasing and Said can't cover them anymore. So he requested a 5000 EPG loan from TADE to buy fruits and vegetables such as guavas, cucumbers, oranges, and mangoes to increase his sales, expand his business and as a result increase his family's monthly income.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables such as guavas, tomatoes, cucumbers, oranges, and mangoes

loans.name: Rahile

texts.en: Rahile is a widow whose husband died in a car crash. She has two children. Her eldest daughter is 22 years old and married and her son goes to school in eleventh class. He is engaged in sports. Rahile's family lives in the Baku region. Now Rahilya has a little business here weaving carpets. This is her  work, making carpets daily and selling them. Rahile needs a loan of 2,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan she wants to buy a new apparatus for weaving carpets to replace her broken one. She is thankful to the Kiva organization and its members for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new apparatus for weaving carpets

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 25-year-old, single man from Tubas, a village near Nablus city. He opened a store to sell mobile phones and maintenance in the village. It is a good job, and Mustafa gained this experience from his previous job. He would like to improve his business and expand it. 

Mustafa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more mobile repair parts for his store. He will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.  Mustafa appears in the photo in front of his mobile store.

loans.use: to buy more mobile repair parts for his store.

loans.name: Zohran

texts.en: Zohran is a 40-year-old woman. She is a widow and the mother of four children. She is running a business of livestock sale and purchase. She looks after the animals and is responsible for feeding them and sells them in different markets. Her business is providing her with enough income to support her children. However, she needs to earn much more for the betterment of her children and wants to provide them with a good education. Therefore Zohran has requested a loan amount of 40,000 PKR to buy livestock including baby goats, calves, etc. for resale purposes in order to expand her earnings. She is hopeful that expanding the business will help in improving her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock including baby goats, calves, etc. for resale purposes in order to expand her earnings.

loans.name: Jose Osmin

texts.es:
José de 69 años de edad, está casado y tiene un hijo que vive en el extranjero, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella vive y depende de él.

José toda su vida a sido agricultor, aprendió gracias a sus padres, además en su casa tiene ganado de repasto, todos los días a las 6:00 am camina un kilómetro para llegar donde tiene la parcela sembrada y sus animales y luego regresa a las 3:00 pm a su casa para ayudar a su esposa con los oficios.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado de engorde para luego comerciar y aspira a tener mucho más ganado para dejar de trabajar en la agricultura pues a su edad se le dificulta demasiado realizar dichos trabajos.
texts.en:
Jose is 69 years old, married, and he has a son who lives abroad. 

Jose did not have the chance to study. His wife is a homemaker, and she is the only one living with and depending on him.

He has been working in agriculture all his life. It’s work he learned from his parents. He also has pasture cattle at home. Every day at 6am he walks a kilometer to get to his farmed land and animals, and then returns home at 3pm to help his wife with the housework.

He is requesting the loan to buy cattle for fattening and trading. His aim is to own a lot more cattle so that he can stop the agricultural activities, because at his age such work has become too difficult.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
La señora Anatolia tiene 54 años de edad, separada hace 8 años, tiene dos hijos una mujer de 20 años de edad y un  hijo de 22 años, actualmente su hijo vive y trabaja en en el extranjero y su hija estudia en la facultad y le ayuda en la casa  con los trabajos.
A ella siempre le gustó todo lo referente a la cocina o la gastronomía y sus comienzo fue un comedor en el Mercado  durante 9 años estuvo en el mismo lugar trabajando con su esposo luego se le presento la oportunidad de vender el negocio completo y con ese dinero construyeron para su casa y cuando se terminó su capital decidieron ambos viajar a la Argentina para trabajar y con sus ingresos poder terminar la casa, se quedó en ese país durante 6 años y en ese tiempo cuenta ella que tuvo una crisis en su relación de pareja por el cual decidieron disolver el matrimonio, eso la afecto mucho emocionalmente y decidió volver y empezar de nuevo con todo. Volvió al país y como le gustaba la cocina empezó haciendo minutas para vender entre sus vecinos, en ese entonces recuerda ella que sacaba en la vereda una mesa en donde podía exhibir sus productos y de esa manera fue haciendo para su capital de trabajo para comprar algunos equipos e ir formándose de nuevo.
Hoy ya pudo crecer de vuelta mucho más de lo que tenia, y pide este préstamo para poder seguir creciendo, pues quiere comprar insumos al por mayor para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas.
texts.en:
Sra. Anatolia is 54 years old and has been separated from her spouse for eight years. She has two children, a 20-year-old daughter and a 22-year-old son. Her son is currently living and working abroad while her daughter is studying at a college. She helps at home with the chores.

Anatolia has always enjoyed everything related to cooking and gastronomy. She opened a diner at the market. Anatolia worked there for nine years along with her husband. Later on, she was presented with an opportunity to sell the entire business. She used the money to build her house. With her capital depleted, Anatolia and her husband decided to travel to Argentina for work. With the income they earned, they were able to finish their house. They stayed in Argentina for six years, but during this time they experienced a crisis in their relationship. Eventually they decided to dissolve their marriage. This affected Anatolia emotionally, so she decided to return to Paraguay and start over from scratch.

Upon her return, Anatolia began preparing quick meals and sold them to her neighbors due to her love of cooking. Later on, she set up a table on the sidewalk where she could display her products. With her operating capital, she was able to buy some equipment and begin anew.

Today she wants to grow and try to return to what she had. She is requesting this loan so that she can keep growing. Anatolia wants to buy supplies in bulk so that she can continue preparing her dishes.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid is married, and he is 40 years old. He has four children, all of whom learn in school and are very talented and clever. They live with his lovely family in Baku region.  Vahid always supports his children in their studies. 

Vahid has greenhouse where he grows tomatoes. He has been in this business for six years. Today he needs a loan 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan new manat). With this loan he wants to repair the water system in his greenhouse. He says great thanks to the Kiva organization and members for their support.

loans.use: to repair the water system in his greenhouse, to increase business and improve quality.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es:
José de 44 años de edad, está casado y tiene 5 hijos de 5, 9, 11, 12, y 14 años de edad pero solo 4 estudian. Él estudió hasta 6° grado de educación básica, su esposa es ama de casa y solo ella y sus hijos viven con él.

José es albañil, traba en la construcción de casa desde hace 27 años aprendió por iniciativa propia y por la necesidad de generar algún ingreso económico; trabaja de 7:00 am a 4:00 pm luego regresa a su casa a cuidar su ganado, sus dos hijos mayores le apoyan y les está enseñando a trabajar.

Solicita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto para luego venderlo, pero aspira a tener algún día ganado lechero y beneficiarse con la venta de la leche y sus derivados.
texts.en:
Jose is 44 years old. He is married and has 5 children, who are 5, 9, 11, 12, and 14 years old. Only 4 of them are in school. He studied a basic education through 6th grade. His wife is a housewife. His wife and children live with him.

Jose is a bricklayer. He has been working in house construction for 27 years. He learned this as a result of his own initiative and because he needed to generate some income. He works from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm and then returns home to care for his cattle. His two oldest children help him, and he is teaching them to work.

He is requesting a loan to buy grazing cattle, which he will later sell. He dreams of one day having dairy cattle and benefiting from the sale of milk and its derivatives.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Fatama

texts.en: Fatama has successfully built her business selling milk with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her seventh loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will enable her to increase her milk sales and to gain more profits.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales and to gain more profits.

loans.name: Farogat

texts.ru:
Фарогат образованная женщина, проживающая в городе Худжанд. У нее высшее медицинское образование. Она по профессии детский врач и на протяжении 22 лет работает в клинике. Ей нравится лечить детей и видеть их здоровыми. 
Фарогат 52 года. Она замужем, ее муж уже не работает, он вышел на пенсию. У них есть 26-летний сын и он со своей женой живет у родителей. Сын Фарогат работает в частном предприятии, а его жена студентка. В настоящий момент ей необходимо оплатить за учебный год в ВУЗе, но к сожалению у нее и у мужа нет сбережений, чтобы произвести оплату. Фарогат хочет, чтобы ее невестка успешно окончила ВУЗ и получила высшее образование. С такой целью она обратилась за кредитом. Фарогат берет кредит, чтобы оплатить за учебу невестки и надеется на финансовую поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Farogat is an educated woman who lives in the city of Khujand. She has higher medical education. She is trained to be a pediatrician and has worked at a clinic for a period of 22 years. She likes to treat children and to see them get healthy. 

Farogat is 52 years old. She is married. Her husband does not work, he is retired. They have a 26 year old son and he lives with his parents, together with his wife. Farogat's son works in a private enterprise, and his wife is a student. Currently the wife needs to pay for her tuition at the university, however unfortunately she and her husband do not have savings to make the payment. 

Farogat would like for her daughter-in-law to finish university and get higher education. With this aim she applied for a loan. Farogat takes the loan in order to pay for her daughter-in-law's tuition and hopes for financial support from you.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter-in-law's university tuition

loans.name: Estrellas De Cota Cota Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLA DE COTA COTA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Guillermina es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, venta de papa, venta de pescado, tienda de barrio.
 
El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Guillermina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un Asesor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; nos cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, pues desde niña apoyaba en el negocio familiar, ahora que tiene una familia independiente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de forraje para su ganado) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de su comunidad y posteriormente lo utilizará para alimentar a su ganado. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y la atención de la institución ofrece.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Estrellas de Cota Cota” (Stars of Cota Cota) is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Guillermina serves as its secretary. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling cheese, selling potatoes, selling fish, and managing a neighborhood store.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Guillermina. She says that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after receiving an invitation from an advisor with the organization who visited her at her house. Guillermina currently has a business of selling milk. She says that she learned this business from her parents. As a girl, she had to help with the family business. Now that she has a family of her own, Guillermina decided to start her own business.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital to buy fodder for her cattle. She acquires her supplies from the wholesale vendors in her community and will then use the fodder to feed her cows. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Guillermina is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Guillermina said that she enjoys the training seminars and the attention that the organization offers.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru: Лидия успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду КИВА и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. В хозяйстве Лидии на сегодняшний день есть 12 дойных коров, 4 бычка, 3 лошади и 3 овцы. На участке мерою 4,86 Га она выращивает клевер и ячмень. Ежедневно Лидия продает до 100 литров молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лидия обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Кредитные средства позволят Лидии сохранить поголовье скота, а весной получить здоровый приплод. Лидия планирует увеличивать хозяйство и поголовье породистых дойных коров, чтобы иметь возможность отремонтировать ее дом.
texts.en:
Lidiya successfully repaid her previous loan, after having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. 

Currently Lidiya has twelve dairy cows, four steers, three horses and three sheep on her farm. She also grows clover and barley on a plot of land of 4.86 hectares. Lidiya sells up to 100 liters of milk every day.

With an aim to further develop her business, Lidiya turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock fodder. The loan will allow Lidiya to keep the number of livestock and get healthy offspring from them in the spring. Lidiya plans to develop her farm and increase the number of purebred dairy cows, in order to get the opportunity to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase livestock fodder

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 49 years old. She is married and lives with her husband, 2 children, and a daughter-in-law in the Kaspi district. Shorena is unemployed at the moment. The family's only source of income is her husband's salary working as an artisan.

Shorena decided to start up a husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of GEL 1,000 to start a husbandry business.

With the money she receives, Shorena will purchase a cow and will produce dairy products. She already has a shed in their yard, where she will shelter the purchased cow. Shorena awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and start a husbandry business

loans.name: Zuhran

texts.en:
Zuhran is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of five children.

The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, therefore she started her business of milk sales with the help of her husband. She looks after the cattle and is responsible for feeding them while her husband sells their milk in different places. They have been doing it for many years and have become famous for providing good quality milk in their community.

Currently Zuhran requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help them to increase their sales which will ultimately help in generating more income.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo in order to increase sales

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es:
Antonieta de 32 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 3 y 5 años de edad, estudio hasta 6° grado de educación básica, por motivos de escaso recursos económicos tuvo que dejar de estudiar, actualmente ayuda a su madre con los oficios domésticos.

Antonieta es costurera, su negocio lo tiene en su casa ya que todo el día realiza costuras y trabajos. Solicita el préstamo para comprar cerdos y engordarlos, ya su mamá se dedica también a esta actividad. Su sueño más grande es algún día construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Antonieta is 32 years old, she is single and has two children, ages three and five. She attended school until the sixth grade, but due to limited financial resources, she had to drop out. She currently helps her mother with the household chores.

Antonieta is a seamstress, and she has her business in her home, since all day she is sewing and working. She is requesting the loan to buy pigs for fattening, as her mother also does this work for a living. Her biggest dream is to someday build her own home.

loans.use: to buy pigs for fattening.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 36 years old, is a responsible wife and  mother to two children aged 17 and 10. 

Having been raised in a family that earns their keep through a small eatery business, Evelyn puts up her own eatery business in 2004. The decision was made the growing needs of their family which her husband could no longer support alone. Her husband works as a construction worker and receives a very meager salary for a hard-days work. 

In 2013, she came across SEED and availed a first loan amounting to PhP 5,000. She used it for additional capital to her eatery business serving breakfast items to customers. From the additional capital, she earned PhP 700 daily which doubled her earnings. Gaining more customers, on her her second loan, Evelyn was able to open a small retail store. As this was a new endeavor, Evelyn encountered problems with customers taking credit and not paying back on time.  This however did not hamper her operations. Instead, she went on with the retail store business and discussed with customers taking credit the need to pay her back in time for her to be able to replenish her stocks and continue to provide credit to them. To date, her eatery and retail store business are still running well, having learned fully from the lessons of giving credit to customers.

On her third loan now, Evelyn wants to capitalize in electronic mobile phone load to add up to her eatery and retail store business. She will be the first one to open that kind of business in the area so she expects that this will be a great help to increase her income. Mobile phone is common place in the area and Evelyn was able to establish that customers need to walk at least 15 minutes towards the main road in order to access or buy this service. 

Evelyn values studying the business landscape in the area where she lives and run her business. She is also decisive in resolving whatever concerns she face in her business. Due to these, Evelyn was able to diversify her business and therefore also improve her family's condition of living. Before, Evelyn's household did not have had no electricity nor water connections of their own. They merely relied on neighbors selling out electricity and water on a sub-meter basis. However, with the earnings from her businesses, Evelyn was able to apply and acquire their own electric and water meters. 

Evelyn dreams of having her kids finish college and attain a better life than what they have now. She is certain that with the continuous improvements in her businesses this dream will ultimately come true.

loans.use: To buy electronic mobile phone load to be sold in retail to customers in the community.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad has successfully built her milk selling business with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By this time she has attained a good number of customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously, with the help of Kiva, she was able to expand her business. Now she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will enable her to increase her milk sales and to gain more profits for the betterment of her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase milk sales and to gain more profits

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед родился в 1973 году. Он  женат и имеет четырех детей. Его жену зовут Машхура и она домохозяйка. Он очень трудолюбивый мужчина, любит семью и старается для благополучия своей семьи.  Он сотрудничает с МДО Арванд  с 2012  года. Он подал заявку для  получения кредита на расширения своего бизнеса. У Хуршеда свой магазин автозапчастей. Его выручка составляет 1500-2500 сомони в день.  Он покупает автозапчасти по оптовой цене и продает в розницу. Хуршед  хочет в дальнейшем сотрудничать с МДО «Арванд»  и заранее благодарит за поддержку и доверие!
texts.en:
Khurshed was born in 1973. He is married and has four children. His wife is called Mashkhura and she is a housewife. Khurshed is a very hardworking man. He loves his family and strives for their well-being. 

Khurshed has worked with "MDO Arvand" since 2012. He applied for a loan to expand his business. Khurshed has a store selling vehicle spare parts. His revenue is around 1500-2500 somoni per day. He purchases vehicle spare parts at wholesale prices and sells them as retail. 

Khurshed would like to further cooperate with "MDO Arvand" and thanks in advance for the support and faith.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts to sell

loans.name: Kanoti's Group

texts.en:
Kanoti is a thirty-year-old Komaza tree farmer with six children, four of whom are in school. She is married and her spouse sells charcoal. In addition to growing trees, Kanoti also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas.

She decided to join Komaza because it is a long-term investment and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to pay school fees for her children and to start a business. Kanoti’s favorite part about working with Komaza is experiencing the partnership and support from Komaza staff. 

Kanoti is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture. Her neighbor Edison also appears in the picture, although he is not part of this loan group.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Furaha's Group

texts.en:
Furaha is a fifty-four-year-old Komaza tree farmer with six children, three of whom are in school. She is widowed.  In addition to growing trees, Furaha also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas.

She decided to join Komaza to improve her family's standard of living and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees and start livestock farming. Furaha’s favorite part about working with Komaza is seeing positive changes in the environment and the community.

Furaha is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture. Chengo also appears in the picture even though he's not part of this loan group.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en: Mary is a thirty-one-year-old Komaza tree farmer. She has five children, four of whom are in school. Mary is married and her spouse is a welder. In addition to growing trees, Mary also cultivates maize, cowpeas and cassava plus she supports her family through charcoal burning. She decided to join Komaza to improve her family's standard of living and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a business and educate her children. Mary’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting trees on her farm. Mary is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a hardworking married man living in Kagadi, Uganda. He has been dealing in produce selling alongside a mobile money business as his income sources. He is challenged by network failures in the mobile money business, price fluctuations and poor roads hindering his dream of earning more profits to get school fees for his children. William intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Asanasio

texts.en: Asanasio is thirty-two-years-old, married with three children, and living in Kasese, Uganda. He owns a textile shop of new clothes and also practices farming, growing crops such as maize, millet, rice, coffee and others to sell and earn a living. He has a dream of expanding his business into a modern boutique and educating his children. Asanasio is faced with a challenge of limited capital and market competition. He will use the loan to buy clothes for ladies and babies to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy  clothes for ladies and babies to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Floro

texts.en:
Floro works hard to sustain his family's needs.

Starting out as a pedicab (a bicycle with a cart for servicing passengers) driver for a neighbor, Floro came across SEED and availed a loan to buy his own pedicab unit.  From the increased income, Floro saved and continued to avail further loans. At one instance, he financed the setting up of a general store and at another loan he decided to set up an eatery business selling out viands in the community. The store and the eatery business was managed and operated by Floro with the help of his wife. Even as the two other businesses are running well, Floro is determined to continue with the pedicab business. He maintains that the driving the pedicab was how he started having his two other businesses and besides, his wife has been an able partner in their family's businesses.

On his 5th loan now, Floro wants to take advantage of the holiday season and finance the needs for catering to school and office parties. He wanted to buy in bulk pork, spices and other ingredients which are needed to cook various food items for the catering. Floro sees that this is a good opportunity for him to earn.

Through hard work, Floro want s to see his son finish off in college and have a better life. He also wanted to have his house repaired and set up for rooms for rent owing to the demand in the area. The loan extended to him will make his plans feasible.

loans.use: To buy pork, spices, and other ingredients for catering in time for the holiday season.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a forty-two-year-old male married with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

Fred is a farmer growing crops such as maize, beans, bananas, cotton, groundnuts and others to sell to get income for his family. Fred has a dream of being a model farmer and having a happy family.

Fred will use the loan to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour. His main difficulty is the floods that affect his crops.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Gustavo

texts.es:
El señor Gustavo, es casado, vive con su señora Veronica tiene un camión semi-remolque, el cual utiliza en servicios de fletes, tiene también un deposito, se encuentra trabajando en la actividad desde hace ya varios años, lo que le permite poder seguir creciendo.
Gustavo fue muchos años empleado de la empresa vidrios, luego se independizó y con mucho sacrificio se compró para su camión, actualmente realiza trabajos de fletes para la empresa y otros clientes que cuenta.
El préstamo que pide es para que el Sr. Gustavo pueda comprar maderas, clavos, tornillos, herramientas y demás, ya que él está interesado en habilitar un nuevo rubro que es la de carpintería.
texts.en:
Sr. Gustavo is married and lives with Sra. Veronica. He owns a semi-trailer truck that he uses for providing cargo transport services. He also has a storage depot. Gustavo has been in working at this business for several years and it has enabled him to keep growing.

For many years, Gustavo was employed at a glass company. He later became independent and purchased his truck after a great deal of sacrifice. Gustavo currently performs cargo transport jobs for his business and his other clients.

The loan that Sr. Gustavo is requesting will be used to buy wood, nails, screws, tools, and other items. He is interested in starting a new trade in the carpentry field.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, screws, tools, and other items in order to start a new carpentry business.

loans.name: Richar

texts.es:
Richar es casado, vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, se dedica a la compra venta de productos varios de primera necesidad ya hace mas de 2 años, sus principales clientes son de las zonas aledañas a Encarnación.
Richar quiere seguir con su trabajo de ventas ambulantes, es por eso que se está esforzando, y pide este préstamo para poder  invertirlo en la compra de una moto con carro, lo que le permitirá seguir con sus ventas, es más ir mejorando cada día más.
texts.en:
Richar is married and lives in the city of Encarnación. He has been buying and selling various basic necessity products for more than two years. His main customers are from the neighborhoods that surround Encarnación.

Richar wants to continue his work of making traveling sales. For this reason, he is striving to do his best. He is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the purchase of an engine for his car. This will enable him to continue making his sales so that he can keep improving each day.

loans.use: to buy an engine for the car that he uses for making sales.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 47-year-old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He does cattle fattening alongside a motorcycle transport business.

He has a business dream of buying a motor vehicle. However he is challenged by prolonged droughts that affect his cattle and the bad roads that make him spend a lot on motorcycle repairs.

Stephen needs a loan to buy cows for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy cows for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey, a divorced man, sells produce and operates a bar in Kagadi, Uganda for income generation.  He desires to grow his business into new markets and own a big produce store in town.  Despite being hard working, he is challenged by price fluctuations that affect his returns and is requesting for credit to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: buy maize to sell

loans.name: Khamisi's Group

texts.en:
Khamisi is a twenty-eight-year old Komaza tree farmer with four children, three of whom are in school. Khamisi is married and his spouse sells used clothes. In addition to growing trees, Khamisi also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas.

He decided to join Komaza to improve his family's standard of living and to help protect the environment. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to improve his family's business and to pay school fees for his children. Khamisi’s favorite part about working with Komaza is seeing the positive changes in the environment.

Khamisi is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Daniel's Group

texts.en:
Daniel is a 59-year-old Komaza tree farmer with thirteen children, three of whom are in school.  Daniel is married and his spouse is a farmer, too. In addition to growing trees, Daniel also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas. He supports his family additionally, by selling charcoal and firewood. 

He decided to join Komaza to educate his children and improve the environment and plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to to pay school fees and build a good house for his family.  Daniel’s favorite part about working with Komaza is planting trees on his farm.  Daniel is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree seedlings for his tree farm and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a hard working farmer who lives in Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is now at the age of 52, married and has 5 children. 

Her main source ofincome is rice production.  Because she wants to harvest good crops, she has requested a loan in the amount of Php 30,000.00 to buy fertilizers and pesticides. 

This opportunity given to Adelina will hopefully bring her success.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides to help have a good harvest of crops

loans.name: Ia

texts.en: Ia is 40 years old. She lives in Terjola district with her pensioner parents. As the family lives in poverty, Ia decided to start a trading business and generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $2300. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of clothes and will start trading. This will give her a chance to generate her own income and thus Ia will provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes and generate income

loans.name: Dama's Group

texts.en: Dama is a forty-five-year-old Komaza tree farmer with eight children, four of whom are in school. Dama is widowed. In addition to growing trees, Dama also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas and supports her family through burning charcoal. She decided to join Komaza because it is a long-term investment, and she plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to pay school fees and build a good house for her family. Dama’s favorite part about working with Komaza is taking care of her trees. She is the farmer with her hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Anny

texts.en: Anny is a 39-year-old hardworking single woman living in Kagadi-Uganda. She is a supplies officer who hopes to have her own residential house in spite of the challenges of low and delayed salary payments. Anny intends to use the loan to buy cement and pay for labor for the construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy cement and pay for labor for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses lives in Masindi, Uganda. He does cattle fattening and sells beef products. He started the business to be able to earn a living and sustain his family's needs. He desires to have a good standard of living. However, droughts affect his cattle, whereby they even die, due to lack of water and pastures. He needs a credit facility to buy more cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Cleophus

texts.en:
Cleophus is 25 years old and a hardworking, single man living in Kagadi, Uganda.  

He started selling produce in addition to farming to generate income to support his family. He wishes to build a residential house despite seasonal changes that bring about irregularities in his earnings. 

Cleophus is requesting a loan to buy maize and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and rice for selling.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 37-year-old married man, living in Kagadi-Uganda with his 4 children.  

He has been operating a bar and lodge since 2011 to increase on his income.  Peter hopes to grow his business despite the challenges of load shedding and a lot of competition hindering his business.  Peter is requesting a loan to buy beers to sell this festive season.

loans.use: to buy beers to sell this holiday season.

loans.name: Pasteur

texts.en:
Pasteur is a 30-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells produce such as rice, beans, maize, and groundnuts. He earns a salary and bought a grinding machine for groundnuts so as to get extra income to be able to support his family.

Pasteur faces a challenge of price fluctuation that retards his business growth and profits.

Pasteur needs a loan to buy beans, rice, and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, maize, and groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cables, cameras and batteries

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, who operates a retail shop, is a hardworking married lady living in Kagadi, Uganda.  Ruth ventured into this business after realizing that she needed a personal source of income to support her family 

She desires to grow her business despite challenges of price fluctuations and delayed payments by debtors who end up tying up her capital.  Ruth is asking for a loan to buy sugar and cooking oil for selling.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hog-raising businesswoman from Ozamiz City.  She is 55 years old, happily married with 5 adult age children.  

She has invested her time and effort into her hog raising business because she believes that money can be made in pig farming. This kind of business helped her send her children to school and complete their education. 

Arlene is requesting a loan in the amount of Php 30,000.00 to purchase bags of feed and bottles of vitamins to raise healthier hogs and to earn more. 

This financial assistance would help her continue her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of feed and vitamins in order to have healthier, quality hogs

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a hard working man living in Kagadi Uganda.  He is married with 11 children, eight of whom are in school. 

He gets his income from operating a retail shop and farming.  He is challenged by price fluctuations hindering his dream of growing his business into  a wholesale business.  

Peter is asking for credit to buy soda and beer to sell, ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell, ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sugar, salt, soap and other general merchandise for selling.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward runs a retail shop in Masindi, Uganda that sells general merchandise such as soap and sugar. He does cattle farming as a side income business. He started the business to earn a living after realizing that farming alone cannot sustain his family. Like other retailers, he is challenged by competition that has let him down. He wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and tea leaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap and tea leaves to sell.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
María de 59 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijas, dos ya se casaron y tiene hogar aparte, solo su hijo vive con ella y estudia bachillerato. Ella estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica. 

María es comerciante tiene un chalet en la escuela de la comunidad en el que vende golosinas, refrescos, bocadillos y demás, además cría ganado en su casa y en esta actividad le apoya su hijo. Solicita el préstamo para comprar una novilla que le venden y con ello aumentar el número de animales que tiene, sueña con que su hijos e gradúe de la universidad y pueda ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
María, 59 years old, is single and has 3 children. Two are already married and have homes apart. Only one son lives with her and studies in high school. She studied until the 5th grade of basic education.

María is a businesswoman. She has a house in the community school in which she sells candies, soft drinks, sandwiches, and more. Furthermore, she raises livestock in her home, and her son supports her in this activity. 

She is requesting the loan to purchase a heifer that they are selling her, and with it she will increase the number of animals that she has. She dreams of her children graduating from the university and able to practice their professions.

loans.use: to purchase a heifer.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 51 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband in Sagarejo district, Kakheti region. 

Nino works as a baker at local bakery and earns a small monthly income.  Her husband is the guard at the shop.  

Nino wants to start a business and increase her family's income. The start up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 4000 Gel to begin her business. With the received credit she will purchase cereals and will resell them at a higher price. This will increase her family's income and Nino will be able to provide better living conditions. 

She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading cereals and increase income

loans.name: Ramon Alberto

texts.es:
Ramon es un humilde trabajador residente en el municipio de Medellín con una vida colmada de sueños, esperanzas y los mejores deseos para su familia. 

Es padre de 2 hijos por los cuales siempre tuvo el valor y responsabilidad de responder para que su vida fuera la mejor.

Hoy en día se gana la vida con venta de alimentos como frituras y tinto, estos alimentos los transporta en una carretilla y los vende de manera ambulante.

De las principales dificultades que debe enfrentar en su trabajo son las fuertes lluvias y el alto costo de los insumos.

Solicita un préstamo para la ampliación de su carretilla y la compra de surtido de frituras y tinto para tener una muy buen producción en esta temporada de fin de año, así podrá tener los ingresos suficientes para continuar con su negocio y sostener a su familia.

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Ramon ¡
texts.en:
Ramon is a humble worker who resides in the municipality of Medellin with a life filled with dreams, hopes, and the greatest desires for his family.

He is the father of two children for whom he always has the courage and responsibility of responding as if his life were the best.

Today, Ramon earns his living selling fried foods and red wine. These products he transports in a tiny cart since his sales are made on the streets.

Among the principal difficulties he must confront in his work are fierce rains and the high cost of inputs.

Ramon is requesting a loan to expand his tiny cart and purchase a selection of fried foods and red wine in order to achieve very good production during this end-of-the-year season. Thus, he will be able to have sufficient income to continue with his business and sustain his family.

With the loan he is requesting, Ramon hopes to improve his life and his business.

loans.use: expand his little cart and augment his supply of fried foods and red wine to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a baking machine and materials.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Oscar tiene 59 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee desde hace 6 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, el está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Oscar is 59 years old and lives in his own home with his family. For the past 6 years he has owned a small store located in his residence. He has many customers due to his good prices and the kindness that he offers as a salesperson. He is requesting a loan to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc. so that he can have better income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Jorame

texts.en:
Jorame is a 35-year-old male, married and with three children.  He lives in Kasese, Uganda.  

Jorame offers tailoring services to the community. He has a dream of buying a business vehicle to help him in marketing his products to the people around his area.  However, he is faced with the challenge of market competition and high rental fees. 

Jorame wants money to buy material for making ladies and men's suits.

Jorame used his previous loan to buy uniform material to sell.

loans.use: to buy material for making ladies and men's suits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pipian squash seeds, compost, insecticides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson a married man aged 37 and he used the previous loan to buy cattle for resale. Alongside cattle trading, he operates a retail shop to supplement his income and has rentals in Kagadi, Uganda. Because he is hard working, he desires to grow his business despite the challenge of price fluctuations that cause reductions in his net income. Jackson intends to use credit to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Bere

texts.en:
Bere is a forty-five-year-old woman, widowed with six children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Bere has been selling salted fish for fourteen years, in order to earn a living and look after her children. She used her previous loan to buy sodas, maize flour, and fish for selling.

Bere has a dream of educating her children. However, she is faced with the challenge of limited capital and high family expenditures. Bere wants money to buy salty fish and jerrycans for selling.

loans.use: to buy salty fish and jerrycans for selling.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Ella es Sandra, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante con su familia.

Ella decidió por iniciar con un negocio de preparación y venta de bebidas y batidos nutricionales desde hace aproximadamente 2 años en un pequeño local con muchas ganas y empuje. 

Este oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica, con la necesidad y el gusto por las ventas, esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio con la ayuda de los prestadores de Kiva y la Corporación Interactuar, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar insumos para sus preparaciones como polvos nutritivos, pulpas de fruta, leche, entre otros.

Con este crédito podrá sostener su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada día más.

Es una mujer que asume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Sandra, a woman of character and good will, who wants to progress and get her family ahead.

About two years ago, Sandra decided to start a business making and selling beverages and nutritional shakes out of a small venue, with a lot of will and energy.

She learned this skill through her own trial and error, and her love of sales allowed her to gain great experience.

Now she wants to give a small boost to her business with the help of Kiva lenders and la Corporación Interactuar (“Interact Corporation”). This is why she needs a loan: to buy supplies for her preparations, such as nutritional powders, fruit pulp, and milk, among other things.

With this loan she will be able to sustain her business and grow it more every day. Sandra is a woman who takes challenges and faces them bravely.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her preparations, such as nutritional powders, fruit pulp, and milk, among other things.

loans.name: Aya

texts.en:
Aya is a 20-year-old single lady, studying to become a midwife to help those who cannot afford going to the hospital to give birth. Aya feels for those who have financial difficulties, as she and her family went through after her father passed away when she was in secondary school. But, their mother made sure that her children finish at least high school.

Aya is working hard to save as much as she can to pay for her semester fees and buy what she needs for books, but recently she decided to apply for a loan that can help her in doing so.

loans.use: to pay for her semester fees and buy what she needs for books.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ready-made women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Karisa's Group

texts.en:
Karisa is a thirty-one-year-old Komaza tree farmer. He has five children, four of whom are in school. Karisa is married and his spouse is a farmer too. In addition to growing trees, Karisa also cultivates maize, cassava and cowpeas to support his family.

He decided to join Komaza to educate his children while improving the environment. He plans to spend the money earned from the Komaza tree farm to start a business, educate his children, and build a good house. Karisa’s favorite part about working with Komaza is the training Komaza provides to tree farmers.

Karisa is the farmer with his hand raised in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase tree farm planting inputs such as seedlings, and to pay for technical training and planting support

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Triunfantes está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Olga integra este grupo, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir en un nivel medio, ella a través del esfuerzo y por medio de la venta de prendas varias que hace, está teniendo los medios suficientes para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella es una persona que se sacrifica y quiere poder salir adelante.
La Sra. Olga solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas varias, con lo cual podrá seguir con sus ventas, luchando por crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Women) is in its third loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another to get ahead. They have taken the poverty elimination survey so that all of them can put forth their best effort to grow and move forward.

Sra. Olga is a member of the group. Her latest survey indicated that she is at a Stage 2 poverty level. This means that she is at a moderate level. Through her efforts and her work of selling various types of clothes, she will be able to have sufficient means for helping her family and loved ones. Olga is a person who makes sacrifices because she wants to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes. This will allow her to continue with her sales. As a result, she can continue to grow and improve each day.

loans.use: to buy various types of clothes to sell.
